The staff was all great, especially Greg our server, the food was good and dessert was delicious. We only wish the weather had enabled us a whole evening of Mr. Keawe! We'll be back!
Good, consistent food. Very good service. Pricy compared to most Sacramento restaurants of the same tier.

column4: 8941 Elk Grove Boulevard Elk Grove, CA  95624
column13: Well done; food was flavorful and service first rate. Exceeded my expectations. Visiting my daughter in Elk Grove from Philadelphia; thought about going to Sacramento for my anniversary dinner. Happy to have found you
Great place for lunch. Food was good - a little different than the usual Honolulu lunch scene. We sat outside which got a little too warm.A new place to add to the rotation.
Buckhorn Steakhouse had the best steaks our group had ever experienced! Service was excellent. Reservation honored right on time. Very busy restaurant. Worth the hour drive!

The food was terrific as always but the service was horrible. We had reservations and requested an outdoor table, when we got there we were told a table outside was not available even though there was an empty table outside. We were sat immediately but the server did not come to our table or even acknowledge our presence for more than twenty minutes. We ordered when she finally came to our table and had bottomless mimosas along with our food. Our drinks were empty every time before we had a refill and on top of that we had to request more in order to get them refilled.
The food and service is outstanding. The best deal is the $60 dinner for two. You get salad, a pasta dish, an entree, AND dessert. There are many choices vs just one or two to choose from.
Food was great. Kitchen and bar were slow. It was a busy night though

Such an amazing experience. A friend gave us a gift certificate to chef mavro as a wedding present as we were honeymooning in Hawaii. Our experience was absolutely fantastic, the service was impeccable, the food was amazing and the wine pairings with each course were perfect. We told everyone we met on our trip about how fantastic our experience was.

I dine out quite a bit, and I can tell you that this experience will quickly be forgotten. The place has potential, but 3 of the four dishes that we tried were mediocre. The only one living up to it's potential was the burger. We were the only table in the restaurant at 9pm on a Friday night, and service was a bit on the slow side.
Food is always good here but the service is always slow.

The service was fantastic. The food took a while to get to our table. We did not mind at all as we were enjoying our conversation and wine. We were celebrating a birthday so we were given our desert on the house which I thought was very nice.

Great food and wine service by our favorite waiter Tim Hurd (a Morton's staff member for 11 years). With the purchase of Morton's by the Landry's chain of restaurants, the food is as good as it has ever been with the addition of several new seafood and side dishes. Plus, make sure you become a member of Landry's select club which gives you cash rewards based on points accumulated from dining at the various Landry's restaurants which is something that was not available previously.

The Ambiance rating of Fair comes from the fact that there was a family of 4. Mom, Dad, 3 year old boy and 5 year old boy. Both of whom acted up a little here and there. On top of that, mom and dad rolled in with a stroller and were dressed for In and Out Burger instead of a fine dining establishment. Not Morton's fault I suppose but I have been to Morton's twice and both times had this situation. Although, the first time was more acceptable. The point is that when spending the amount of money required for fine dining you don't expect to have sloppily dressed folks with squalking kids at the table next to you.
Great menu for everyone at a reasonable price

column1: Grown A Restaurant for the Community
column13: This is an established "pop up" restaurant run by experienced people using local foods and professional chefs from some very upscale local restaurants. The people are friendly, informative and accomodating. If you get a chance to sample this unique experience do not hesitate. This is not a standard tourist restaurant but a weekly event that is staged at a smaller local venue. I highly recommend it to those whose definition of good food is not limited to grilled fish or steak. Bring your own wine and be willing to share.
Large menu many choices to pick from, we had the King Arthur Supreme pizza was a very good pizza. If in area again would come back. We recommend you try it out, we are from NY so we know pizza.

First time visit was for Sunday lunch. Food was excellent even though restaurant was out of a couple of items such as bananas. As a result, we weren't able to sample the banana split. Didn't matter because everything else made up for it.Lunch was a treat without dessert. We especially liked the BLT tart and the chicken sandwich which our server recommended.Great wine selection and wide range of beers.It's a restaurant to which we are certain to return many times.
We enjoyed our dinner and wine. No complaints
The line for the sushi is long.... I wish they had more sushi makers. Food was good, but no king crab legs.

I went to the Luau with low expectations. Communal seating is not something I enjoy. Still don't. The food was actually good(all you can eat) and the open bar was a nice surprise. But the entertainment saved the night for me. The emcee/singer was fun and entertaining and the hula dancers and fire dancer were great. I probably wouldn't go to another Luau, but I think it is something you have to do once when in Hawaii.
Great food and service. Huge portions. A bit out of the way but worth the trip.

Sake was not chilled and served in awful looking glass which was not chilled eithersome of food was Ok, rest allmost not edibleNot sure where was CHEF WONG, maybe he has his fingers in lot more pies than he can really handleWill never ever go back to his restaurant, what a disppointment
Set in a neighborhood strip mall, Firebird serves authentic Russian food. The borscht was excellent as were the entrees -- a chicken stuffed ravioli and chicken.
Really enjoyed everything. Great food, great view, awesome service. We will be back.
One of my all time favorite restaurants! Have been eating here for 15 years. Consistent, reliable, interesting menu, fun atmosphere, historic building, just a great place.

column1: Ka 'Ikena Restaurant at Kapiolani Community College
column13: The appetizers, main course and dessert were excellent. The bread was delicious and service provided by the students was outstanding.

column1: SHOR American Seafood Grill at Hyatt Waikiki
column13: Especially, the seafood tower was great. If I come to Hawaii again, I have to go to SHOR.

After two visits, "inconsistent" is the take-away.Last week, we had an awesome meal with fantastic, attentive service.This week, except for the fact that we were sitting in the same space, everything was different - and not in a good way.The service was barely adequate - slow, inattentive.The food wasn't great either - including the salmon, which we had and loved the week before.The spinach salad was overdressed, making the leaves limp,and the dressing wasn't tasty - unlike that on the bistro gardens, which is very good.We used to come here a lot, and now maybe we remember why we stopped.But we will probably be back since it's a convenient option before Mondavi events.And the patio is a lovely setting.

de Vere's is a great addition to Davis' restaurant scene. The burgers and the Reubens are terrific, the home made "crisps" are so good it's hard to stop eating them and the shepherd's pie unusually tasty. Interesting and unique decor and genuine pub feel. A keeper!
Bloody Mary was far too salty - probably used "Mrs. T" mix. And was not spicy. Food was excellent except turkey & pork were dry.
One of my favorite haunts although their cajun shrimp portions was on the small side thus the reduction of a star in my rating.

column4: 100 Wailea Golf Club Dr. Wailea, HI  96753
column13: Nice, quiet atmosphere, romantic setting, eye-pleasing view and the service was impeccable. Food preparations and presentation very satisfying. All in all a place we will return to many times.

column4: 900 Front Street Suite A 101 Lahaina, HI  96761
column13: I love using OpenTable, thank you.\A little disappointed in the food.Servers were very nice.
Formaggio Grill never disappoints. The beef bourguignon if absolutely fantastic...best ever. Order the wine Wes is drinking...

Another great experience this past weekend. My wife and I have dined at Baci Bistro at least two dozen times over the past decade. One bad experience during the holidays 4 or five years ago.....every other time very good food, service and overall experience. Some of the special entrees, starters, and salads often brought to mind the great food we had on a trip to Italy in 2006....very creative dishes of seasonal fresh food.
Perfect evening with friends and relatives,the food was outstanding, and the service was first class.Went at sunset, for a perfect setting.A must try for everyone!!!
Love the Mariachi's but can be quite loud.
I had an excellent steak sandwich.
My family has been going here for decades. Consistency and quality of food and service is impeccable.
Food - awesome. Wine list - superb. View of Waikiki from our table windowside - amazing. Look on friend's faces that we took there - priceless.
Tiki's has a great menu and is located on Waikiki Beach with a great view of the sunset. What more could one ask for?

We went during the 'quiet' period just as school was starting - on Maui this is Sept/Oct -which means it's a good time for people who live on Maui to enjoy places that are usually packed with tourists! even though it was quieter than usual, it wasn't that awkward quiet of an unpopular placel, the food was terrific and the wait staff very friendly and happy. the restaurant is in a perfect spot across the street from the beach where the sunsets are always sectacular!
Very romantic, right on the beach overlooking the sunset. Had the fish trio, so good! The service was great too!
only recommend for sunset dinner

I've been going to Scott's Folsom for years. Consistently great seafood and service. Wine selection is good and the prices are reasonable. Also, the wine comes to the table chilled (56 - 60 degrees); not off of some room-temperature storage shelf.
Rachel is so great. She took great care of my family. Wonderfull wine service from robert. Taylor oh wow the best hostess in the west. Thank you so much be back this winter.

Great setting with a warm and casual feeling, yet worthy of dressing up for a special occasion. Its been my second visit and not at all disappointed with the high quality of the food. Off the beaten path, but well worth the travel. Great selection of wine. A SF/Napa quality restaurant right here in the foothills.
The quality and taste of the food continues to be excellent. This is a historic spot in downtown Sacramento and is always a great choice for a special evening with friends.

Enjoyed the "old" Gaylords so when we found out the restaurant had changed back to Gaylord's, we decided to give it a try for Sunday brunch. We weren't disappointed. In fact, we were quite pleased at the better selections, including the additional of the ala carte menu. (Be sure and try the Ahi Benedict) The brunch buffet had the usual breakfast items but the specialty areas were delightful. The addition of wonderful cheeses including Chevre and Brie and the smoked salmon was complimented by an assortment of quiches and puff pastry goodies. The fruit plate was very good. The desserts were yummy. Take your time and enjoy - especially the Koloa Rum Bread pudding.

My girlfriend and I went there for our second year anniversary,the waitress congragulated us on it. And wished us many more,the staff was great n so was the feel of the place.defiantly a good spot for romantic dates or even just a night out

I am only recommending Town because up until my last lunch there, I have had good service and the food is always great. This last time the waitress was very absent, we felt neglected. She didn't offer us water, didn't refill beverages, forgot requests, didn't ask how the food was, took forever to clear our plates and bring us the check. She didn't mess up the order and did split our check for us, but overall she was really bad. The restaurant was not busy. What could have been an amazing 1 hour lunch turned into an okay two hour lunch. I will go back because of the food, but I really hope my next server is more attentive. I worked in restaurants for twelve years, so believe me - I am generally not a complainer.
Food was fantastic! The flavors of the Mediterranean food explode in your mouth with each and every bite. Highly recommend!!!
Very sad that Grand Cafe will be moving from their current location as it has great ambiance and convenient for downtowners.

The food is always very fresh and the menu changes with the season and what is in season. The service is fantastic. I go there for lunch 1-2 times a month and can always get in and out without a reservation within my hour allotment. My husband and I meet there because of the food, but also the staff. It's a great place to watch people walk by, if you like to people watch. I highly recommend the daily spritzers! I always get them!
the sunset was beautiful great food outstanding service

This place and its staff made my anniversary unforgettable. I am in love. I am sold. I wish I could call Oahu my home. Prices are great, happy hour is the best for food. Drinks are quantity and quality.Aloha & Mahalo Hula Grill.

We were very pleased with the fresh fish. Excellent flavor and quality. My only complaint was were sitting in a corner enjoying a romantic evening and the hostess seated a birthday party of 4 ladies right behind us that we're loud even though many other sections were completely empty. Would have preferred to avoid that.

column1: High Steaks - Thunder Valley Casino Resort
column13: Not knowing the area, I was leery about selecting this restaurant for a special occasion. We were not disappointed. A family event, a party of 7, with 3 birthdays & 1 anniversary. Guests ranged from 40s to 80s; everyone was happy. One guest had a special diet and he had no trouble selecting from the menu; they even adjusted the dish if needed. When we asked if we could split/share items, they did an excellent job of serving the item already split. The sides can be shared family style. Excellent chef, fantastic presentation, food to die for, with a staff that was attentive to all our needs. We received divine desserts for the special occasions. We will definitely go back!

Our waiter was friendly and took the time to explain the menu. He could have been more attentive as we had to ask for bread and soft drink refills. Also, my husband ordered one glass of wine and was charged for two.The greens in the salad were limp and the penne arrabbiata sauce was on the sweet side (for our taste). The sausage was flavorful but the casing was tough.

I always enjoy dining at Il Fornaio since the service is generally very good and the food quality ranges from good to excellent. I find it convenient to dine here since it is easy to access and provides validated parking in the Wells Fargo bank parking structure.

Indigo has wonderful food (food was excellent when we went this week) and beautiful ambiance. Great cocktails and wine. we really love going there. We love taking out of town friends there - since there's such a good mix of local foods and asian-pacific cuisine. and it's beautiful space.

This is the 3rd time I have dined at this location , and I have dined nearly 10 times at other Melting Pot locations. This experience didn't meet up with the typical excellence experience at any location of this restaurant chain. Most of my issues are service related, as the quality and quantity of the food was very good. Even though not very busy, waiter kept doing "drive bys" of "how is everything?" without stopping to hear our answer.
First time here and we were really pleased. Only had salads but they were fresh and well presented. Will give this place another try soon.

The meal was very good. The cooking was unique. It was pretty expensive though so we would not go there often. I was disappointed that they did not have even one salad with lettuce. Overall it was a very pleasant experience.

Food was over salted and undercooked. My "medium" ribeye was crusty on the outside and red and cool on the inside. Asparagus was over done and tasteless. The bright spot was the desert which was great. Wine was outrageously priced by the glass. No view of anything. overal: overdone and overpriced. Perfect for a Trump property.

The service was very good and the wait staff was very attentive. However, the food did not live up to expectations. We went to 4 high-end restaurants during our stay in Maui and the food at Capische was easily our least favorite of the four. Also, we expect prices to be a bit higher at these types of restaurants, but $23 for a (short pour) glass of red wine was too much for my wife to take. We left immediately after eating.

My wife call it 'Oh My God' food and service.It is an awesome experience for any food and wine lover.Their wine club is second to none and wines are veryreasonably priced for the high quality you recieve. The winelist is huge and everyone knows their stuff and can pair winesbeautifully. It is a must for those who enjoy impeccableservice and true gourmet food.

The Chart House never fails to impress. The food is excellent and the service is superb. Recommend making reservations for dinner, enjoy a cocktail - get a "GuyTai" and watch the sunset. For an appetizer, the escargot are out of this world delicious. For an entree, if you love shellfish, try the Kahuku Prawns if they're available - have them prepared Chinese style. Or if you are more of a meat lover, the rack of lamb is excellent as are the steaks. Save room for the lava cake for dessert - a chocolate lover's dream...a moist dark chocolate cake with a chocolaty gooey center, and if you dine on a Friday evening, enjoy the fireworks. Truly, your night out here will be something very special and memorable.
It was an explosion of flavor in my mouth that night! The pesto fries, taco, fried chicken with bacon gravy, and bacon brownie were awesome!!!

Mulvaney's B & L is top notch with both high quality food and a high class staff! I booked a reservation for my wife and I's 8 year wedding anniversary on open table, I made a note that it was our anniversary, they put flowers on the table, printed special menus with happy anniversary and I think every member of the staff said happy anniversary to us while we were there. The food competes with "ruths chris", "scotts seafood" and any other high caliber restaurant. This place is excellent. One thing to note if you have not been here before, it was difficult to find because there is not an obvious "Mulvaneys" sign out front. Loved it and I will definitely be back.
everything was great...good food and ambiance
Great dinner and late-we ate at 9:15 PMComfortable atmosphere and excellent service

We were the only table eating lunch on a Sat in the dining room. That should have been a tip off. There were two tables upstairs on the roof deck. Arrived at 12:30 pm and didn't have our food until 1:15 pm. We felt terrible for our server James who kept apologizing for the kitchen and offering to sell us more beers. It's a train wreck lots of dollars spent on the interiors but ZERO management. With an empty dining room and a couple people in the bar watching football games, the help just stood around in a daze. I would only recommend getting drinks on the deck at sunset. Food was ok, albeit pricey. Tons of potential but we won't be back as there are way better chef owned restaurants in the area.
Very relaxing, away from crowds, left feeling like we could not wait to return.

column4: 5530 Douglas Blvd Suite #110 Granite Bay, CA  95746
column13: We came to celebrate my husband's birthday. He broght me here in December for my birthday. I thin it will become _ur"special occasion place to dine. The food has just the right portion size and the wiat staff is attentive but not intrusive. We have truly enjoyed our meals at Hawks. Carolyn Amador
Nicest teppenyaki restaurant we've ever been to! Servers addressed by our names all night. Catch of the day was light and flavorful. Pricey but worth it.

Expecting to find an extensive selection of wines by the glass and Italian fare to match, I was sorely disappointed on both accounts. The kicker was when my friend asked our server whether the Sauvignon blanc they served was on the sweeter or drier side, and she replied (no joke!), "It's a little of both. It's like a cab." Huh?!? Needless to state, my friend went with the safe Chardonnay. Sadly, both our glasses (I opted for a Grenache) tasted "old." Top it off with shoddy service, and one can assume I will not be giving Il Lupino another chance to redeem itself. It touts itself as a trattoria and wine bar; however, it is nothing more than an overpriced Waikiki facade. How unfortunate, given its prime location.

It's basically a drinking and meeting place for young singles, loud, raucous, etc. The young people seemed to be having a good time. So, it is what it is. Note, the young ones appeared to be drinking only, not eating. You don't go for the food.
Terrific brunch menu. Service was very good, and the ambience was very pleasant.
great place for awesome food! Not enough wait staff so it took too long to get our second round of drinks -- it didn't arrive till after dinner. But otherwise a fun spot with yummy food.
Very flexible with making changes to reservations. Surprised at how easy it was to change the number in our group at the last minute. Very accommodating.

This was my second visit to Mama's Fish House. My recently deceased wife loved our first visit there in 2009 and so I wanted to go there in memory of her. It was better than I remembered. I would highly recommend this to anyone going to Maul for visit.
Extraordinary cruise in an extraordinary island
I always liked Miyabi for its service and food.So even with the parking issue, I would venture out to that restaurant.

Went back to Moana for dinner after finding out it was under new ownership and wow, has it changed for the better. We ordered the half chicken with sweet and sour sauce. The skin on the chicken was crispy, meat was juicy and tender and the grilled pineapple was a nice touch. Zucchini and onion was stellar with black garlic, which I haven't had before, but not overly garlic-y. It's really hard to find a decent bourbon cocktail on this island and the bartender custom made me an delicious drink with bourbon, averna and cherries. Service was friendly and attentive and offered us pastry bites at the end of our meal, after our dessert! Prices are very reasonable. Have to check out pastry and breakfast next time.

column4: 10 Wailea Gateway Place, Unit B-201 Kihei, HI  96753
column13: I loved the convenience of making your reservations on line. I made it while enroute to Lahaina on my phone. This was our first visit to your restaurant and it sure won't be our last.
Took family out for birthday dinners. Everyone was extremely happy!! Food was excellent as always and we love his beer also!!
Always great. Good music, good food, great service. Nice location and view.
We golfed at Turtle Bay which is right there so we had lunch and dinner . Litterally sat on the beach. Beautiful spot and the food and staff were all very good. Would go back.

The only con of the night was that they now charge for parking. Having said that, it is still really reasonable at $1/hour after 4pm (9am-4pm is still free). The food is plentiful and good. I was partial to the lemongrass clams and crab legs. The primerib was overcooked that night (too bad), but there was lots of other great food. You can still buy fish food to feed the koi which the kids loved. The server was friendly and constantly changing our plates. I would definitely go back again for a buffet - the cost is very reasonable at $31 adults/$16 for kids. Make reservations for sure - there was a line waiting at the door. They are renovating for the next month and a half - I wonder what they will be doing.
Excellent food and a nice place to dine outside on a warm Kauai evening.

The sushi is amazing! My favorite is the jalapeno hamachi. Only dissapointed that the menu is limited but what they do offer they do bery well. It can be hard to have a conversation as the music is quite loud.

What a treat!! The food,wine and friendly and knowledgeable staff are exceptional. We had the opportunity to talk to Tracey who so exemplifies the caring and creative atmosphere and dishes. My party was from MI but has traveled the world. We each ordered different dishes and were all so happy with the starters, entrees and the beautiful creme brulee. A must visit for anyone who enjoys good food and fun.

We were a little disapointed in the food they serve. My husband asked for plain chicken no Balsalmic dressing or capers on the chicken & it came out with both. I had the Sheepards Pie & it was made with lamb which was very fatty.The spinach salad I had & the salad my husband had were very good.We did wait for 10 min. until a waitress came up to us. She spoke very softly but once she had our order she did check back to see if we were okay.

column4: 3909 Park Drive El Dorado Hills, CA  95762
column13: The service was very slow. The waiter said he was sorry he "forgot" our initial drinks which took so long to get. He also forgot the ravioli appetizer we ordered. We did not re-order since service was so slow. Then he forgot one of our drinks the second round.
The food was great, but they need to put in Air Conditioning, it was hot inside.

Had a very good experience. Don't see too many restaurants offering an intermezzo course. Presentation on entrees were very nice. Service was great with Carla's smile and always attentive to us. Kevin made it very special by always being there and calling us by our names.
Overall , very entertaining , would prefer larger portions verses asking for more. Service excellent , will be back. :).

Overall the restaurant is good. The menu really doesn't change very much. The restaurant has a great view of Kapalua, especially great view during sunset. The service and staff are great. We enjoyed the experience, but probably won't go back for dinner. We heard good things about brunch menu and would like to try it one day.

Our waiter was fantastic.....and what a view! the 360 degree panorama was spectaculor. Food was cooked to perfection and the quality was superb. This is the second time we've been there. Will definitely go back!
Service was a little slow at times however the server told us they were missing several help staff.
Haliimaile General Store has great cocktails & wonderful service. I like bringing my family here when they're on island to do "something a little different". Food is too expensive for the quality

Good flavors and portion sizes are fair if not large. We both ordered the carnitas which had an orange zest to it. It wasn't "crispy" as described but tasty nonetheless. Table side guacamole was good, not great. Flautas appetizer was large and very well done. Great alternative to the every day eats on the island. Service was exceptional.
Lowen gave excellent customer service. Great food. Better to reserve or will be waiting forever. The seating appeared old and torn which made it a little bit uncomfortable.
My dinning experience at Kauai Pasta was wonderful overall. Parking is a little bit of an issue at both of your locations.
Good place for breakfast!

column1: Wolfgang Puck's Spago in the Four Seasons Resort Maui (FKA Spago - Maui)
column13: What can I say? It is absolutely a wonderful but pricey experience. Service was exceptional. We had three people checking on us but not in a hovering over the shoulder way. Our main wait was great. We had a young man who was more snobbish than most of the clientele but he was tolerable and did a good job. View is and was great, though it is not a good venue for seeing the sunset. Food was outstanding. Macadamia encrusted mahi mahi is delightful. Be prepared to spend with tip about $300 for two, but it is worth it.

The owner was very accommodating. I made my reservations thru Open Table for 3:45 p.m., the earliest time available. However, when I arrived at the restaurant, I was told it did not start serving dinner until 4:30--an issue to be resolved by Open Table. The owner suggested that I order an appetizer first and my entree later since the kitchen was not quite prepared. I ended up ordering three appetizers and the excellent Bistro salad.
Excellent as always, never fails to present excellent service (thanks Jonathan for such personal service), excellent cuisine, ambiance...Love, love love, Pulehu!

Local pizza place, that has great drink specials everyday. Sandwiches and burgers are very good at a good price. Pizza is hand made and really good. $3.00 drink special varies every day and lasts all day long, but there is also a Happy Hour every day from 3:00 PM to 6:00 PM.
Excellent service, food, atmosphereWill be back to dine there again

We had the calamari piccata appetizer and both chose the Filet Wellington (perfectly medium rare) for our entres. For dessert we had the Danish berry pudding, finished tableside with rich cream. Everything was delicious! The servers were friendly and attentive and I loved the atmosphere. Definitely a special occasion restaurant for us!

Azure was memorable! Food was fantastic!! Our server Greg was beyond outstanding! If I can give 10 stars for his service, I would! He was pleasant, knew the menu and wine list and his recommendations were great! He made our birthday dinner unforgetable!
My computer has been hacked... I did NOT make the Monkey Cat reservationIt was NOT authorized by me.John French530-268-0985
Tasting menu is the way to go, everything is delicious and just the right size. Chocolate pyramid is to die for!

column1: Norio's - The Fairmont Orchid - Kohala Coast
column4: 1 North Kaniku Drive Kohala Coast, HI  96743
column13: This is without doubt one of the best restaurants in Hawaii. Absolutely excellent food and great service. It just doesn't get much better. Food is prepared perfectly, is very fresh and served at the proper temperature. We will be going back every time we are here on the Big Island.
FABULOUS divine food! EXTRAORDINARY service! Our birthday dinner w friends was SUBLIME!!! Fine dining Burgundy is one of our new fav's!!! An absolute DIAMOND in the Kapahulu dining scene!
OK but NOT up to par with expectations....

Excellent food. The Opah was cooked perfectly. All courses were absolutely excellent. Very happy with our meal. The attitute of the entire restaurant is set on making the customer happy and you don't find that too often anymore. We will be back!
Went there at last minute not too long before closing, we found out. Difficut to farily evaluate because we were the last ones in the place.

Service was adequate, food wasnt as good, but not gourmet. I enjoyed my Veal Marsala, my wifes chicken picatta was either microwaved or something, it was served lukewarm. She was disappointed for sure. we enjoyed the Bruscheta, the bread was excellent. We were looking for an upper scale eatery, this was more like a family spot for Spaghetti and Pizza. I wouldnt say dont try this place, but i wasnt overly satisfied. I may give them another try when we come back to town to go to the THUNDER VALLEY CASINO. (they did say happy birthday to my wife when we arrived, that was a nice touch)

column4: 1279 S. Kihei Rd. Ste. B -201 Kihei, HI  96753
column13: always injoy the food & the fun..we have been to several of your Dinner & Show & truly enjoyed.Service is very good...fun & helpful..when we have visitors, Stella's is part of their trip..Mahalo,BIG

Although they have a nice selection of breakfast buffet items, I had some issues: the bagels were old (even had some moldy spots), we ordered our eggs benedict medium but one of them came out hard, bacon was cooked to a crisp (I prefer mine a little softer), turkey sausage really tasted like turkey sausage, and their pineapple was sour. We did really enjoy their egg items (minus the overcooked eggs benedict). The ambiance was comfortable and relaxing. The service was awesome, very friendly and attentive. But there was one waiter (not ours) who made a rude comment when our 8 month old made a loud noise (can you really help it?). He said "That sounded like a dying cat!" out loud and caused several customers nearby to laugh. I was offended.
Check out their main course combo's.

column4: Kawaihae hbr lower level Kawaihae, HI  96743
column13: Food was great. Staff friendly and very helpful. Waiter very knowledgeable about menu and food and gave great service. Restaurant clean and cute inside. Great drink prices. Only thing missing is an outside view (in an industrial area) but the quality of food made up for it. Will visit this place again and recommend it to others.

The setting is pristine and peaceful. Sitting out on the patio with the ocean and coastal view of Kona is unmatched. The food was very good and of decent value. I just wish we had moved over to the fire pit for our after dinner coffees!

column4: 78-6831 Ali'i Dr., Ste D-125 Kailua-Kona, HI  96740
column13: Nice place to have dinner. Very friendly and attentive service and great for sushi.

Service and food were both top notch. Both the hostess and the server were friendly and very helpful. The Duo Tartare was excellent and my steak (flat iron cut) was one of the best steaks I have had in the last five years. My wife loved her fish. We had excellent cocktails and nice glasses of wine too. I was happy to finally find a place in Wailea that had a Rye for my Manhattan (or even knew what I was talking about when I asked for a Rye; a lot of blank stares elsewhere). We really appreciated this dinner;e we are from a great food city and had not managed to have a noteworthy meal in Maui during this visit until Duo (I know there are other great restaurants on Maui, we just hadn't managed to choose well this visit).
Food was wonderful, as always. Still our favorite foodie destination in Anchorage.

Late evening dinner, last to leave but not the slightest hint that we were keeping thestaff from other things. Food and wine were excellent. Service was the best of Alaskan, friendly, on time and very helpful.

column1: Ko at The Fairmont Kea Lani
column13: Amazing restaurant. Our server Hollie was wonderful and the food keeps up and surpassed the best Maui has to offer. Try the lobster tempura -- fantastic. We lived every minute of our dining experience at this noteable restaurant!
A spectacular casual dining experience. Outstanding food and service with an unbeatable view.

The food was very good but it's clear management does not prioritize daytime restaurant customers as important. There is no host/hostess during the day (1:00 on Sunday).The two servers visible were also covering the pool side food and beverage orders which requires a lot of walk time between pool clients and the kitchen so the servers were not available for the tables. If you are not a hotel guest you have to get a parking validation at the front desk (restaurant cannot validate) and after waiting at the front desk, their validation did not work so the automated gate in the parking lot wanted $18 to exit the lot. Had to walk back into the lobby to get released from the lot. Not worth the hassle for a $100 lunch.Bar drinks were excellent

column4: 9634 Fair Oaks Boulevard Fair Oaks, CA  95628
column13: We were looking for a special restaurant to celebrate our grandson's 18th birthday. He had never had French food. La Boheme fulfilled all expectations! The special items of the night -- kangaroo and elk as well as the standard appetizer of escargot made for a memorable birthday. The house wine was very good as well.
Had a great, quiet, anniversary celebration dinner.

This is the place to be for sunset in Kauai. I started with two breaded poached eggs, each with a scoop of caviar, and a side of vodka creme fraiche. Perfect yolks. I had lobster with a side of mushrooms. I am a huge fan of gourmet mushrooms and the mushroom side was pan seared Pleurotus eryngii, the king oyster or trumpet. Additionally, the appetizer soup was a butternut squash poured over some Oyster mushrooms, Pleurotus ostreatus. Decent wine selections and we enjoyed a caramelized banana cake for desert.
I am a vegetarian and they always have so many yummy options. It's my favorite breakfast place.

column4: 3750 Wailea Alanui Dr. Suite B-22 Wailea, HI  96753
column13: Great happy hour and excellent service.

Don't let appearances fool you. Yes, this restaurant is in a strip mall. Once you step inside you will feel like you are in a downtown restaurant. The difference is the owner/chef will greet you at your table and recommend menu items, describe their French beers on tap and deliver samples from the kitchen. Love a restaurant where every special sounds amazing. You will experience an amazing rack of lamb that is cooked perfectly and wishing you found this place sooner. Loved the timing of the meal--didn't feel rushed and didn't want to leave. So much so you will order dessert and will gladly wait the 8 minutes for the molten chocolate cake. All the staff were friendly and personable. Will be making another trip back soon.

Took my wife for her birthday and the service was absolutley awful. The worst that I have experienced in Fairbanks (and that's saying something), on five separate occasions during our meal one of the two of us was completely without a beverage (drink or water). The food was not horrible, but it certainly did not make up for the hideous customer service. You certainly expect better when paying $125.00 for your evening. Don't waste your time or money folks, go to the Silver Gulch instead.
I have never had better Italian food at a restruant. We always take friends there for special occasions

Nice local spot using island ingredients and making some very tasty dishes. Sat at the comfortable bar outside and still enjoyed great service. Grove Fries with crispy salami and prosciutto, along with the dipping sauces a highly recommended pupu -- neighbor at the bar also enjoyed the grilled mushrooms, they looked delicious! Live music on Wednesdays!

column4: ES Sacramento 100 Capitol Mall Sacramento, CA  95814
column13: We enjoyed every one of the Vegan Chef Challenge dishes, and will definitely be back.
We were celebrating a family birthday....food, drinks, service all great!
We enjoyed it very much. Wooden chairs could be more comfortable.
Nothing wrong with the food or beer here, everything was quite tasty.

Worst tasting food that I ever had in Mauii for $80 for lunch for three.The food is supposed to be fresh and organic, which it probably is.We had the following1 Lamb ragu. The stench of the lanb is still there. No flavor. lamb is not the type of meat to make a Ragu.2. Salad with chicken. The salad was blanched or wilted quickly. The carrots were not even pealed and had its roots. Light cinigrette dressing. No flavor. Salad is supposed to be fresh and crisp. The chicken was on a side dish boiled with just slight salt. You don't need to be a chef to do that.3. Same slad with Blackened Mahi. The fist was very fresh. Again the problem is in flavoring. Very little salt and had the horrible flavor of cumin.

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Mauna Lani, Big Island
column4: 68-1330 Mauna Lani Drive # 101 (located in KoHala Cove) Kamuela, HI  96743
column13: We had a wonderful dinner here the last nite of our stay at Mauna Lani Point. I had fish (moon fish) and my husband had the filet. Both were wonderful. The pina colada with toasted coconut was the best! We enjoyed the deserts and appreciated that we could get 1/2 portions. The service was perfect, attentive but not hovering. We arrived at the end of the sunset and sat outside. The view would have been perfect for watching it. The live music was a plus for us. This would be a terrific place for a special occassion. Price is comparable to other resort restaurants.

We were truly amazed. What a great find. I had the pork belly and my husband had a New York strip with foie gras. In Anchorage! So good, great wine selection and the service was amazing. Friendly without being intrusive. Just a wonderful dinner.

We've gone to Honu a couple of times during our trip to Maui. The food quality is pretty good and tasty. Once we went for dinner. I ordered an oyster shooter, an appetizer and an entree. I ordered the octopus as my appetizer and it was delicious and very tender. It was a very generous order. By the time I finished the octopus I was so full and could not finish my delicious entree, which was oyster sandwich. The oyster sandwich had generous portion of oysters as well. The 2nd time we were there for lunch and I had the crab sandwich, which was pretty tasty, not drenched in mayo. The bread was soaked in butter which made the whole meal very heavy and we ended up not having dinner at all.

column4: 2424 Kalakaua Ave. Third Floor Honolulu, HI  96815
column13: First; I tried Japengo because a usual Sushi spot - across the street - ended. Japengo, relative recent addition to scene (well, about a year, but I'd rarely visit/eat at Hotel, being local) a replacement? Well, perhaps for the sushi/menu, but the veritable barn/aircraft hangar type space could be easy to get lost in; The bar is somewhat uninviting at first, but eventually will probably be the place to be.Second: what's with the we-stole-the-logo-from-Hiroshi's? I'm surprised there isn't a cease-and-desist, but in fact the comparison might be valid; the menu/sensibility is much the same. However, the execution/design is not quite equivalent, but after cherry-picking items the check was surprisingly moderate.

This "rebooting" of Enotria (October, 2012) is impressive. A great deal of care seems to be devoted to the preparation and the presentations. Salads and entrees were delicious. Service was attentive and meticulous. We plan to go there again soon and show it to friends. Encore!!
Great place. A must in Kaanapali.

A neighborhood gem. The menu promises genuine heritage and that's what you get. The venison ragu was rich and full flavored, the veal melt in your mouth. The murals that adorn the walls are amazing and add to the atmosphere. The staff are welcoming, know the menu well and maintain a personable touch. Toughest decision is what to have, so many choices were tempting. Definitely one to go back to and recommend to friends.

column4: 62-100 Mauna Kea Beach Drive Kamuela, HI  96743
column13: Remarkable beachside setting, quality food selection (fresh seafood - lobster, crab, Ahi tuna, shrimp, oysters; prime rib; wide variety of desserts and salad options) , friendly service. Hard to beat the clambake for a memorable dining experience in Hawaii.
Fabulous Restaurant!! A talented chef creates this menu. I think he or she cooks it as well. What a find! They are talented with everything, even dessert!!

column4: 68-1330 Mauna Lani Drive, Suite 111 Kohala Coast, HI  96743
column13: This place has incredible flavors and excellent sashimi. Everyone recommends the tuna tataki, and for good reason. The fish itself is barely seared and sliced in a such a way that eating it is like a luxury, but then there's the ponzu-shoyu sauce! It wallops you with bright tang and makes you hungry for the rest of it, whatever it may be. We tried quite a few dishes and were pleased with the emphasis on produce and obvious care they took with them. Some of the Korean-inspired flavors were just a touch sweet for my taste, but everything is luscious and the kitchen is top notch. On a final note, the sochu fruittini with lillikoi is a girly drink that tastes like a sophisticated dream.

column1: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Roseville - The Fountains
column13: Loved the food, but we thought it was a little loud in the bar area. We also thought it was quite pricey. The wine was good, but received only 4oz. Should have been 6.
Very slow service 2+ hrs, and was not a busy night, no bread til halfway through meal.very salty lobster bisque. For 2 people spending $160 it should have been a great meal.

Celebrated Dad's 79th birthday with family and friends in the bar and for dinner. Other customers joined in to wish Dad a Happy BDay. The rib eye steaks ordered were prepared just as requested. This is a go-to place close to Elk Grove, convenient parking and always great service.
first visit. good service, good food. would revisit

good ambient and good service.food are fusion.and fish(ahi, ono shrimp,)are fresh.but It's too expensive for japanese.because some menus are asian menus."gari","wakame to kyuuri no sunomono","kimuchi",etc.in japan ,It'S izakaya menus much,and more reasonable.but in big island,most deliscious here.

I have been coming here frequently of late. As I have indicated before this is a first class dining experience with very authentic Italian food. The owner, Leonardo Fasulo is very personable and committed to a quality expetience. The food is always fresh and the pasta and all the food is homemade.

The overall experience was poor to fair. It took too long to receive our order, the pupu's, and the main dishes. The waitress checked on us once and came to refil our drinks once during the meal and once at the end when she brought us the desert menu. It appeared that the wait staff was short so it took a lot longer to be serviced. The quality of the food was fair. Our visit from the time we got there till the time we were given the check was an 1 1/2 and we only had pupu's and the main dish. We won't be visiting again any time soon.

column1: The Pineapple Room by Alan Wong
column13: Oh dear, what happened to Pineapple Room?? After years of coming here we won't be back.

Took 20 minutes to get a scratch margarita that was way too bitter. Waitress was ditzy and couldn't do more than one thing at a time. Asked for our chicken wing appetizer to be extra crispy, they looked like they were boiled. We ended up cashing out and going to another place for dinner. We won't be back!

Friday night is very nice ! You can have romantic experiences especially Friday night because you can see the fireworks,listening to moody music, and romantic scenery ! Also every food is very delicious !Before you go to there, better check the events which is holding.Have a great evening !

Best Flilet ever! It just melts in your mouth! It was "Broke Da Mouth" good! The service was excellent. They made it very special for us, we were celebrating a first anniversary, and they went above and beyond to make it super special. It was an amazing experience. Everything was so fantastic! We will dine there again and again.

column4: 900 Front Street Space A-3 Lahaina, HI  96761
column13: Excellent food, and superb service from our waiter Bob!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Kohala Coast
column13: We love Ruth Chris at the Mauna Lani. The experience is always awesome and the staff are so warm, welcoming and friendly. Great adult beverages, solid wine list and engaging bar staff. The food, particularly the steak quality is excellent every time. Kyle the GM is such a gracious host and the team is well trained in service.

Manager David, and waiters David and Joseph were outstanding in celebrating my wife's Birthday and our 2nd Anniversary. They were very attentive to our table needs. The lamb chops were deliciously seasoned and cooked to perfection. Always a pleasure dining here every 4 months on our visit to Waikiki.

The steak was as good as it gets. A bit of sticker shock but well worth it when celebrating special occasions! Food service was fast. Perhaps they could have taken longer bringing the food. Seems like we barely started sipping our wine and the appetizer came fast followed by salads and then the main courses. On Wednesdays, they offer 25% off their entire wine list. A good opportunity to branch out and try something new. Make sure you ask for a booth when you make your reservation.

column4: 1450 Ala Moana Blvd. Suite 3001 Honolulu, HI  96814
column13: One of the few restaurants at Ala Moana that takes full advantage of the beautiful beach view.

We love the view at oceanside, the fabulous healthy farm-grown food, the fresh fish prepared so beautifully ( it was Ono tonight...yum!), tasty desserts, and the wonderful wait staff. And Hawaiian music from the luau next door. Who could ask for anything better?!!
You can't go wrong it's always good food and great scenery
Pretty good food, decent prices, great service, cool upscale city vibe and awesome looking outside area
Dukes had great food and was an awesome experience for my wife and I's anniversary.

The staff was wonderful both in the dining room and at the buffet - welcoming, friendly and helpful. The buffet offered many choices - the food was good and all of the salads, poke, sushi, sashimi and fruit were very fresh. My one and only complaint was that because the restaurant does not use chafing dishes, many of the items that should have been offered hot, were only luke-warm or almost cold. In order to get something hot, you literally had to be on the buffet line when the dish is put out. Had all of the hot items been offered hot whenever you arrived at the buffet, our rating of the food would have been somewhere between very good and outstanding.

Every time we've eaten here, we've always had great experience/service. We love the calamari, but we've noticed lately that the amount of calamari on the plate has diminished. We have to order 2 now. Overall, Outstanding Service!
Amazing food. Impeccable service.

This is our favorite restaurant on Kauai. We always plan to enjoy at least several evening meals at Hukilau whenever we vist Kauai. The menu is imaginative and the food the utmost in freshness and innovation. The fish dishes are always fantastic and feature interesting combinations of textures and garnishes. We always love trying the tasting menu which features 5 courses composed of small (not really small at all)plates with an accompanying wine chosen to compliment the dish. It is a fantastic value at $40 per person and the price has remained the same for at least the last two years. What an amazing value! The setting is gorgeous and the service is always top notch. We will return on our next visit to this our favorite island.

column1: Island Breeze Luau at the King Kamehameha Hotel
column13: Great show and nice people. Bar is to far away from the seats

Our dinner at Lahaina Grill was by far our best during our 10 day visit to Maui. Unfortunately, we saved it for our last night so did not have a chance to go back...which we would have! The food was excellent. And plentiful. I had the Opakapaka fish special and it was amazing. Possibly the best fish I have ever eaten. Lahaina Grill was a wonderful dining experience with amazing food and superior service. We had the pleasure of being served by Richard who was just a delight and made our already fantastic dinner even better!

A little disappointing. The ingredients on much of the menu are mostly locally grown and seem to be healthy, but the preparation of the cooked foods were far less than healthy . Started out with the beet salad with macadamia encrusted goat cheese which was tasty and, but it went downhill from there. The burgers (one beef, one tofu) were extremely salty. The fried onion rings and sweet potato fries were very greasy. Couldn't finish eating them after trying a couple of bites of each. The waitress was very friendly, but the service was slow. We were literally the only people there for an early dinner at 6 PM and it took at least 20 minutes to receive our salad.
Top notch gourmet food in a comfortable, homey setting. Like going for dinner at your aunt's house, and your aunt is a 5 star chef.
Party of 4 with an 18 month old baby. Waitress was exceptional in seating and additional assistance.Food was delicious and beautifully presented, as always.Specials are a must try!
Excellent brunch, much quieter than most downtown spots, very enjoyable.
We were sat promptly (we actually were early) and our server was very helpful and friendly. I have eaten here many times and have always had a good experience.

column1: The Veranda at the Kahala Resort
column13: Went for the Tea Service. It was okay. Service was neglectful. The waitress was cute, but dizzy. She never refilled our water. We kept having to ask for the obvious...spoons, cream, more tea, etc. Tiny sandwiches and tiny desserts isn't really my thing. Not sure if I would recommend it.

I took my young daughters to eat prior to seeIng the musical "Shreck.". The staff treated them just great. They both felt like special guests. We ordered fish and chips for the girls and I had a salad so my rating of the food is more a reflection of that particular meal selection then the general quality of Simon & Seaforts food which is typically very good.

This is my new favorite place to go to when I'm shopping at the mall and want to get away from the busy foot traffic and just relax with some good food. I dined here solo this visit and enjoyed my favorite dish - the jidori chicken with yuzu kosho. Along with a bowl of rice and a bowl of miso soup it was so satisfying, I can't wait to go back and have the same meal all over again. Also I'm glad that my server noted that the chicken would be about a half hour wait. I had time to spare and I was craving it so I was willing to wait for it. If I had a dining companion I would have also ordered a serving of shrimp tempura, another tried and true dish from this restaurant, it would have been too much food to order it for myself.
Eating at the Kitchen Table......energetic and bubbly fun!!!!!
Took my wife here for date night and the food was excellent, wine list was very good with good suggestions from our waitress. Would strongly recommend Crush 29 to friends and will return.
Dinner was special as this was a birthday celebration. Food and service were excellent

Food was very good, using locally sourced, organic ingredients. I really enjoyed the roasted corn and quinoa soup. It was delicious. My companion had the prawns and said they were delicious, as well. We sat outside and our table happen to be located under the speakers. The music was a bit too loud for comfortable conversation. When I eat there again, I will be sure to sit further away from the speakers. Our server was polite, well-informed, and engaging, but she was slower to serve each part of the meal and deliver the check. Overall, however, our experience was very good and I will definately return.

column4: 1185 Galleria Blvd., Suite P-120 Westfield Galleria at Roseville Roseville, CA  95678
column13: Took my wife here for our second anniversary. They put rose petals on the table and wrote "Happy Anniversary" on the dessert. Service and food were both wonderful. We can't wait to go back.
Went for my birthday party with special family and friends again Rudy's hideaway did not let me down food was excellent service was great everybody was happy and helpful thanks

Took my wife there before a show. Fit the evening nicely. Good food with great presentation, attentive service and a wine list a mile long. A little on the pricey side, but not overpriced by any means.

Our family of nine went to celebrate two birthdays, the kids and adults have a GREAT time. Definitely on the list of great birthday dinner locations. The entertainment was good, the food great and the service was outstanding.

The food was average, about like strings.. but the prices too high. The family style serving was not my style but if you had a big group, that might work. The caprise salad lacked balsamic, and their broccoli dish was unseasoned. I wouldnt go back, I like my food a little "higher end" than that, especially at that price.Er had to ask for water, bread more than once and to more than one waiter since ours was way too busy.
We just love Ruth's Chris Steak House. We can't figure out why we didn't discover this gem sooner!! The filet is divine and we love the new Classics Menu!
Diverse and unique food. Great date night place. Limited wine menu. Above average service and hospitality.

column1: Sam Choy's Breakfast, Lunch, Crab & Big Aloha Brewery
column13: I had the daily lunch special, which was a sausage sandwich with onions and garlic fries and my wife had the crab cake sandwich with a salad. Neither were fantastic, but both were good enough that we finished them. Absent a coupon special, I'm not sure I would eat here again. It wasn't bad, it was just pricey and didn't stand out.
Good quality sushi and great service, exactly what we were looking for to celebrate our anniversary!
Food and service were excellent. Location is good if you are a tennis fan. The view of the sunset gets obstructed by the trees so it's not a good location for that.
Wonderful variety of Japanese food and delicious! GREAT service, too. Mahalo.
Service was great. Food was pricey for quality of entrees.

column4: 75-5799 Alii Dr, Ste. C 3 Kailua-Kona, HI  96740
column13: We enjoyed our experience and would return. We have alreadyRecommended it to others
Basically a sports bar with good food. Everything is served family style. Large portions.

column1: Son'z Maui at Swan Court - Hyatt Regency Maui
column13: Disappoint in the food but the ambiance and service were excellent.
GReat staff who knew it was our anniversary and provided complimentary sparkling wine and a photograph of the evening.
I have been many times and this time our service just wasn't as good as previous visits. Perhaps just an off night.

This place was really hopping but the staff didn't miss a beat, neither did the great band (duo, Matty something...I forget, but theywere incredible!). The food was great and the place had a good energy. Staff is awesome, particularly Stephanie. Mahalos Wahoos.

The food was not edible. The blue cheese on the steak made the steak sour, the horse radish in the potatoes made them unpalatable, and the lobster had no flavor - was not boiled in salt water. The wedge salad was good and the water was good. We will not eat there again.

column4: 320 W. 5th Avenue Fifth Avenue Mall Room C01 Anchorage, AK  99501
column13: Wonderful staff, friendly and polite. We completly emjoyed our meal.
I love sushi and this is by far the best I've ever had. The service was outstanding. All the employees seemed to take an interest in making us feel like we were special guests.
Everyone there was very helpful and nice.
We had lunch at Taormina on Saturday.Lunch Pasta was good.We had good relaxing lunch at there ,Lunch time was'nt so crowded.

Located in the family-friendly Turtle Bay Resort, this is what you'd expect from an Italian restaurant in Hawaii: Mostly Italian fare with some interesting Hawaiian twists. Average to above average quality at an excellent price, as long as you stay away from the specials. Aside from slow service (in an almost empty restaurant at 6:30pm?), the food was good (not great) and the portions were generous. Leonardo's is not an outstanding restaurant, but it is good enough to be a great value compared to typical resort prices.
The service here was so impressive that I and my wife enjoyed dinner. We will come back to eat some delicious dishes and see him again.
Not as good as in years past.Still love going hear.
Delicious food, great service !
This place was recommended by a friend who has very similar taste to mine.I really wanted to give this place a thumbs up review.

When we have a special occasion, this is the place we like to come. We enjoy the outside seating because it is more quiet. The staff is attentive; if you have a special occasion, let them know! The food has been consistently good; even if you don't like fish, there is plenty of variety. While you don't really need reservations for 'off peak days/times' you definitely need them if you plan to have dinner or brunch on a weekend. Use the online "open table"...its ez! :)

column4: 1945- G South Kihei Rd Kihei, HI  96753
column13: Very good mix of food and staff was very nice. I went back two times on a 5 day trip for the pork ribs!
Food was marginal at best. WE expected much higher qulaity for the ambience and the price. The setting is great, the service is good, but the food let us down.
Our server was delightful--Food was good but not outstanding
Escargot is my favorite. New York Steak is so Big and Delicious.

Nick's was written up in the guidebook, Maui Revealed, as one of the best restaurants in Maui. It didn't disappoint. In fact, it was probably one of the best restaurants we've ever eaten at. Service was impeccable, with multiple servers making sure our every need was attended to before we even knew we needed it. Food was delicious and beautifully presented. Wine list was excellent. Only thing that would have made it better is an ocean view: the restaurant is in the Four Seasons Hotel in Waimea, so the view is just of the resort grounds -- not shabby at all, and we did enjoy a lovely sunset.
It is a must-stop on every trip to Wailea. Great dining experience.

We arrived and they did not have our OpenTable reservation. They asked us to wait in the bar area, and never came to get us. We ended up just eating at the bar. Fries and calamari... Took very long, and the calamari was oily mush. They said they were short on cooking staff. We left and went across the street to have pizza. It was funny, because we saw a lot of other Kailua Town Pub customers eating pizza there.

AMAZING!!!! What a beautiful and special gem! A smaller outdoor dining area adds a feeling of exclusivity to the restaurant and combined with the ambient lighting, trees and beach setting it made for a perfect evening out. My friend and I have been travelling together and decided on finishing out holiday with a nice dinner out and this was just a perfect choice; it would also be very romantic for couples!! The food was absolutely beautiful; fresh, cooked perfectly and fantastic serving sizes! Neither of us could finish and the waiter was lovely enough to allow us to take the leftovers home with us too! The wait staff were all very attentive without being overbearing. I could not recommend this restaurant any more highly.

column1: Mariposa at Neiman Marcus - Ala Moana
column13: Excellent restaurant. Service was great! Food was awesome!

column4: 5121 Arctic Blvd Suite I Anchorage, AK  99503
column13: Still good food, but not as good as it used to be.
the best pizzas on Oahu. The Kiawe wood pizza oven give the crust and amazing flavor!!

This is a great restaurant and a best-kept secret, because it is the Pocket area of Sacramento. This place rivals many downtown Sacramento eating establishments in quality, service, etc. I will recommend it to many.
Food was over-rated and over-priced.
good service from Justin. Had prix fixe dinner-sweet n sour pork and sweet n sour chicken were so tender

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Wailea, Maui
column13: Great Restaurant! They have made some changes in the restaurant since our last visit. Outside dining is much improved. Removed umbrellas and put awnings which is much improved as far as the sun beating down on the customers. When we return to Maui I will definitely be there.

I can't recall ever having better service at a restaurant. I was impressed that several waiters came by, each very knowledgeable about the menu and asking us if we had any questions. We were greeted promptly upon entering and the hostess was very pleasant and gracious. It was a team effort, not just a single waiter assigned to our table. The food was unique and adventurous, very enjoyable. The menu, though prix fixe, allowed latitude. The atmosphere was quaint and romantic. A very enjoyable experience for my wife's birthday.

The website advertised a three course meal during Sacramento Restaurant Week for $15. I also called to confirm the price several days before the reservation. I was disappointed to find out from our server that the price had been misadvertised and was actually $30. Semmed conspicuously misleading and will not be forgotten.

column4: 1121 White Rock Rd El Dorado Hills, CA  95762
column13: Excellent place - waited too long to make the visit. Food is delicious and great value. Service was friendly and attentive. Was a little dark when we arrived, and they cut the lights up a little so we could order. Very quiet. Will return for sure.
What a wonderful dinner! Very nice menu selection, and the meals we had all tasted delicious. Probably the best chicken taco soup ever, and the filet mignot as well as the desserts were outstanding!

column4: 555 South Main Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Such a beautiful and unbelievably affordable tea. Unhurried, unrushed service in a gorgeous setting. What a great place to catch up with long lost friends. Highly recommend this!!!

column1: The Garden Cafe - Grand America Hotel
column4: 555 South Main Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Nice quiet lunch spot with a good menu and wine list.

column4: 8841 N. Alpine Loop Rd. Sundance, UT  84604
column13: The Founry Grill has been a favorite of our family for years. Unmatched atmosphere - really breathtaking setting year-round. And the food is fabulous. My four sisters and I share a meal together once each year at the Foundry Grill to celebrate all our birthdays. It's a perfect location for special events like this. (We visit it often in between too, because we love the place.)

column4: 8841 N. Alpine Loop Rd. Sundance, UT  84604
column13: Everything was superb! The fish was cooked perfectly, the steak done to perfection, the ambiance and location unbeatable. The service was thorough. The entire evening was just a treat!!

Apex was described as being "romantic" so we went for our anniversary. The staff couldn't have been more attentive.. Each one congratulated us, they brought us a personalized dessert .. We will definitely return for the food, service, and to hear the wonderful musician - who saved the evening from being a disaster because of the OBNOXIOUS noise level for the entire 2 1/2 hours we were there - all coming from one table of 8 people. They were having a great time, shrieking and screaming... They should be allowed to be "energetic", as described above. The restaurant has all hard surfaces, nothing to absorb sound- so go in your jeans, sit in the bar, & enjoy. Do not go for a quiet, romantic evening! Apex- PLEASE GET A RUG!

column4: 15 East South Temple 10th Floor Salt Lake City, UT  84150
column13: Got the best seats in the house, right in the middle of a large window overlooking the temple. Great food. Wonderful desserts. Very romantic. No wine or alcohol (as expected).

column4: 779 E 300 S Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: The food is always fantastic at Niche. The small plates, and specials are always stellar, and the regular menu items are excellent as well. I have never had a bad experience at Cafe Niche

column4: 122 Pierpont Ave Salt Lake City, UT  84101-1901
column13: Food wasn't very good at all. The appetizer and entrees came out so fast that it was obvious that the food was prepared in advance. We arrived, ate an appetizer and entrees, paid the bill, and were gone all in 30 minutes. The food was average. The menu wasn't accurate, and neither was the description of my dish given by the waitress. Most of the restaurants on OpenTable are a little higher end, but this one ranks below Chiles.

column4: 4000 Canyons Resort Dr. Park City, UT  84098
column13: The Farm is inconvenient to get to unless you are staying at one of the Canyons buildings at the base of the gondola (valet the car at one of the hotels, then a walk up and out to the "beach" area and down the concourse to the main door). The decor is great. The trout and port chop special were prepared and presented very well. The beet salad was bland but colorful. The service is excellent. The specialty drinks were excellent and the bottled wine list is large although mostly foreign. The by-the-glass selection of red wines is limited but there are a few good selections. We had a great meal and recommended the Farm for a great evening.

AMAZING FOOD!!! I love the meatball appetizer, but the were out of the mint this time. That dish is wonder with the mint. It is still good with out the mint but would have ordered something different had I been told that there was no mint.The Zucca Pizza was awesome as well, and the roast with mushroom sauce my wife ordered was exquisite. Always keep going back!

Very impressed overall. The food was great. The servers were gracious and the chef came out twice to check on us. The outdoor patio was very beautiful. It was such a shame that on a Friday night the place was empty before 8pm. It has to be the best place in town. Where is everybody?

column4: 260 South 1300 East Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: Our second time there and always great food and excellent service. We will definitely return. It's a great place to celebrate special occasions.

After eating at the Blue Iguana in Arrow Press square in SLC and the Red Iguana as well, which were both excellent, I was terribly disappointed with the Park City entity. The service was poor, the waitress only checked back once toward the end of our meal and the food was no where near the other branch and definitely not close to the Red. I have never had better mole than the almond at the other two and ordered the same at the Park City location and it was terrible. Never again unless it's just to sit outside eat chips with their amazingly bland salsa and drink!

column4: 67 West 100 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: We had the omakase - chef's tasting menu - for the 2nd time and it was fantastic. Chef Sunny was out of town but Eric made the experience just as delightful and delicious. The sushi is incredible and the hot dishes are an amazing treat. I don't think we would typically order hot dishes in a sushi restaurant but Chef Tosh is a genius with meat, seafood and noodles. The valet even had our car ready before we got to the curb. It was such a lovely dining night.

column1: Christopher's Steak House and Grill - Draper
column13: enjoyable night-- wine, apps,steak were very good -- dessert!?! -the strawberry shortcake was whipped cream & strawberries over a LOAF OF BREAD- not kidding . server/service was an A+

column4: 241 North Main St. Cedar City, UT  84720
column13: Delish! Food was good, Service was great. Absolutely going back!!!

column4: 423 West 300 South, Suite 150 Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: We come to town a few times a year. We always visit Dojo. The fish is fresh, the rolls are unique, and the service is good.
Not your ordinary menu. Great-tasting, creative flavors made for a superb meal!
Unique and superb appetizers. Pizzas like you will find no where else. And the desserts are wonderful.

column4: 707 E Fort Union Blvd. Midvale, UT  84047
column13: Great food. We especially enjoyed the salads. Food was hot, but a little slow in coming

column4: 454 East 300 South Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: We come here often...Major foodies ourselves....NEVER had a bad meal.Love the wait staff...Best fresh attention to detail food.

The only reason I gave Ambiance a 4 instead of a 5 was because it is a rather large space, and it felt a little empty.Classy, but just a little sparse.The food was great, the service was great, the prices were not outrageous. I hope that they are successful. I love having a nice place like this in the neighborhood.

column4: 22 East 100 South Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Martine is always a good experience for us.

column4: 935 East Fort Union Boulevard Midvale, UT  84047
column13: Celebrated daughter's birthday. Had good food, good family and good fun.

column4: 55 West 100 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: We sat out in the courtyard and it was beautiful. The food was very tasty and the server was knowledgeable about the menu items which helped me narrow down my options on what to order. The service was timely and courteous, I was able to enjoy my lunch with a friend without any unwelcome interruption and our beverages were kept full and needs were met.

column4: 48 Market Street Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: The stuffed salmon was well-seasoned and I really wish I knew the Market Street trick for making broccoli palatable. We could not have asked for better service. We frequently dine at the Market Street Broiler, which is in our neighborhood. We know we can depend on all Gastronomy restaurants for quality dining in all its aspects.

column4: 2985 East Cottonwood Park Way 6580 South Cottonwood Heights, UT  84121
column13: They must have had an off day; Sunday brunch has been good there lately.

column4: 1513 South 1500 East Salt Lake City, UT  84105
column13: The food was great and serving portions were about perfect. A little on the spendy side for Italian food, but we new that before going. Overall it was a great for our special occasion.

column4: 10720 South Holiday Park Drive 160 West Sandy, UT  84070
column13: Accommodating staff and excellent menu. Ambiance features post-and-beam decor with a large fireplace. Great place to enjoy your favorite foods.

column4: 7570 Royal Street East Park City, UT  84060
column13: Everything was awesome. Great food, service and setting. Definitely deserved those best restaurant awards.

The restaurant seems to be presented as if walking into someone's home. The service, food and decor were in keeping with that feeling. We were never rushed or made to feel that we had over stayed our welcome. The friendly staff were all willing to help each other and to answer patron's questions. Would definitely recommend.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Hotel Park City
column13: My wife and I went here for our 5th anniversary on Oct 5th 2012. I went there with high expectations because I had heard such good things and I knew the price. My expectations were far surpassed as it was the best steak and lobster I have ever had. I love good food and this is the place for good food. The service was very good as well, the server was very attentive and took care of us very well without overdoing it, he came to the table very minimal to allow us to enjoy the meal but always made sure we had everything we needed. We had the steakhouse salad, au gratin potatoes, sweet potato casserole, cheesecake, and chocolate explosion and each of them were also delicious! It is very pricy so know that going in and you will not be let down.
Excellent salad bar, by far the best in town. The restaurant has a rustic warm feel to it and live music on weekends. I would recommend the prime rib. Oh, and save room for the dessert!

We came to dinner with my in-laws for my husbands birthday. The food was fine - not great this time. Did not love the mahi mahi - such a surprise. My father in law never received the milk that he requested come with his meal. The bananas foster was delicious.
We've been to Elements numerous times and it never disappoints. Great food and service every time. Can't wait to go back.
It was a Tuesday night and there wasn't a crowd. The food and service was wonderful for our group of four particular ladies. We loved it and will go back each time we're in Park City!

column4: 244 South 1300 East Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: The waitress was seemed socially awkward, didn't seem comfortable engaging us in a conversation. The food was really good, with the exception of their cakes. We got a complimentary baklava which was amazing but the additonal desserts were not good at all. Would definitely return but not get dessert.

Actually never ate ---it was somewhat busy and they did not come to our table for about 10 minutes.. so just left. Poorly staffed that night. Would like to go again, but hesitant. Also, menu prices were really high for Thai food.

The Blind Dog is a large facility with good food and very good service. We visited on a off season weekday night and the seating spread people out too much. During slower periods, part of the facility should be closed off to create a cozier feeling. The mixed drinks were OK but not great. The food was served at a good pace and the service was attentive. The menu is extensive. The Blind Dog is worth a try on a busier day of the week.
First timers. It was a really nice place and the service was nothing short of spectacular. Excellent food and atmosphere. We will be back!

column4: 237 S 400 W Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Knowledgeable waiter who made great recommendations and wine pairings. I had a perfectly cooked steak with blue cheese macaroni. No guilt, all flavor.

column4: 370 East 900 South Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Forage is a true dining experience for anyone wishing to taste creative foods prepared and presented in unique ways. The food is consistently excellent, the atmosphere light and contemporary, and the staff is exceptionally knowledgeable.

column4: 6263 S. Holladay Blvd Salt Lake City, UT  84121
column13: Fantastic as always. This time, I ordered the Tuesday Tasting menu. It was fun to try new things.

column1: J&G Grill at The St. Regis Deer Valley
column4: 2300 Deer Valley Drive East Park City, UT  84060
column13: we were so disappointing that service was terrible this time. Long wait, wrong orders, and two young children make parents exhausted. we will sadly have to drop J&G grill from our regular restaurants list.

column4: 878 S. 900 E Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: I was not really impressed to say the least, I have nothing terribly bad to say about the food, it was ok. It was cooked well but there was more garnish on my lamb than sauce, and my gf's steak was not very tasty. I don't love writing bad reviews but we didn't get our entree for a whole hour after we sat down. My drink was left empty over 20 minutes, even after two servers, a host, and a manager had walked by and had clearly seen my empty coke. Anyone could have done it! The server was not ecstatic about food nor about being there. I had recently flown in from a work trip that my restaurant sent me out to, and I was tired and really excited about a great meal, expectation were not met. We were not even offered dessert! I'd go back, not soon

column4: 2 West St. George Blvd. #22 St. George, UT  84770
column13: We find the Painted Pony to be the best dining option in St. George. We usually go there whenever we're in town, and it never disappoints. Fun menu, good service, and really delicious food.

It may have been the time of night (8 oclock)but the ambiance of the romantic quiet ambiance of the dining room clashed with the noise coming from the piano bar. It was hard to hear sometimes the person across from you. Other than that the food and service were fantastic

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Salt Lake City
column4: 275 S. West Temple St. Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: it was very difficult for everyone to hear each other. The acoustics in the small dining room off the bar are terrible. Our waitress was fair but slightly intrusive and at the end of the meal was hard to find
