column13: Menu almost too large, with beautifully done pictures for many of the menu items. Server was very good and recommended some dishes with medium spice that were good, not too hot. Wine glasses and martini glasse were very small, thus smaller pour. Overall, very good experience. Will come back again.

column4: 3746 Sunset Drive:  PO Box 446 Spring Park, MN  55384
column13: So much potential but the food always disappoints. It is an expensive resturant that serves food that is nothing special.

The service was great however the drinks and food were pretty slow. The server let us know upfront that the bar was slammed and kitchen was running behind. I guess I found this odd for a Friday night as places are usually staffed to take care of this. The wait was worth it as the food was great.

column4: 7965 Lost Lake Rd. Lake Shore, MN  56472
column13: First off we loved the food. Can't figure out how such a great restaurant with a highly skilled chef could be tucked away in the north woods of MN. It was fantastic in every way! We had a very romantic spot overlooking the lake. The staff we very helpful, prompt, and we thoroughly enjoyed the time there for dinner.
We had amazing service! I had requested a quiet, romantic table for our anniversary and they delivered- it was perfect. Our server was fast and attentive. The food was delicious! We had a great time.
Excellent food, exceptional service and wondeful food.

The food and service are usually excellent, but I had the stir fry and it was not good. It was tastless chicken and vegatables that looked like it just had some soy sauce poured over it. All the other food is great. Just get rid of the stir fry.
Best kept secret in Downtown St. Paul for a business lunch: moderately-priced menu,good food (GREAT popovers) and friendly, personal service. AND, Macy's pays for yourparking when you dine here!!
It was a highlite of our anniversary celebration.
Love the 3 for $10 options. Lots of choices. Excellent good overall although the Tortilla soup was very salty this time. Nice location for our group of 8.
Over-priced for the value you get.
Great downtown location with amazing happy hour specials.

We went for restaurant week and thought the food was great. We especially liked the steak for the main course and the chocolate pecan fondue dessert. It wouldn't be worth paying full price, however. If you aren't sure, I would recommend trying it on restaurant week.

column4: 3906 Excelsior Blvd. St. Louis Park, MN  55416
column13: My friends and I had an excellent time. The ambiance is lovely. The staff is truly wonderful -- every single person! The food is very, very good and I love the nutritional information. They make it easy for us to "split" a menu item since let's face it, who really needs a full dinner at 9 p.m. at night? I'll be back! Thanks again, Karen and friends

The Monte Carlo has been one of our favorites. We went for Sunday brunch which begins serving at 10:00 a.m. We were promptly seated but our coffee did not get served until 10:15/10:20. At that time there was only one other couple in the restaurant. There were enough servers but for whatever reason the food was very slow getting to the table. One would expect coffee to be ready immediately. The bartender even came to our table asking us if we'd like a beverage or water while we were waiting.

This was our second visit to Morgan's. Our first visit was great. The service was good, the food was very good - overall very positive. This visit we were a little disappointed. The first table we were seated at bumped right up to the door to the kitchen (and there were plenty of empty booths). We immediately asked to be moved - that was no problem.

It has the only sake brewery outside of Japan. The food is great and my teenage children love the food and the fact that it has a foos ball table and is next to Tatters, a used clothing store. The food is unique and delicious (especially the steak). Happy hour prices are a great deal.
We loved the pizza and the kids meal options. We look forward to going back to sample more of the menu items, everything looked really good.
Can't believe Muffuletta has been around 35 years and this was our first time there. We loved it. Every aspect of the dining experience was great. We will return for sure.

Traditional style, linen table cloths and attentive staff. Food superb, extensive wine list though we stuck to the familiar Cabernet Sauvignon, which at 45 dollars was one of their cheapest but delicious none the less. Steaks were tender and full of flavour. Can't comment on deserts as we were too full to try them!

column4: 2400 Mystic Lake Blvd. NW Prior Lake, MN  55372
column13: Cant wait to have a glass of wine.

We had a lovely evening at Napa Valley Grille. Strib review this week was less than glowing, but this is a gem in the middle of the mall frenzy. Hadn't been there awhile and had forgotten how imaginative the menu is ... every course and dish for our party of four was outstanding and memorable. Ignore the uber-sophisticated Strib reviewer ... this is a great restaurant with terrific food and ambiance. Our waitress was also delightful and fun. Thank you!
Love the newsroom! Even more I love the Wine bar that I had my bday party in this year. Super fun crew and yummy food!
We will miss them. Sorry they are closing.

Food was excellent, and service to match. You feel well taken care of! The mahi-mahi was so tender and juicy with the perfect amount of relish to compliment the flavor but not overpowering. The only part of the meal we were unimpressed with was the Oceanaire Hashbrowns. They had a nice kick, but were basically just hashbrowns.
Food and entertainment right at your table....nice evening and great service.
We had a great time. We celebrated our 39th wedding anniversary Saturday night. It could not have been better. The food and service were absolutely the best!

We ordered drinks at the beginning and didn't end up receiving them until after we received our food. Also, it took a long time to get our check. It was difficult to catch any of the servers attention. They were very task oriented vs. customer service oriented.
The foos was spectacular and our service (Jenny) was awesome!
hey always do a good job here. loved the 10.00 bottle of wiine on Sunday with 2 entrees. t is very quaint.

column4: 360 St. Peter St St. Paul, MN  55102
column13: I hate to be classified as a "foodie," but Pazzaluna has fine food and sufficient variety.
This staff feels like family... From beginning to end there service is amazing, professional, and friendly

Once again, Piccolo came through in spades. My wife and I went for our anniversary, as we have leaned towards this restaurant to attend for these special occasions. I passed on the pickled pigs feet (my favorite), if only because the rotating menu always seems to have something exquisite and new to tempt me. This time I discovered Halibut cheeks with Manila clams and Portuguese blood sausage. OMG! Had a taste of my wife's Acorn Squash soup with potato gnocchi and Stilton Cheese. The waiter brought the soup out in a flask resembling a Saki server, then poured it over the gnocchi in the bowl. I was astounded as the flavors present progressively came over my taste buds one after another. If you haven't tried Picollo, you have to go!
Our Ladies night out was fun. The waitress was super positive and all was good

column4: 11900 Main Street North Maple Grove, MN  55369
column13: we don't go out to often and this was avery good experience
We've been there three times over five years. Each time we hoped it would be better. It was not. The combinations of flavors are wierd and overpowering and oversalty. We wo'nt be back.
Enjoyed the food & service. Our server was particularly good because she checked on us to see how we were doing without being intrusive...thanks.

column1: Porterhouse Steak and Seafood - Little Canada
column4: 235 East Little Canada Road Little Canada, MN  55117
column13: Went here for anniversary with the husband. Steak was literally melt in your mouth. I had the petite filet with scallops and it was delish. Only complaint was we were seated in the bar area where they have a few booths. There were some loud conversations because thats what happens in a bar area so that bugged me a little but the husband didn't complain. THat is the only reason keeping me fron giving all stars.
Awesome beer selection, amazing burgers, with a range if traditional to adventuresome offerings on the menu.

Great sushi. Service from Kelvin was very good and he was helpful in selecting items that would suit my wife's somewhat particular palate. The Playboy roll was like nothing I've ever had (served flaming in aluminum foil) and the Lotus roll was quite good. Crab cake appetizer was great as well, and not your traditional fried/breaded crab cake.
The food was spectacular. The service was fine: cordial but not overly friendly, in fact it seemed a little cold at times. Otherwise, what a great place.
We love the brunch here. The music can be a bit loud at times, but it's not unbearable. The food is great and the portions are huge.
With having a reservation, we had to wait over 25 minutes to be seated. When we were finally seated, we were next to LOUD kitchen and bar area. Will think twice about going back...
Our first time visit. Staff was eager to assist with menu questions and made us feel most welcome.
LAME, it use to be an inviting place, with lots of energy. Now it feels like Perkins, at 4:00 am. Bummer, won't be going back, again. We left after the app arrived, and went to LaGrassa!

We have always had a good experience at Rinata. This last time was the exception. We had a bad table location - in the walkway next to the kitchen and server's station, long delays in between courses, chewy pasta and slimy mussels. We smelled like smoke and grease when we left the restuarant.
wonderful staff, excellent food, great beer!

column4: 1602 West End Blvd St. Louis Park, MN  55416
column13: fairly expensive, but not really all that good.

Go to this restaurant for the food experience. For anyone that has traveled various regions of Mexico the menu variety and spices will sure to please. I tried the Pollo/Taco "Chicken" Skillet and was not disappointed. If you have a limited budget drink Mexican beer not $11 cocktails and invest in the food. The traditional desert of flan and tres leche were very different but tasty. The four person bill worked out to be about $50 each including drinks, shared appetizer, entree each and two deserts.

Very noisy after a table for 14 sat next to us. I would request seating in the main dining room. I had the beef brisket dinner ($18.95) felt the portion was small (no bigger than the sandwich) and the beef was dried out and chewy. Had a great server.

column4: 4940 N. Highway 61 White Bear Lake, MN  55110
column13: My husband and I went to Rudy's for our 44th wedding anniversary. The waitress was so congratulatory. We had excellent food and even met some relatives who happened to be there that evening. Overall a great experience. It is local to us, which is nice also.

column4: 920 2nd Avenue S., Suite 100 International Centre II Minneapolis, MN  55402
column13: As usual Ruth's did not disappoint everything was prepared perfectly. Unfortunately, they were out of the Sin cake.

Uniquely flavored Mediterranean food with some of the best service found in the twin cities. Much of the African food was unfamiliar to us and our waiter answered every question in detail. He also made an excellent wine pairing for us with our African dish and all of our dishes and drinks came out in a timely manner. We ventured out to try a new experience and ate lamb brain, but also enjoyed some standard fair, like hummus and fried cauliflower. We are foodies and will definitely return to Saffon's.
I ENJOYED MY FIRST TRIP TO EAT AT SALUT BAR AMERICAIN. I THINK EVERYTHING WAS DONE VERY WELL AND I WILL BE COMING BACK AGAIN VERY SOON THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING.

My spouse and I often have dinner at Salut Bar Americain before a Saint Paul Chamber Orchestra concert at the St. Paul UCC. The location is extremely convenient. We enjoy several different things on the menu, but we find the burgers are always fabulous.
Food was good, but my main meal came without cod in it. THey did correct this for me.

column4: 903 Washington Ave South Suite 150 Minneapolis, MN  55415
column13: I entertained friends from out of town who are the most discriminating foodies I know. They were blown away by every course that we tried, and we tried them all. They even asked for the chef to visit our table so they could thank him personally. Amazing!!
Great service. Good food. A good place to have a meal. Didn't feel rushed.

Sapor Cafe tries to be global........and every time we go-there is something new and exciting. The food always has GREAT flavor and is creative enough without being over the top! The prices are reasonable, the ambience lovely (candlelight) and the servers stay forever-so they know the wine, beer and food. This place is consistent and a true gem.
food was not very good. My Burger was salty and almost inedible. Had asked for well done french fires and they came out pale. Very expensive for a poor meal.

column4: 111 East Kellogg Blvd. Saint Paul, MN  55101
column13: Food was excellent and affordable. The pho was huge, and although really spicy, really good.

column1: Seven:  Steakhouse, Sushi Ultralounge, and Skybar
column13: Wendy is awsome,she is a great asset to SEVEN.

Food was just OK. This is first time we have been there since the ownership changed. We felt that the food had that extra flair that moved it from "good" to "outstanding" before the change. Now the food was just OK. The surroundings and service were excellent. I hope the new owners continue to improve and make a success out of it.

column4: Hilton Minneapolis 1001 Marquette Avenue Minneapolis, MN  55403
column13: We ate at Skywater because OpenTable was offering 1,000 points and it was conveniently located within walking distance of the Pantages Theatre. This is a restaurant inside the Hilton Minneapolis. Because they had a large group staying at the hotel that weekend, they were offering a buffet. My husband had salad, ham, peas with pearl onions, rice and two desserts - lemon meringue pie, and sweet potato pie. I had the ribs from their regular menu. The ribs were done well, nothing special. The best part of the meal was the sweet potato pie.

The ambiance was excellent and some of the food was delicious, particularly the tacos and the sushi rolls. One of the rolls was hard to eat because it did not hold together, though it still tasted good. The rolls were served on a platter covered with radish shavings that looked nice but his the attractiveness of the rolls themselves. The dessert was a disappointment. We had the s'more egg roll. The egg roll was tasty but the graham cracker ice cream was incredibly icy. The biggest problem we had was that the music was so loud that you had to shout to talk and the restaurant was not that crowded. Why do restaurants have to spoil the dining experience by blasting music.
Great for a date, service was very attentive, nice and classy

Enjoyed the potato salad with aji pepper sauce. Beef saltado was tasty. Prices were a bit high for what we were served. Restaurant does not have a liquor license yet so were amused by the sports bar signs. They did have Inca cola which has real sugar and tastes like Juicy Fruit gum. Server was friendly, but inexperienced. With a little training, she will improve. Will try them for dinner some time.

I go to this restaurant once a week. I love the staff (ask for Jose!) and the owner is a proud localvore. Alot of people say the portions are too small for the price- but the quality of food is exceptional. And the croque Monsieur for lunch is enormous. And frankly - you CAN order dessert here, because it is delicious, and won't break your calorie bank. I find it delightful to have food served in lovely dishes, not chunky, oversized camp ware. A bowl of soup feeds you not an army. And you will spend more time savoring and wondering what creates all those flavours instead of wondering why you don't have a quart for your serving. Note that it is also served with the rest of your meal!!!It is truly a gem, so delighted they opened for lunch.

We had extremely slow service, waited 45 minutes for our food, and the waitress spilled a drink on a member of our party. Once the food did arrive it was good, but not exceptional. This is a good restaurant to meet friends for drinks but not necessarily for the food, which is hit or miss.

column4: 6501 Wayzata Blvd St. Louis Park, MN  55426
column13: Very nice ambience. We sat near the fireplace. Lots of warm "wood" and stone effects for a casual "Country" feel.

This restaurant has the best food that I have ever found. I have had lamb all around the world, and this was the best. The hashbrown house specialty side was equally well done. Even the bread was outstanding. This eatery beats anything I have had, even in my number 2 spot, New Orleans.

column1: Stella's Fish Cafe & Prestige Oyster Bar
column13: Stella's was fabulous, as always. Food was awesome and service was great!!

Sunsets is one of our favorite places to dine on special occasions. We both were celebrating out birthdays on our last visit. Whomever we have a wait person, in the past, has always been very attentive. This time not so much. The wait person didn't pay much attention to dishes we were finished with, didn't offer to refill our bread, etc. It could have been an 'off night', because we've always felt very taken care of when we dined there in the past. It won't keep us from returning on our next special occasion.
Service is just ok. Sushi is good, but not the best in the Cities.

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu __ Minneapolis
column4: 1315 Mendota Heights Road Mendota Heights, MN  55120
column13: Gourmet dining at a bargain price. My friends had never dined at Technique and were very happy with my choice.
Could not be more pleased with the dining experience.

column4: 400 Sibley Street Suite 190 Saint Paul, MN  55101
column13: The food was excellent and our server was super friendly and helpful.
The food was amazing. The wine was wonderful. Service great. Really enjoyed it.

This was our first visit to Tria and overall we were very pleased. The only complaint I have was our seating. We were seated in a large booth and there was just two of us. In the future, I would request a table, possibly by the fireplace.
Good brunch. Nice to have live music on a Sunday afternoon.Enjoyed the live music of Jana Anderson very much.

column4: W114 Mall of America Bloomington, MN  55425
column13: Enjoyed the food and service at Tucci. Our server was very attentive.

column4: N130 Mall of America Bloomington, MN  55425
column13: We had a recent business lunch there. The food and service we very good. We will definitely be back.
We were pleasantly surprised by our recent experience here. Our server seemed to anticipate each of our needs. Very well done!!!! to be revisited.

The food was delicious, but they were out of a few things our party attempted to order. Their manager made that up to us, though.Appetizer: The guacamole is probably in my top 3 for restaurant-made guac. Pretty tasty.Entree: The walleye is just so-so. The spice didn't really seem to work too well with it.Dessert: Their ice cream sundae was AWESOME.
Love that the pasta and flatbreads change daily. Nice to have a surprise each time. Great small menu - everything sounded fantastic.

Our server was very knowledgable about the menu and was able to answer all of our questions regarding the different items. The food was okay but nothing spectacular. The chicken wings on the appetizer menu were huge and very messy and could have been a meal in themselves but were good. They have a very good happy hour and a lot of options to choose from. I would return again but will not rave about it.

column4: 4001 County Rd. 25 St. Louis Park, MN  55416
column13: Best italian food ever and there salad dressing is amazing cant leave without a bottle.
Enjoyed our dinner w/ friends. Six adults and 4 kids. Donna the server was fantastic. Everyone enjoyed the meal and the chance to chat after.

Victor's 1959 lived up to its hype! Everything was exceptional - from the atmosphere, to the service, to the food. Ah, the food... in a word "phenomenal". As a vegetarian, I'm usually limited to one or two items, but not at Victor's!

column4: ES Minneapolis 7901 34th Avenue South Bloomington, MN  55425
column13: Jesse our waiter was great! He is very personable and very attentive! He takes great pride in great service! And the food was very good!

column4: 3373 Coon Rapids Blvd Coon Rapids, MN  55433
column13: Yes and food is a great place to go for a fun night. The Comedy is entertaining while you enjoy a nice meal. It's a great place to bring a date or for a fun family dinner. I would recommend them to anyone.
Very dark and NOISY there was no way to have a conversation and hear the other person. Food was acerage but over priced.

While some of the entrees were very good, some were OK. The biggest problem is that k(new) is understaffed and service is very slow. Unfortunately, this colored the evening. We were at the restaurant for 2 1/2 hours ( it wasn't particularly busy).

All the right elements, but just off. From the entrance (no sign, kind of a doorway off the street) to the entrees (good mussels but served with burnt toast) this restaurant has the makings of a good place but not quite there. I loved it was BYOB and the service was amazing (despite seeming short staffed, you were never left waiting). Maybe it was an off night - doubt I will try again with other options to choose from.

column4: 136 N. La Salle St. Chicago, IL  60602
column13: Absolutely amazing time. The people and the food were outstanding.

We were excited to go out and try a new place. The flavor of the entrees were just bland - I had the skirt steak and my fiance had the paella. I do recommend the ceviche - this was awesome. The place is BYOB, which is what brought us in the door.

We had seen "90 Miles" on Check Please last week, and decided to try their Sunday Brunch while visiting our daughter in the City. Loved the food we had - the Cuban Pancakes and Cuban French Toast were outstanding --- as were the potatoes with chorizo. Will definately go back and try one of their other meals (probably dinner)
Delicious thai food in a quaint, comfortable setting.

The host and our waiter were very accommodating and we weren't without bottomless mimosa's the whole time! The restaurant is nice and spacious which is especially nice when dining with children. I will definitely be coming back.

This is a small place attached to the Mayne Stage Theatre. It's a pub, really, but with a little brighter atmosphere. I expected high prices and sub-par food since it's attached to a theatre, but not at all. The highlight is the Pulled Pork Nacho (also available as a sandwich). It rivals Kalua Pig from Hawaii, which is phenomenal if you've ever had it. There wasn't much on the dessert menu, and I think they should work on that because the menu is mostly small plates. The staff was courteous and quick, and the valet parking is really inexpensive and absolutely necessary in this neighborhood. Overall, a fun place to go before a show at the theatre itself.

Nearly everything that counts about Ada Street was amazing: the food, the crowd, the atmosphere, the service, the drink, etc. Be warned though that they do NOT honor reservation made through OpenTable. Both my party and a party we conversed with in the waiting area waited almost an hour for our "reserved" table. I'm surprised I didn't just leave, but glad I stayed.
Excellent meal. The risotto was one of the best dishes I've eaten in a long time. The whole experience was wonderful
Good food, good service, strong drinks. They have a lady come out and make the guacamole right in front of you - it is so awesome!! I'll be going back.
Impeccable service and delicious food.

column4: 11 N. Northwest Highway Unit 1 Park Ridge, IL  53638
column13: We were there with a small group of 7 on a Tuesday night. There was something on the menu for everyone, and we thoroughly enjoyed the magician who visited our table. It was a fun evening.

Wonderful food and service. Beautiful space and a great presentation of food. The service was attentive without being over-bearing. A great place if you want to enjoy a very good dinner and enjoy a conversation.

It was our first time to this restaurant, and after reading the reviews, I thought we would try it with our living socials coupon. Our server was attentive at first, got our drink orders and suggested things on the menu. We ordered and had our salads right away. It took another 40 minutes to get our entrees, which were good, however my husband ordered the Veal Marsala and was given Veal Limonae.The waitress never checked how our food was and must have passed our table 20 times without asking how our meal was. It took another 10 minutes to get the check. I would go back again for the food, but our service was horrific.

First the positives. Aliano's has all the appearances of a great local Italian restaurant. Nicely decorated and great lighting. The bar staff is extremely professional. Top notch. Our experience last Saturday, however, was so bad that half way into the experience we started to laugh. The service was nearly invisible. I had to walk to the bar to get drinks for the table. Our appetizers came but we had no napkins. At first we had no silverware. We were then provided knives and spoons but no forks. We thought OK the service is bad but at least the food will be good. We were a party of three. None of us finished the salad. How can you mess up a salad? The sauces used on our dinners were not home made. Overall a big disappointment

Living on the north shore - options can sometimes be limited in the northern suburbs and so when you find a keeper you tend to hold onto it. Allgauers is a keeper for us. Went on a Friday night - the rest of the table chose off of the a la carte, I rather dubiously took the seafood buffet. Whilst not cheap at $42, I was surprised by the quality - with all fish and shellfish being fresh and tastily prepared. Good to have a solid seafood choice on the north shore.
It was a pleasant surprise, it was my Birthday and the gave mea free dinner. Will go back again soon.

column4: 120 E. Delaware Street 7th Floor Chicago, IL  60611
column13: This restaurant offers a variety of seating that covers any occasion, from a private, romantic setting to a group function. The new decor and artwork installed since my last visit is most attractive and warm. Service by Kathrine was attentive, friendly and accommodating. The best part of the evening was the superb, fresh salad and entree of pan seared walleye. Not to be missed.

Had a new waitress that wasn't familiar with the menu but very nice and apologetic-Co-workers were very helpful to her. The ambiance was magnificent -dark but romantic. Plcs of Italians adorned the wall and with the Sinatra and Ella Fitzgerald music piping out made for a wonderful old world experience. the bread arrived cold w/cold butter-but good!I I chose instead an entree garden salad and it arrived cold, crisp and fresh. They allow an add on of an 8-10 oz lobster tail with an entree and it was very tasty. My choice of the shrimp scampi was not good-made with capers and a thin and runny, tasteless sauce made me yearn for a garlicky scampi. I left disappointed. A glass of very good Lambrusco totaled $35.00 so overall, it wasn't pricey.
The service was fairly inattentive, the restaurant smells like smoke, and there is paint peeling off the walls. That said, the food was really good. Good place for take out.

The food was not that great for the price paid and the server was very nice but he didn't tell us the specials. It was a ho hum experience and given the many choices you have in Chicago for food, I would not go back to Anna Maria Pasteria.
An extensive and interesting menu, delightful and interesting dishes well prepared and presented well.We expect to return.

Aqua is brand new. When we arrived there were only five other people in the restaurant/bar. We were seated immediately but waited more than five minutes for some one to come and take a drink order. We then waited another ten minutes for some one to take our food order. It took a really long time for our food to come out. We were never given or asked if we wanted water. The food was good and a good value.This could be a really great place to go and watch sports, meet friends, etc. The proximity to Loyola is great and could be a good replacement now that Hamilton's has closed. However, if they don't improve the speed of service, not sure how long it will last. I will try it again and hope the service level improves.

Started with The Roasted Rabbit Ravioli. The ravioli was good but the sause was a miss, also the portion was too small. The Smoked Mushroom Soup was a little bit too smoked for my taste buds but still good. The 7oz Filet Mignon was amazing, good flavors and perfectly cooked. Service was a solid A. Noise level was low arrived early. Street parking was easy. Great neighborhood restaurant! Prices were in line with other area restaurants. Overall B+.

I was delighted to discover the gem that is Arami. Puncuated with interesting tables which look like they've been created form real trees, and a back room which makes you feel as though you're in a cozy attic of a mountain retreat, the food is fresh and exquisite. Arami has a charm unspoiled by the pretense of other restaurants.

Good food BUT very slow coming out. I think it is because it was lunchtime. They brought out small appetizers twice because we were waiting for so long, but we were vegetarian and the free appetizers were not, so it unfortunately did not help the situation much though we appreciated the effort.
Love the naan bread.Miss the authenticity of the food.Red curry didn't taste curry enough! No coconut flavor!Branzini was good!
It made for a very enjoyable night without the baby. Food was good and spiced just right for us. We will be back.

Wonderful experience, and excellent food. The menu is wide, but not overwhelming, and everything we tried as very good. The lobster mango appetizer and asparagus spring rolls were nice beginnings, and the wine seletion was very good (more than I expected). Looking forward to being in Merrillville to get back to this place!

Atwood Cafe has an excellent seasonal menu, nice wine list and a great atmosphere. A small restaurant tucked away in the corner of a hotel lobby, it is cozy, inviting and provides a nice ambiance for the dining experience. Highly recommend this restaurant for non-tourists living in Chicago who have not tried this wonderful restaurant yet.

We enjoyed the experience. It was a special occasion and our first time to Augie's. we WILL be back. It was wonderful! The staff was very proffesional and knowledgable. Thank you very the great experience!
sat in the garden for the last time in 2012, I suspect. I always get the lentil salad, but this time tried the grilled octopus. Delicious!

I've been to this restaurant before and the food is imaginative and excellent. Their soups are absolutely wonderful. The only negative note this time was the dessert. I had a chocolate tart that tasted dense and dry. Previous desserts have been excellent, so maybe it was just a bad day for the chef.
Service slow. Food was below average. Nothing seemed fresh. Menu too large. Prices were cheap. You pay for what you get. Would not go back.

So enjoyed the smaller menu filled with hard to make choices!Love the portion size so you can feel good about having 4 courses.Would be a shame to not try several things and share as well.Authentic northern Italian cuisine.

The Sunday Supper has to be the best kept secret in Chicago. Amazing food, incredible price and each course never disappoints. In fact, you wonder how the next course could be better than the last....but it is!
was not impressed with the service
Great place for pizza in the SW suburbs!

Love the Barrington Country Bistro -- the food is fabulous, and the ambience and service is impeccable. One of the few restaurants in the northwest suburbs where holding a conversation during dinner is a pleasure instead of straining to hear and shouting.

column4: 4000 Fox Valley Center Dr Aurora, IL  60504
column13: The host and wait staff were very friendly and attentive. There is a number of delicious appetizers to choose from - the Grilled Calamari was outstanding. While the menu held typical Greek and Mediterranean entrees, there is also a number of creative (and tasty!) dishes that expand the selection. One of the specials of the evening was Autumn Pasta - creamy butternut squash ravioli served with diced, browned sweet potatoes and crumbled bacon in a cream sauce - DELICIOUS!! Everyone in our party of 6 was more than pleased with their dinners.

I was very impressed with the level of service and the quality of the food at this restaurant. Our server Chris was very professional, knowledgeable and offered recommendations off the menu. I had the Bone in NY Strip with Portabella Mushrooms and White Truffle Oil which was delicious and cooked perfectly. Being in the Hospitality Industry myself I notice the little things such as saying "pardon my reach" every time our server or busser reached across the table and our drinks and bread were constantly refilled without asking. I live in Chicago but whenever I come back to visit my family in Bloomington-Normal I will definitely visit this restaurant again. Great job and keep up the good work!

The Bedford was an experience. Food was delicious, but seemed more of a bar/drink scene than a dinner one. Would bring out of towners there as the experience to eat in or near a bank vault was fairly entertaining.

column1: Beef and Brandy Restaurant and Lounge
column13: Convenient downtown spot with good service and good prices, however the food is mediocre.

Great vibe. The food is creative and delicious. It's a great spot for a date or a group interested in sharing good food. Went on a Sunday, so I look forward to going back on a Friday or Saturday to check out the scene then too.

while this is a very expensive restaurant to go to for a family of 5 with three children, it was an enjoyable way to celebrate my son's 16th birthday and all of the kids thoroughly enjoyed the experience! Our chef was excellent and very good with my younger two!

I went there for my birthday dinner. The food was excellent, however, it was very busy so the chefs seemed a little rushed. They didn't get to do all of their usual flips and tricks. We had our picture taken together, but it came out very blurry. Overall though, it was a great night out. Especially since I wasn't the one paying! (Average meal without drinks is $30)

We arrived five minutes late for our reservation due to our friends, who were supposed to join us,who were not going to make it so it caused us to be late. We were rushed to a table, which I understand, but then the waiter hovered over us rushing us to place our drink order. We were looking forward to a quiet relaxed night and did not get that. They seated us at a table with an toddler who was whiny and was throwing food. The whole dinner took about 1 hr and 5 minutes and we felt totally rushed to leave when we finished eating. It was extremely loud in there and was just not an enjoyable dinner. Will not go there again.
not a very good value for the money....was disappointed with experience

Experience was ok, but let down by the quality of the food and drinks. Our cocktails were weak as water, yet not cheap. The Rueban was very average, too little thousand island an sauerkraut and haphazardly thrown together. Jeagersnitchzel was bland, tasted of canned mushrooms and no bacon to be found. Roasted veges were a few sad little chunks of plate filler. There are a lot of choices for dinner in Chicago, we will make different ones next time.

Our waitperson was Thai and helped us with our menu selections. Great personality.My order didn't come out right, but she was right there to take care of it.As far as atmosphere, this place is crowded and noisy - not a place I would recommend for a couples dinner out. Overall, a positive dining experience; we would probably come back.
Always a hit while visiting Chicago. Tried the Thai dishes (drowning in un-remarkable sauces) this time but prefer the big bowl plan where you choose your own veggie.

Pass. Greeted by a very grumpy set of two young hostesses. Clearly not happy and clearly not happy to see us. Segued to the bar for a drink, the Hispanic Bartender was a pro and very friendly only to be replaced by a very grumpy and non-personal female bartender.I hate bartenders that don't look at you and take your drink orders and money like a movie usher takes your ticket at the movie theater. No tip for her and she was frustrated. All and all, BB Lincolnshire will not a destination for me while in the suburbs or downtown. Much better Asian fusion in Chicago that are happy to have you. Ironically, Wildfire, another Lettuce Entertain You Lincolnshire restaurant (next door) is fantastic and the direct opposite of BB. Must be the Manager?
Great food and service. We had a party of 8 that was accommodated nicely
loved it, great food great beers
The food here is inventive and delicious. The atmosphere is wonderful.
Amazing food, amazing wine list. This place has it all!

column4: 6164 E. Riverside Blvd Loves Park, IL  61111
column13: Attended primarily for beer tasting and dinner. Generous beer samples, which there were five total, and not just once, we were allowed to re-taste, unlike the previous wine tasting, one sample and your done. :( Hor de vores that were part of the beer tasting are great, as well was dinner.
I loved this restaurant and would go back in a heart-beat

The food and customer service here is amazing. Steven the waiter knows how to treat his customers with great attentiveness and care. The food is delicious and there is no rush to kick you out. We had a 2 hour dinner and I felt like I was there for 5 which was very relaxing for our night away from kids.
The staff and their unique approach to food preparation made it a great brunch experience. Can't wait to try it for dinner!
Excellent meal...the risotto w/ duck was outstading.

Honestly, the food we enjoyed during our visit to Bistrot Zinc was better than any meal we had while in Paris. Great specials, wonderful comfort foods! We cannot wait to return. This restaurant has become our must-visit stop while in the city.

column4: 1180 W. Devon Ave Elk Grove, IL  60007
column13: We sat in the lounge and had a drink before dinner, while we thought the atmosphere was nice I thought the group that was singing was incredibly loud. The bar is nice sized but when we found it difficult to talk to one another because the music was so loud.
Portion size had a lot left to be desired.

column4: 157 Randhurst Village Dr Mount Prospect, IL  60056
column13: The pictures on the walls are amazing.The food was excellent.

Ordered the special, and it was not as described. I like a mild fish so I asked to be sure, and what I got was very like salmon which I do not like at all. No offer to make it right, nothing, and I'm not the type to make a stink. Thank goodness it was on a bed of delicious mashed potatoes!

The food is always fresh and flavorful. They have a nice selection of wine and beer. The service staff is informed and helpful. So what more could you ask for? Well, they also make some of the best pastry, cakes and desserts on the North Shore, which include vegan and gluten free options. If you enjoy sweets it's worth a visit just to try the pastry.

Glad that B&B would take reservations for our group of 12 for a special celebration.The staff and food are as good as it gets in Chicago for reasonably priced brunch.Thoroughly enjoyed our event.Hate to write this review because they might get "discovered" and it will be much more difficult to book.

We were there as a group of seven. The ambiance was great-lots of energy. The margaritas were outstanding, especially the Endless Summer. The guacamole is fresh with good texture (the avocado still chunky), but could use more zing. Chips taste homemade and arrive warm. The Steak del Fuego, was excellent, but be careful how much spice you ask for! My enchiladas were slightly dry but very flavorful. The carne asada was delicious-very tender. The service was good-the waiter knew the food and was helpful with ordering. We had a great time and would definitely go back.

My wife and I had a joint bachelor/bachelorette party at Blue Agave, and everything was perfect. Our table for 20 was set up when we walked in, and our waiter with two assistant waiters kept our glasses and chip baskets full. We had a great time and will definitely come back.

Great maki rolls and sashimi, with good creativity in the maki. Our kids love to come here to celebrate a great report card, and my 8 year old found he loves the sashimi! Service was good, very little noise. Definitely a favorite, and we'll be back soon!

Flat bread Aka Buffalo style very good when hot, crust looses something as it gets cold.Lamb burger excellent flavors & buffalo burger a bit bland. Service great wish we had more time to play z board game.

column4: 1209 N Noble Street (free parking) Chicago, IL  60642
column13: Wow! What a great find.

column4: 1636 Old Deerfield RD Highland Park, IL  60035
column13: I love this place. The owners are local residents, and are so acommodating. We frequently dine here and throughly recommend it. The facility is small, so reservations are necessary on the weekend, or you will have to wait for quite awhile. The food is consistently well prepared and delicious.
The food was outstanding with great scallops, and pork that melted in your mouth.

Great lunch spot. The Create an Entree is perfect for someone new to Indian cuisine or for someone who only likes certain ingredients. The sauces are all described in detail, which is helpful. Our group loved the hot chai tea. It was delicious.
Outstanding in every respect! If the ratings allowed an adjective even more effusively positive than "outstanding," I would use it to describe Bon Femme!
As always, great dinner and service. Specials were nice. Like the fact that they bring back specials at around the same time each year. Tuna was wonderful.
We've dined here many times and always enjoy it. The au gratin potatoes do not seem to be as good as they used to be - or perhaps mine were just overdone this time.
Lots of kids on this pumpkin carving event night. We enjoyed carving the pumpkins and eating hand made caramel apples. The apple cider hot drinks were tasty.

A Buddy and I went on Branches Mussels Nite - He's a Mussels addict- I'm also when I have the tast. I ordered the Roasted Pork Loin - that's what it was, I don't recall the the dish name- it was over flavorful grits with Broccolli florettes and pomogrante seeds. Each were great texture and taste but, the pork loin it was DRY & CHEWY & out side of the seering of the outside skin the inside had none,very Dry! I tried using the other elements (to include the pomagrante seeds) to spruce up eating the pork & it help a bit until tired of chewing. I left 2 and a half pieces of the 4 cuts displayed on the plate. I DIDN'T complain & the waittress didn't ask. I suppose because seeing what remained on my plate.

The food was just ok. My ribs were very fatty and it was hard to find good meat to eat. The pulled pork sandwich was ok but it's hard to mess up a pulled pork sandwich. The Mac and cheese was good but very rich and hard to eat as an entree. The sauces were very watered down.
Small portions a little over priced. Loud and crowded. Food was ok not great.

column4: 3734 West Irving Park Rd Chicago, IL  60641
column13: The hamburgers were very good -- juicy and flavorful, although a bit on the pricey side ($17 including fries). Cocktails were delicious. The place is visually appealing. The parking lot is definitely a plus, too.

Wait staff avoided eye contact, no offers were made to refill or refresh drinks, or check to see if everything was alright. Beer taps were not working. Very disappointing experience for a first-time visit to a restaurant that I have wanted to go to for a long time.

We came to BHT for my friends birthday brunch. The menu was filled with amazing comfort foods rich with choices. We also really enjoyed the mimosa special. The owner came to introduce himself to us and our waitress was amazing and attentive. I can't wait to go back and try it in the summer!
Good corned beef sandwich, disappointing soggy turkey burger.

A bit too noisy for what my husband and I were hoping to be a quiet, romantic evening. The food was pretty good and the staff very attentive and friendly however. I had the gorgonzola crusted filet which was very good. The roasted vegetables that came with it were perfection, and the side Caesar salad was one of the best I have ever had. My husband, while satisfied with his pasta carbonara, was extremely dissatisfied with the soup selection of the day. They have lobster bisque available daily, and their soup for the Friday we went was clam chowder. He would have liked to see another soup option that was not seafood. But overall, it was a pleasant enough experience. Our waitress was helpful and attentive, our water glasses never empty.
I had brunch, and the special gin drink was fab and refreshing! The chilaquilles was the best I've had since Mexico, thank you Bristol. Can't wait to try it now for dinner.

Nice and accommodating. Too busy of a night for our server. He had two big parties and other tables -- it seems so our service was very sloooooow. We were chatting to pass the time but I did have to say to my guests that this waiting for our order to be taken and ten to get to us was worth the wait. Almost had to stand and put on our coats in order to get our check

We had a blast at Browntrout. We went early on a Sunday night, and it seemed to be the perfect spot for lovers of great food to go if they happened to also have toddlers in tow. The band was fun and the service was extremely accommodating.

column1: Buca di Beppo - Chicago - Rush and Grand
column13: Great food and price. We had 3 appetizers, salad, bread, and 2 entrees and it was under $200 / $20 each for 9 people. We always try to eat here when in Chicago.
We had a fun time and the food was great.

column4: 15350 South 94th Avenue Place Mall Orland Park, IL  60462
column13: The hostess table seemed very unorganized. Because we had a reservation, that did not hinder us. Others waiting for a table were very irritated.The waiter was very friendly and attentive. The food was good and plentiful.
Too noisyMy husband and daugher got stomach aches after dinnerDid not have a great experience
First time, great sandwiches, good service. Affordable and good feel. We will go back.

We had a delicious Italian meal at Bueno Terra. The food was well above the average Italian fare. It has a small but vibrant atmosphere. The gal at the bar was very helpful describing the differences about the Italian wines. Our server was very helpful and just attentive enough without being obtrusive. We do not live in Logan Square, but Bueno Terra was worth the trip and we would definitely go back.

column4: 1800 W. Irving Park Road Chicago, IL  60613
column13: The food was great and flavorful. The wait staff was a little slow even though it wasn't busy when my husband and I stopped in. Dessert was delicious and the coffee was amazing. They do have a problem however; they lost their liquor license so they are BYOB. We didn't know it when we made our reservations; we were told when we got there. I understand not wanting to lose business but I would have appreciated knowing ahead of time. We ended up going to the nearby convenience store, picking up some rum and adding it to the house made virgin mojitos. I don't know how long it's been like that but I hope they get their license back soon.
Amazing food for such a small place. Staff is great and made awesome suggestions.

I have heard great things about Cafe Bionda and I was not disappointed. The food was wonderful. Nice wine selection. Paul, the owner was super nice. Everyone made you feel like you were a regular. I will be back.
marvelous restaurant. food is fantastic. good value for fixed price menu.

column4: 2777 S. Mannheim Rd Des Plaines, IL  60018
column13: Outstanding. We've been going there for more than 25 years with the same Cafe La Cave staff serving us. Marvelous. We had three groups of 8 join our group of 10 and it still felt like an intimate dinner. Staff was gracious and generous. Everyone left very, very happy.
A great spot. Very warm and friendly. Great food and wonderful wine list. Enjoyed it totally. Easy on and off from the toll road too, as we came from Wisconsin!

I have been to Marbella a few times and love the place. Great to have BYOB tapas around here. nice selection of dishes, friendly service. This time (Fri eve) it was very crowded so I was glad i made a reservation.
The food was not good at all. The guacamole was tasteless. The fish special was overly salty with blah rice and bland veggies.

This is a very solid steakhouse with very good food and service set in a nicely appointed decor.The wine list has plenty of moderately priced choices....a welcome feature from a Chicago steak joint.We would recommend this spot to anyone and we will definitely be back.
The food was amazing! Our server took care of all our needs quickly and with a smile. We were treated like VIP guests, and our experience overall was wonderful and relaxing.
We frequent this Capital Grill regularly and always find the staff friendly and helpful. This was a Dad and son night out, and they made it special for both of us. We will return!
Maybe a little more on the wine list.

This was not our first visit. In the past, we were impressed with the service and high quality of food, but not this time. It was a Sunday night, and there were lots of large parties in the restaurant, so the staff may have been unprepared. They ran out of some requested entrees/wines. The service was friendly, but slow and unapologetic.My wife's filet was dry (ordered med-rare) and unseasoned. My mahi-mahi special (a specific recommendation from our server) was tasty, but the portion size was small. I left hungry -- not something I'm used to in an Italian restaurant!
This place is a hidden gem - never overly crowded - outstanding food. Nice, casual, atmosphere.
Wines are overpriced by the food is great
Some of the best food I've ever had. This restaurant is a must in Chicago!

We had a reservation for 4 at 7PM on a Sun. When we arrived the place was full except for one 4-top near the window and room at the bar-height communal seating near the kitchen. The hostess sat us at the high table near the kitchen. When asked if we could have a the other open table she had to go check. She came back she said it would be 10 min or so while they waited for another table to finish, then they could push two 2-tops together. That set the evening off to a bad start. Five mins later we were seated at another table. Thankfully our waiter was great and the food was consistently good.

column1: Carson's Ribs Steaks and Chops - Chicago
column13: The ribs are good as is the sauce. Lots of people rave about the cole slaw, really? That is not why I go to eat ribs so the sides are of no real importance to me. These are not "fall of the bone" pork so if that is your preference, Carson's is not for you. Overall it's OK but I am in no hurry to, go back.

column1: Carson's Ribs, Steaks and Chops - Deerfield
column13: Love Carson's...food was great...service slow...
Food was very good, preperation was also good.Crab legs were fresh!
The services was very outstanding.There meal was very different and the give you a lot of it. They salads could be better .

We are new to the area, so this was our first visit to the Cellar Bistro. Our server, Anna, was fantastic. The food was delicious. The ambiance was a bit noisy as there was a large group near us. Our only complaint was the price of the food. The entrees were all in the $20-25 range. Assuming the specials were also in the same range, my husband ordered one of the specials. Only when we received our bill did we realize that the special was 50% more expensive than the most expensive item on the menu. We were quite surprised, but at that point, there was nothing that we could do but pay the bill. Our recommendation would be to post the prices of your specials so that diners aren't caught off guard like we were.
Little gem we didn't know about. LOVED IT!

Chama Gaucha has become our restaurant of choice for special occasions. The variety of aged cheeses from the salad bar and the extensive wine list are only the beginning of the steakhouse experience. What ever your taste, Rare to Well, try several of the sirloin cuts and don't forget the Flan...
Our only complaint was that they ran out of the one entree-veal-that two people in our party of four wanted to order.
Great pumpkin martini! Only had appetizers but the squash dip was excellent along with the chicken wings. Our waitress was awesome!
We had a fantastic brunch. The restaurant was not overcrowded and the staff let us chat and enjoy the meal.

Four of us dined. Only one thought the meal was outstanding. The bone-in-filet was great. I had the prime rib and it was cool to the touch and tough. The others had filets and they were fine. We split desserts and the chocolate cake reminded us of one you would get at a chain. Not the quality we would expect. Cream brulee was good. I guess there just wasn't any wow factors. We are all foodies and had higher expectations. I must say though, the iced tea was wonderful. The drinks were fun but the menu was difficult to read from. Sides were good. Overall a fair meal.

What a find! The Chicago Firehouse Restaurant was pure luck finding it online as we were in Chicago for the weekend. The food was amazing. The service was outstanding. The ambiance was great - it really is in an old fire house. The bar is small, but quaint. The bartender(s) are VERY friendly and knowledgable about the drinks as well as pointing us to other destinations for the rest of our stay in Chicago. I would highly recommend this restaurant for both locals and out of towners alike. We will definitely be going back the next time we're in Chicago.
Couldn't of found a better place with how everything went here for my special occasion.
Went for brunch, they were out of French toast at noon
Great Mexican food that you find in Mexico, not your typical US Mexican food.
The service tonight was MUCH improved over our last visit, our waiter Jason was outstanding.
An excellent quiet place to dine serving delicious food...well worth the money.
Love the funky decoration! Went here for dinner and both food and drinks were unique and good. I'd like to try this place for Happy Hour too!

Third Saturdays are beignet breakfast special days. They are outstanding along with a menu that includes breakfast offering unlike most restaurants in Chicago. Excellent service and very efficient kitchen.

column4: 505 North Lake Shore Drive (Navy Pier) Lake Point Towers Chicago, IL  60611
column13: Better dining views than The Signature Room and definitely a better deal. The atmosphere was pleasant and all of the persons from greeting to departure were very nice. FYI, parking is valet only, a deal for the location at $24 as opposed to $25 from Navy Pier without the walk.

The food was O.K., but the portion sizes were not. I ordered a vegetarian entree. It was $15 for two small pieces of cauliflower, plus some grains and a few tiny carrot pieces. My wife ordered a seafood appetizer that was more than twice the size of my entree. Good for her, bad for me. I walked away hungry. Our waitress was awful. She alternated between yelling in my ear, and mubling so neither one of us could understand her. The room is very noisy, and not particularly pleasant looking. I won't be in a hurry to return. Maybe they'll work the kinks out, or maybe they'll just fade away.
Our dinner was okay -- don't know that we would rush back.

We stumbled upon Club Lago on our way to a Bears game. As this was our first time in the place, we felt right at home, and were made to feel like regulars. The service was outstanding, the atmosphere close to perfect, and the food was very good. You feel like you've stepped into a large family dining room, where everyone knows everyone, and you're welcomed like a long time friend. The food was very good traditional Italian. We liked Club Lago so much, we went back for lunch the next day. I would recommend Chicago visitors give this resturant a try over some of the more "advertised" Italian places.

All around great restaurant. The food is awesome, the service is amazing... And all employees thank you for coming as you walk out, not just the manager or host. I've never experienced that at another restaurant.Club lucky happens to be in my neighborhood, which I love... And when I tell people where I live and use club lucky as a reference point, people say "I know where that is. I love that restaurant".

We have eaten here many times in the past, but usually for sandwiches and appetizers. The few times we have ordered dinners in the past they were not very good for the cost. This evening was different the dinners were very good and worth the cost. The complimentary dessert they gave us for our anniversary was wonderful. If it was closer to where we live we would probably eat here more often.

WE had a spectacular asparagus and truffle risotto and mussel pasta and roasted bronzing shared among the table. All thought it marvelous. The suggested pairing with a Montepulciano Abruzzo was perfect. The MD and staff were tactfully helpful to our two elderly guests who needed assistance with the access elevator and storage of their walkers. THe evening could not have been better.
Service was very slow from the time we walked in to the time we had to pay the bill. On this particular night they appeared to be under-staffed as 2 waiters were serving at least 25 people.

We went to celebrate an anniversary, we let the waitress know & she seemed so unfriendly very not happy to be working there. The other waiter attending on the other table was friendly & energetic thats what I wanted! it makes a world of difference when your waitress isn't that friendly. I don't think I'll be coming back here any time soon!

column4: Conrad Chicago 521 N. Rush St. Chicago, IL  60611
column13: Sub par. Would expect better for a high end Hilton property restaraunt.

If you love a turkey pot pie, prepared perfectly with flaky crust and a delightfully tasteful light creamy sauce base, Convito is the spot. I look foreward to sampling more of their menu in future visits.
Smart and knowledgable waitress.
The ribs had been recommended to us, and they were very good.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Chicago
column13: This was a unique and pleasant dining experiance. The food was very good, service was fast and pleasant. We are looking forward to attending the Sunday brunch.
Very varied menu and matching wines. Perfect sized portions.

column4: 345 E. Ohio Street (Entrance on Grand Ave.) Chicago, IL  60611
column13: Loved eating here. Staff super friendly and very helpful. Ate dinner with a friend who is gluten intolerant, and they did everything they could to help her (including help from the chef). My only complaint is that the food came out too fast. We were barely done with our delicious appetizer when the main course arrived, and even less done with that when dessert arrived. I should add, however, they were not rushing us out, I think just poorly timed.

Our first visit to Chicago and a local recommended this place for the best example of real Chacago deep-dish pizza. We were not disappointed! The food was great and the service was friendly and efficient. We'll be back and will recommend this place to anyone who wants great food and good service.

When you walk in the door you're greeted by the wood burning oven and a blend of slices and herbs. On the way to your table your you pass a kitchen counter that intensifies that initial blast of freshness. Once seated at your table you notice the great atmosphere, upbeat, trendy music was Playing the whole time. Its just loud enough to create the sense you are in your own dining bubble. The food comes one plate at a time, always freshlyprepared. Every bite of your meal is perfectly tailored.

column1: David Burke's Primehouse in the James Hotel
column13: The steaks and cocktails were some of the best I have had in Chicago. Based on the excellent recommendations of our server, we ordered the 55 day aged selection as well as the Kansas City 35 day aged sirloin. I also tried the Tenacity (another server suggestion) - a gin based concoction that is aged 6 weeks. On the "just ok" list: The sides of brussel spouts, mushrooms, and fries. I was not impressed with the Coconut Alaska dessert. Other than being served in a coconut shell, the coconut flavor was hidden and the cake-like substance at the bottom was hard and difficult to eat. If I return: I'm sticking with meat and alcohol. I will skip all the other course offerings.
Never been here before, but definately would go back. Food was surprisingly very good, service was excellent, and the prices very reasonable. Very much recommend this one!
We celebrated two birthdays and were treated wonderfully. THe food was outsanding--really well done, Deleece!

I went with my spouse and two children to Destihl in Champaign. We chose this restaurant because of its extensive gluten free menu -- my spouse is gluten free. We both had entree salads, which were good though smallish. I had an incredible espresso stout and my spouse had a gluten free beer which was good. My kids enjoyed the kids menu burger and flank steak. Overall, it was a very good place that I will return to during future visits to Champaign.

We dine at Distihl 3-4 times per month and it has become our favorite restaurant in Bloomington/Normal. On this occasion I had the grilled salmond (again). The presentation and the vegetables (asparagus and tomatoes) were great. My wife had the panko crusted cod (which is being added to the menu again) and she loved it. The wine list is not lengthy but all the selections we have had have been excellent. Service is always excellent. The server we had on this visit was outstanding! She explained the specials well. She was familiar with the wines we were considering. She was very willing to accomodate my request for a different sauce on my entree.

column4: 2958 W Irving Park Rd Chicago, IL  60618
column13: It is family owned and our waitor was the son of the owner. He was very friendly and helpful and accomodating: let us try several wines, split two appetizers to make one, and made recommendations for what we should order. Sadly there weren't many other tables filled but we hope it was just because of the rainy weather.

As always, the food is flavorful and prepared to perfection. The service is above and beyond and if you have any allergies, or wish to change up your meal from the menu, they encourage it! If you have not experienced Devon yet, you should definately put it on your "TO DO" list!

The fish was excellent, as usual (I have been here several times). Unfortunately, the service was not, which I guess was atypical for the restaurant. I've never thought it had amazing service, but it was at least was decent. On this night, they brought the wrong wine, the wrong side dishes multiple times, and took very long to bring drinks, too. They were just really out of sync which was a shame because the black grouper I had was perfectly cooked and delicious, and I'm pretty sure everyone else enjoyed his or her entree. I figure everyone has an off night, and I'm not opposed to giving them another chance at some point, but it may be hard to rally the troops to go back...
I love this place! I would recommend this place to anyone who likes food. I would come back here!
I had forgotten how juvinille and silly the crowd is. I felt very old and out of place. Will not be back.

I have wanted to try Dine for some time because a perusal of its menu listes some interesting items. The experience, however, was terrible. It was a Friday evening--before a very popular concert at a near-by venue. Even though we had a reservation, it was evident from the moment we walked in, that the restaurant was completely unprepared for the number of patrons who had arrived, nor was it even ready for people such as ourselves who had made reservations.
Was alright. Not really in the best of neighborhoods, but food had good flavor. Fresh guacamole seemed to lack flavor, but drinks were great. Burritos were good, nice sized portions.
Food was excellent and the service was great.

This is our comfort food place whenthe weather changes to cchilly...We have not been here since April...they really cut down on the portions and raised the prices and it was just soso...do not know if we will go back!

We always have a nice time at Domo 77. It's great for groups, and our chef on this particular visit was excellent. Plenty of menu chioces, and you won't go hungry! I recommend the garlic mushroom, very tasty.
Saturday evening guitar music added to the overall experience. Carlos' house blend port is a real treat for port lovers. Made to feel welcome and not at all rushed.
Food was really good and unique!

Overall, it was a good experience, but not great. When we got there the hostess seemed a little disorganized and it took a while to have someone come over to greet us. It was our first time at the restaurant and when we let the server know she barely had any recommendations. I'd say to definitely go-- but there are a lot of awesome sushi places around as well.

column4: Drake Chicago 140 East Walton Chicago, IL  60611
column13: We enjoyed Drake Brothes. Plenty of food and good. It's a great brunch place.
Great place! Service is absolutely wonderful, food was amazing, and drinks were so perfect!

First of all you have to realize that this is really a bar - not a restaurant. If you do that you can appreciate the worn bar decor. We were the only patrons at our lunch visit. Our server was fantastic - he recommended, advised, suggested and entertained us. It made an awkward meal in an empty restaurant lots of fun. The only tequila served is the house brand - it's good but not great. Prices are reasonable and the food is good quality. The 9-layer dip was delcious and the tacos were almost fine dining. The BBQ pork was great as was the jalapeno cole slaw. Fantastic. With a little work on decor this place would be great. We will try it again.

column4: 110 North Main Street Crystal Lake, IL  60014
column13: What first drew me to Duke's was the combination of casual dining and truly unusual food selections. Even the fries have a number of varities. I'm not a beer drinker, but for those who are, the list is massive. The service was upbeat and never lagged. The first time we tried to eat there at 6:30pm on a Friday night, we were unable to get in. Since then we've gone in around 5 with no problem. Lots of families here and the bar is separate from the dining area. Many vegetarain dishes (and many not), plus they buy local and compost.

column1: East Bank Club- Maxwell's at the Club
column13: Overall the food was your typical stock of brunch items, with nothing really special or standing out. Given how plain the price is a bit high for the quality.

The food was excellent. We had the artichoke appetizer and also the blue cheese potato chips. Both were very tasty. My husband had the wedge salad which he enjoyed very much. I had the chopped salad and really thought it was just o.k. The hash browns were good and the sauted spinach lacked taste. The filets were excellent. The coffee was a great treat. It in lauded fresh whip cream and also some chocolate mortals. That was a real nice treat!
No complaints, everything was great.
Good food, reasonably priced. Been there before, will return.

A very cozy atmosphere. This was our second visit and it delivered great food and service each time. The round table by the window offers an almost private dining experience. Enjoyed great beef appetizer with mole and our friends had the vegan "chicken" with vegetables. Traditional margarita with Grand Marnier was quite satisfying. You can't go wrong here.
Quickly becoming my favorite restaurant in Chicago :)
My wife and I enjoy Emilio's Tapas - Hillside for a change of pace, and we go out of our way to dine there. It is a great quiet spot for friends to meet at lunch.

We loved Emilio's! We came as a small group for dinner during a bachelorette party weekend. The staff was great. The food was delicious! We loved each plate. The wine list is a bit interesting--only blends, but why not step outside your comfort zone? They even had a special treat for the bachelorette. Reasonably priced. Great for a group! Thanks, Emilio's!

I enjoyed my first visit to Enoteca Roma after a dining companion recommended it for Italian fare. I enjoyed the freshly made gnocchi and other dishes including a great lakes fish dish in a lemon butter sauce with cherry tomatoes and spinach. The Polenta was also delicious we had one with sausage, mushrooms and slivers of grata. It was a tough choice as another option had caremlized onions and dried roma tomato if I recollect correctly. I wish I had looked at the dessert menu. But all in all it was nice and I plan to return. As an aside, I had not been out for Italian food in at least 3 years because I can make pasta with tomato sauce and cheese at home. This place was a far cry from the typical.

Service was excellent and the food was very good. We had a group of 8 ladies and we had a great experience. Everyone loved the energetic and lively tone in the club, but yet the restaurant area had great music and wasn't too loud at all. Great for dinner and then a fun night out.

Without a doubt Essence of India is my favorite place to go for Indian food. The service is good, the presentation is elegant and most importantly the food tastes great. This restaurant is an anchor in the Lincoln Square neighborhood.
I love this place in every way. All their seafood items are half off every Tuesday!

Food is PERFECT, wonderful, don't miss this place. The waiter asked if there was anything I didn't want in my food & I said no nuts or creams, and whatever I ordered was cooked to my request. The menu changes with the seasons; I had pumpkin soup & an appetizer of fresh vegetables cleverly cooked, my husband's steak was perfectly seasoned and prepared, my fish was well seasoned and delicious. Chocolate dessert was to die for.

column4: 128 North Oak Park Ave Oak Park, IL  60301
column13: Loved it for a girlfriends Saturday lunch. My expectations for food were kind of low but it was delish!!
Fun bar atmosphere, but music started early and very loud for any conversation. I would definitely go back, though.

Great beer list! We passed on the cheese curds for the mussels with jerky. Jerky mussels were great (the bread might've been the star), but looked longingly at every curd order that was served around us.

Arrived on time for reservation while my husband parked and was td to wait for my party even though I had a physically challenged guest with me. Very offensive policy considering the restaurant was 70 percent empty. Lousy customer service by the hostesses.

column1: Filini Restaurant and Bar-Radisson Blu Aqua Hotel
column13: We came to the Aqua building because we were misinformed by the hotel front desk that the restaurant had a view from atop the bldg. Glad we were because otherwise we might not have ever dined at Filini. We share two brunch dishes, steak & eggs and the Garganelli (Prosciutto, radicchio, mascarpone, and truffle oil). The Garganelli was outstanding and we dipped everything else in it's sauce. We weree surprised we nearly had the place to ourselves for brunch. Definitely recommend more folk check it out.

column1: Final Cut Steakhouse - Hollywood Casino Joliet
column13: We love this restaurant. Great food and great service........ what else does a restaurant need ?Oh yeah, the free appetizer from the chef is awesome too !! We'll be back !Chocolate lava cake... Yum Yum

column4: 7404 W. Madison St. Forest Park, IL  60130
column13: We thoroughly enjoyed virtually everything. The outdoor seating is some of the nicest in the FP, OP area, and the indoor seating is equally attractive. Mary, our server, was wonderful and quite funny. She anticipated our needs the entire evening. They have a very good wine list, one of the better ones I've seen in the near-west suburbs. The food was also excellent, beginning with the warm bread and oil through dessert. The grilled squid was cooked perfectly and with a slight bitterness to round it out. The risotto was some of the best I've tasted. Great red snapper, great meats. The only "average" food was the pan-fried salmon - too much breading. Bill, the owner, was also incredibly gracious. We will definitely be back!

column4: 1810 Avenue of Mid America Effingham, IL  62401
column13: Had excellent service, staff was very friendly and efficient. Food was outstanding, especially the club steak.

The staff was unbelievably rude, especially the manager. We left before we even got our food, after waiting for an hour after we ordered. When we let the manager know that we needed to get to a show he literally yelled in our faces that an hour is a normal wait time and if we needed to be somewhere we should have told them before we ordered (no, "I'm sorry it's taken so long, we will expedite it right out" or "I apologize, here is a discount to make up for our mistake). Needless to say we paid for our drinks and left. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chicago
column13: I totally enjoyed the food, the service was outstanding and the lightening was just right. It was my 50th birthday and it was the best place to have a nice dinner with friends. I felt special cause they were on top of everything. Food was outstanding. With plenty of wine and fun, I would totally go back. Very clean as well. I highly recommend this place to my friends and family.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Lincolnshire
column13: Staff was on top of things and the food was great. It's a nice addition to the area and a step up over a couple of the other steak houses around it.
Our server gave us a tour through the menu, we ate everything he recommended.
the food was exellent, service was very good too.
I love the location, its in the heart of Lincoln Square just steps from the Davis Theatre. I went with my family for brunch, I would suggest maybe a family brunch and a movie or a date.
I find the Four Farthings very reliable in service and food. Menu has improved.
Generous portion sizes of pasta meals. Always bustling.
Slow service, very loud restaurant and the menu just didn't have much cariety

column4: 75 S. La Grange Road La Grange, IL  60525
column13: We love Francesca's for our nice family dinners. Our kids (aged 10-6) love the food and the ambience. We also have had some nice dinners there with couples. The best part about it is the food - but the service is also great. Highly recommend for a nice, but not too expensive dinner.

column4: 1039 West Bryn Mawr Avenue Chicago, IL  60660
column13: Always a great time....the staff at FBM greet you with a smile and continue their wonderful service. The food is always amazing !

column4: 200 South Second Street St. Charles, IL  60174
column13: My husbands pasta dish was medium. He had a seafood pasta and said there was not much seafood and was quite dry. Probably needed more marinara sauce. I do however enjoy the Francesca restaurants. I had a fish dinner which was very good.

column4: 127 W. Main St. West Dundee, IL  60118
column13: This was my first visit to this restaurant and most likely my last. The overall experience was disappointing for these reasons:

Great meal but we were seated next to a function in a the next room, they were very loud, we were just looking for a nice dinner. We really couldn't talk/hear each other because of their loud noise. But overall the dinner, meal, service was fun, just an off night on seating.

column4: 7407 West Madison Street Forest Park, IL  60130
column13: eaten at many of the Francesca's, except for the original & the now revamped Francesca's on Chestnut, i always find a problem. food was excellent & they are more than happy to accommodate with anything you want if it isn't on the menu. i preferred something that i had at other Francesca's & they made it for me. it was delicious. waitress was a little overeager for an evening with not many diners; we told her we were doing business & would take some time; overall, she was fine and took care of our needs. problem was the heat, or should i say cold, not the food - the room was freezing. we had to ask more than once for more heat. waitress fine with that; host/mnger seemed peeved; ok to be that way, just don't show it!

More ambitious menu than I expected for this place that seems more bar than restaurant. Everything was just pretty average. Good people watching as it's on a very active intersection in Wicker Park. Could be a bit cleaner.
Great choice for a nice dinner out. Highly recommend.

column4: 293 E Illinois Rd Lake Forest, IL  60045
column13: As a gluten-intolerant lover of Italian food, this was a great pleasure with their special menu just for people like me. The rest of my family chose from the regular menu. Everyone's food was well-prepared and presented. Wine selection wasn't huge, but well-represented. Waiter was focused and professional. Memorable evening.

I thought the food was very good loved the Veal dish and great risotto. The service was a bit slow and waiter wasn't real attentive. I ordered a glass of wine with my meal but the wine came almost after my meal was done and I couldn't track down our waiter. Very disappointed as if my date and I were ignored. I have gone to Franceco's in Dundee and have always have excellent service. Waiter was more interested in the larger parties wher he assumed we wouldn't tip enough well he got his wish.
Consistent quality gluten free food, excellent service, and always a positive experience.
Overall a good place to have a great meal. Would recommend for a favorable downtown place to eat!

Francesca's was a last minute idea. We made the reservation 30 minutes prior. The service was phenomenal! Our server had great food and wine suggestions. We finished our meal with piece of tiramisu and cappucinnos.
always a pleasure to dine there.we had Frankie (Sheila)our usual server and we were very pleased with her and the help staff.

column4: 208 S. Arlington Heights Road Arlington Heights, IL  60005
column13: We had a group of 7 celebrating a birthday. Service was excellent and accommodating. Restaurant is willing to make pastas and sauce combinations not on menu. Large portions of food. Everyone had a doggie bag. Food was very tasty, however some asked for more sauce for pastaGreat experience.

column4: 12960 S. LaGrange Rd. Palos Park, IL  60464
