My wife's ribeye was cooked to perfection and I truly enjoyed the Wood Fired Shrimp, Clams & Oysters! I want to thank the team at Chef and the Farmer for a wonderfully romantic evening. For a couple of average folks, we were honored like royalty! We are definitely returning!-Brad Smith, La Grange, NC-
We love going to the Chef's Pallet. We even give gift cards to our friends from there. Always a good choice if you are looking for a special meal outside of the chain restaurants.

column4: 308 West Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Authentic and best upscale Indian restaurant in Chapel Hill. One of my favorites.

column4: 201 South Estes Drive Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: The food was terrific and inventive! Unfortunately an Open Table reservation did not seem to mean much. We had the table near the kitchen, clearly nothing "reserved " about it. Happily for the restaurant, it was slammed...unhappily this meant the kitchen had trouble to keep up. Our waiter tried hard to compensate, and the bread and delicious dip did a great deal to keep us from gnawing on him or the table....will try again under less stressful conditions.

column4: 4351-119 The Circle at North Hills Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: Fantastic lunch menu for a good price. Quick service and back to work in a flash. Good place for a business lunch.
Food was very good. We had a group of 8.Prices were very reasonable

column4: 200 N Mangum St. Suite 101 Durham, NC  27701
column13: Dos Perros has fantastic food with exceptional service.A great dining experience for our group prior to Jersey Boys @ DPAC.Make a reservation and enjoy an evening with wonderful ambience and an outstanding dinner.
Very good food for a sports bar.

column4: 454 W. Franklin St Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Very much enjoyed it overall. Service was very attentive. I thought the menu was interesting, but most of our food (she crab soup, grilled shrimp, sturgeon) was good, but not "WOW!". I don't mind a high bill if food, service, and environment are commensurate, but for our particular selections, I think the menu is overpriced. I'd be willing to give it another chance.
If you are looking for a place that has it all - atmosphere, food and service - this is it.

The food at Troy Mezza is always better than expected. Although not food I would eat every day, it is unique and a great break from the "standard fare". The wine list is good and has a great mix of affordable wines. The friends we dined with had never been to Mezza before and were a bit apprehensive at first but both really enjoyed both the food and the ambiance.
service a little slow at times but otherwise very enjoyable; also gluten-free friendly
Food average plus. Portions modest. VERY noisy. Very busy on a Sunday. Service average. Adequate, but nothing above the ordinary.
Excellence from amuse bouche to espresso. We tried the chef's tasting menu for a special celebration and every course was a delight.

We are a Navy football family and ate here back in 2010. It was a great dining experience then and on our short list for any visit to Greenville. Our 2012 dining experience was equally enjoyable and I would recommend Finnelli's without hesitation. Everyone was very friendly....even the Pirate fans! Go Navy Go Pirates.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Raleigh
column4: 4325 Glenwood Avenue #5004 - Crabtree Valley Mall Raleigh, NC  27612
column13: Had a great birthday celebration at Flemings. It is a little pricey but this time we had the best tasting filets that we ever had at Flemings. Unfortunately, our server didn't let us know ahead of time that the Lava Cake took 15 minutes to cook (other waitress's have before) so service was a bit slower than normal.

Four square was recommended to us as a "foodie" place, and it was obvious that that was what they were trying to be. They did a very good job at everything that a "foodie" place should. Ambiance, menu, service, culture, location, and romance were very much in line with what is expected. What was there and how I was treated was great, but I need to end with the following: the food was mediocre.

GREAT PLACE!!! THIS ONE HAS IT ALL!!!! Service so sweet! Food so good! Great for ANYTHING! !! We had never seen a bar-oriented place with OUTSTANDING FOOD before this. WOWOWOW!!! Looking for "somewhere good" to go at the spur of the moment, we saw this listing in Open Table. It is in our neighborhood, so we went for it. WOOOO-HOOOO!!! Were we glad we had!! Since this thing has a short character limit, I'll be brief. Everything was EXQUISITE.The cheese/meats.The soup (YUM).The hamburger??? YEAAAAA!!And then there was that scoop of rosemary/browned butter ice cream: LAY-DOWN-AND-DIE!! SO GOOD! GO TO THIS PLACE!

This restaurant would get 5 starts across the board if it weren't for the noise. I lowered my rating for ambience because of the noise. When the place is full, which it always is for dinner, it gets really loud.

The food and service were both excellent. The only oddity was that the valet took the time to remove and rearrange all the keys on my key ring. That's a little creepy. Otherwise, the restaurant was great!

column4: 1505 East Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: I treated my friend, who is a professional chef and restaurant reviewer, to a birthday lunch. She was impressed. The menu offered a variety of interesting dishes. We both chose the grilled chicken salad, and it was an elegant presentation. The pumpkin bread pudding for dessert came in a tiny iron skillet and was delcious. The wine list is extensive, but not overwhelming. Several wines are available by the glass.

column4: 327 West Davie St. Suite 102 Raleigh, NC  27601
column13: 3 of us had 3 different entrees and 2 desserts, and all were delicious. We were quite pleased to have delicious decaf coffee. Service was excellent.
Very friendly and knowledgable wait staff, food arrived quickly and was cooked perfectly.
Dinner was awesome. We were probably too early for the late-night scene, but the place was vibrant! Matt was our server, and very attentive, and very good. Loved every minute of the evening!
Our waiter provided outstanding service and our overall experience at La Volta was very good.

The service was great and the place is very nice but I'm extremely disappointed in the food. I had the poppers that were terrible. I love hot and spicy food but the poppers were not made correctly. They were barely stuffed with cheese and they were burnt. I asked the kind waitress if they made anything with sundries tomatoes for my entree and she suggested a chicken pasta. I have never eaten a piece of chicken that tasted like pure salt. There were no sun dried tomatoes in the pasta just "salsa" like tomatoes. I could make that pasta blind folded with better tasting ingredients at home. My husband got a steak. May I say that I'm very disappointed that a "grill" has no option for filets on the menu. Unfortunately outback has thicker juicier

Our second time. Very good appetizers and very creative menu, but main course needed additional seasoning. Due to a mixup, we were served our appetizers and main course simultaneously, but server was kind enough to comp us two beers.
Love the food, love the service.
It was a very nice evening. We had a great meal.

Six of us were there on a Friday night..Mantra felt more like a bar than a restaurant, and perhaps the owners agree by seemingly only staffing one server for the entire place. The service was SLOW and we could tell the server was stressed out trying to keep up with several large tables. This is in no way the service staff's fault. What makes up for that is the amazingly delicious food. It was incredible! I would go back, perhaps on a different weeknight, and just mentally prepare myself for the slow, spotty service.

We had a party of 7 and the service was great. Our server took care of us the entire night, right down to making sure no one had an empty water glass. The menu changes daily and every single thing we ordered was absolutely fantastic. Prices were reasonable and portion sizes were large enough to have leftovers to take home. We will DEFINITELY be going back, and bringing more friends!

column4: 109 W Chapel Hill St Durham, NC  27701
column13: I want to try this place again for sure: The food was fabulous. I think we hit a "quiet" night- It was election night and we went to eat there before hitting a later, louder election party.

column1: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Raleigh - Crabtree Mall
column4: 4325 Glenwood Avenue Crabtree Valley Mall - Suite 5008 Raleigh, NC  27612
column13: Very good experience will be back

Had a great time. I strongly recommend that you make reservations and don't just show up at their door step. You won't be happy. I saw four people turned away while we were there for that evening due to them not having a reservation. Dining takes about two hours from the time you enter till the time you leave. The food is very tasty and easy to work with. Our waiter (Ryan) was very helpful as we had never been there before and needed some guidance. The supporting wait staff was also very attentive. You can expect to pay something over a $100.00 for dinner for two plus tip.

If you want to go somewhere that has really good food and is good for groups and group celebrations, Mez is perfect. If you're looking for a place to eat and have a real conversation, not so much. Unfortunately we were meeting a couple we hadn't seen in 15 years, so we had a hard time having a conversation. But that's not what Mez is all about; it is vibrant and energetic and the food is really good. I must say that the hostess was really good about finding us the quietest table possible and our waitress was terrific all around. I would definitely return.

column4: 4100 Main At North Hills St Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: couldn't read the menu with the font used. Still needs some work. Food was ok Maggiano's is better food. Will try again We had a group of 8 people all felt the same about the food and menu.

The restaurant had plenty of folks at tables and at the bar but was by no means filled to capacity. Although my wife and I were only there for about an hour and fifteen minutes it seemed like we were there much longer than that. The food was good, not great, but good but the service was slower than I would have liked and the portions were not comparable to the price I paid for the meal. Truth be told, I'm not completely turned off by the place and I would go back with friends if that's where they wanted to go; I wouldn't volunteer it as my first choice though.

column4: 4121 Main at North Hills St, Ste 101 Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: Food was outstanding - fish was very fresh & beautifully prepared. Great sushi find.

This has by far, got to be the best restaraunt I'm Durham. Period. My aunt and uncle from NYC came into town to visit my husband and I and wanted to go to a restaraunt that was a little classier than the places we had originally decided to take them... I guess Tyler's taproom just didn't scratch their itch. I am so happy we decided to go there. This is now our go to restaraunt for special occasions. The food was outstanding and their wine list left nothing to be desired. Our server was excellent and very friendly and although the place was packed, the noise level was moderate, perhaps even low. Getting back to the food. I ordered the grouper (their menu changes each month) and no lie, it was the best fish I have ever had.

This was our first time there. It was a nice date night. Although the food was not great. And it was expensive for poor quality food. We had the wings. I have never seen such small over cooked with hardly any meat on them wings before. I dont think we will be going back for food anytime soon.

Excellent food and excellent service. Highly recommend this venue for a Sunday brunch and leisurely stroll through the exhibits - then head off to Duke Gardens to take in the sights there. Made for a great afternoon for us.

column4: 115 East St. James Street Tarboro, NC  27886
column13: we all had wonderful meals. Enjoyed by everyone in our party. What a real GEM ON the Square is!
Love the tapas style offerings. It does get cold if you sit near the door during a cold night. Service has always been good and the kitchen super fast.

My boyfriend and I went here on a whim, tired of eating at the same places. First off I'm a huge fan of BASS beer which is hard to find in bars around here. Not only did they have it here, but it was draft...Awesome (but expected for a british pub). I was skeptical of the french descriptions on the menu, but HOLY COW was the food great! We had the short ribs and the trout and it was way above par for "bar food." The place was pretty dead for dinner, so we moved to the bar after we ate and the bartenders were the friendliest around. There was supposed to be a live band after 1030 that night, so I may have given more stars if we'd been able to stick around that late...

First time to the Lafayette Village and first time to Paparazzi's. This was for our 4th wedding anniversary, and it was perfect! We were a little early, but we were seated and waited on with enthusiasm.and professionalism. We felt pampered and special for our special occasion, with a great recommendation for the wine and dessert. The reservation was made through OpenTable, and they noted the note I left about our anniversary and congratulated us sincerely.

This is truly a gem. It's a really good restaurant and serves good food. The waitress from Latvia though really needs to listen when diners are ordering. I asked for my Romesco sauce on the side and it came all over the plate. I should have just sent it back, but I was with a group.The desserts are good, but a little too decorated. The orange cake in itself is good it doesn't need vanilla/rasberry sauce and mounds of whipped cream to emblish it.It needs to be more simple so you can really enjoy the orange taste.

column4: 905 West Main Street - Ste 18A Durham, NC  27701
column13: Suprisingly terrific. The last time we went, it was just okay. This time was a frenetic evening (Duke parents' weekend); place was packed; we were there with 5 adults and a toddler in a high chair. Service was outstanding and very accommodating to the little person. Food was topnotch and came promptly; nice range of specials. Great Gelato for dessert...little one happy, adults happier! Overall good experience.
We had the chef's tasting menu and greatly enjoyed it. The risotto was excellent.

The Pit was a great experience! We had family visiting from MA who wanted to experience the "barbecue" experience and The Pit lived up to its' reputation. The food was excellent, plentiful and served quickly. The staff was exceptional! Prices were more than reasonable - we will definitely visit The Pit again!
It is a Chili's for rich people, but with better food.
The Porter's service is always responsive and quick, and the menu is varied enough to offer something for all taste buds.

It took some time for me and my wife to be seated. we ordered meatballs as appetizers and a lasagna and pizza as entree; food quality and flavor were very good. The place is amazing and really well put together in terms of decor, noise, etc..The bread took some time to get to the table, to the point where we had the appetizer but no bread..& when it did arrive it was a very small portion.Lasagna wasn't super hot but borderline cold. Prosciuto Pizza was delicious and tasted amazing with the Pinot Noir suggested by the waiter. We had Canoli for dessert and it was just OK, although the warm/soft version would've been better.Overall me and my wife enjoyed it, I'd definitely recommend.

We were a little concerned when we pulled up - the restaurant is in a non-descript strip mall next to an open lot. Walking in, we were greeted warmly and shown our table - the reservation was recognized and we had the place pretty much to ourselves. The beer & wine lists were expansive and reasonably priced. We shared an appetizer of the fried green tomatoes and it was agreed they were of exceptional quality, served piping hot with a spicy mustard dressing. For the main course we had the ribs, some brisket, roast chicken and the fish 'tacos' - all wer delicious although the fish tacos(not good for sharing). We closed the meal with bread pudding (delicious) and peach cobbler (doubly so) - hoping the sweet potato pie will be ready next time.

Love french food so was excited to try out a new french place (new to me). Great service. Really liked ambiance (old house). Really disappointed in the food. The bread and the dessert (profiteroles) were amazing. Didn't love the appetizer or entree. We had the escargot for an appetizer - it was tough and had no flavor. I had duck for dinner which I love. It was incredibly fatty. I know duck is a fattier meat but this was unetible. Unfortunately would not go again or recommend.
We had a group of 5 and it was perfect....It was quiet and we could talk and felt like it was private. Service was great! Loved the blue cheese dressing. Prices very reasonable.

column4: 137 E Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: Great service. The restaurant was hosting to large groups but that did not distract from them providing great service and exceptional food. Highly recommend the R&R burger and their flat bread pizzas.
My favorite. Great tasting menu.
Great and attentive service, delicious food. I will definitely go back.

column4: 6112 Falls of Neuse Rd. Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: Excellent food; wonderful service

column1: Shula's 347 Grill at the Sheraton Chapel Hill
column4: One Europa Drive Chapel Hill, NC  27517
column13: Service was excellent. Food was fantastic. This was my second time at Shula's 347 and a great experience was had both times. I'm surprised at how few patrons were there both times, this last being a Saturday evening. I think there were only 20 people dining.

Good as usually but frustrating that we had to wait over a half hour even with 9PM reservations. GM helped with some comps but it made for a long night. Still love the place and the downtown scene, but seemed to have some challenges juggling tables. May have been first cold night and people just hanging out vs. going to another location.
This was our first time dining at Solas although we had been to a rooftop party here once before.

Location was great - 3 blocks from Memorial Auditorium, and (since I don't eat sushi) - I was pleasantly surprised that my salad with teriyaki chicken was excellent! Everybody else in my group seemed to enjoy their sushi. Service was slow and miso soup mediocre.
Great food and atmosphere. Clients were impressed

column4: 456 West Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: I've never had Turkish food - was mostly pleased. All our main entrees, including kabobs and the Saturday night special lamb dish, were delicious. I did not care for the hummous, which was loaded with uncooked cumin. Service was excellent. The restaurant was loud and tables are very close together. Overall, I would return, but maybe for lunch.

column4: 107 Edinburgh Drive South Suite 129 Cary, NC  27511
column13: Wonderful fried oysters! Not to be missed. Everything else (shrimp, tiny bay scallops, veggie sides, lobster) only acceptable--not memorable. Excellent server-- added a free dessert with candle for my birthday.
great burger, good service, pleasant evening, knew tgere were many TV's, but certainly did not go for them,
The pasta fiocchi is to die for!
They give us the best Upstairs-Balcony seats in the house as we made our reservations via OpenTable. WOW.

Used online reservation, but no one was aware of reservation and table was, therefore, not ready. When dialing phone #, only received recording to leave mesage, but does not identify the number or give details about call back, use online, or anything informative. Food was a little slow coming out and it was not a busy night.

column4: 306 D W. Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: nothing pretentious. but well-above-average dining, at a very reasonable price. Don't be put off by Vespa's location, with a cheap noodle place, a generic Mex and a Panera nearby, or by Vespa's namesake 1950's motorscooter in front of the door - that's just the way the street is, and none of these things reflect on the food or wine. Augmented by a good wine list, it's hard to do better than this neighborhood restaurant.
Always Great. My favorite restaurant in Raleigh.

My fiance and I dine at Vino several times per year and always enjoy it. The food and service are consistently good. This particular evening was a Sunday dinner outing, and we were very surprised at how few patrons were there. (We usually visit Vino on Saturday evenings, and it can be lively and sometimes a bit louder than we like.) The lack of activity resulted in a very nice, quiet dinner, and our waiter paid very close attention to keeping our drinks refreshed, etc. - very enjoyable.

Excellent food, classical mixed with traditional.. only comment would be that the Tira Misu was not good,nor authentic. It was very sweet with no taste of any liquor..perhaps you should write it as a "Tira Misu" styled dessert..
This was our first visit and the food was fantastic. We were planning our next visit while enjoying our 1st!

column4: 201 S Estes Drive @ University Mall Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: Didn't enjoy sitting in a booth at all. The table are oversized, I felt like I couldnt reach my food. But the food and service was very good.
Food lacked flavor all the way around. Not sure they make it there or just use frozen products. I think they could do better. Not sure I will give them a second chance.

The food was definitely a regional Indian style and was delicious. The Paneer was tasty and the Chicken Curry excellent. The Lamb Vindaloo was different from any other we had tasted, but good. The Cauliflower & Potato side dish was the best I have ever tasted and the Naans- both plain and cheese filled were exceptional.

Food was very good. Waitress was Great! Bartender was slow!!! One of the owners and chefs came out to a table next to us and spoke to them so we tried to offer our thoughts on his restaurant and food and were totally ignored!!! Would not speek or acknowledge we were even in the restaurant. WE WILL NOT BE BACK! Very RUDE!

Highly chic restaurant for li'll ol' Raleigh. The entrance and lighting makes you feel like you are going into another dimension. I give 100% on decore and ambiance. They truly have something unique there. As for service, we were told that we were stuck behind a group of 45. Well over 90 minutes to get our food. I have a hard time with such excuses. If you are going to accept a reservation for a group that large, have the staff to deal with it. Don't do it at the expense of your other guests. The food was okay; nothing to write home about but tasty. You are paying a premium for old standards like butter chicken served in cool vessles in a cool place. Yes, I will try them again. Hope its better next time.

column4: 215 NE Broad St Southern Pines, NC  28387
column13: Kangaroo Loin, Maine Diver Scallops, New Zealand Filet... Chef Warren's is a foodie's heaven. Relaxed atmosphere, sophisticated dining - great date night location.

Yet another exquisite dining experience at Elliotts. Still loving the service - even on a very busy night with multiple large parties, Amanda was cool, collected, attentive and friendly to the two of us. Amanda and Samantha are our favorite servers, and we always ask for them. The salmon special is absolutely the best salmon entree I've ever had. Looking forward to another occasion to dine at Elliots.

column1: Bernardin's Restaurant at the Zevely House
column13: Another fabulous dinner at Bernardins!

The wait staff would interrupt conversation to "visit" when not taking orders or providing service. The sauce on the duck was overpowering. The music was not in line with the ambiance of the dcor. We will not go back.
Service was slow but worth the wait for wonderful wine and cheese plate. Highly recommend the chicken salad and fried green tomatoes. Will return on a day we aren't in a hurry.

column4: 126 S Main Street Suite G Kernersville, NC  27284
column13: Unique and interesting food made with care.The portions are just the right size and well presented. Saturday night had a guitarist and violinist which lent a festive feeling. An enjoyable casually sophisticated evening.

We love Bistro. They have background music but it is not blaring like so many places. It is casual, yet perfect for us for special occasions since we are casual folks. The people are so nice and the food is outstanding.
Amazing food at a reasonable price. Very friendly staff.
Great food, great service and a wonderful time had by all. My guests loved everything about their lunch (their first time at Deacon Tower Grille). I would recommend it to everyone!!

column4: Grandover Resort, 1000 Club Road Greensboro, NC  27407
column13: This is a lovely four star hotel, but my experience both in the restaurant and banquets is less than four star. We had a business dinner with 5 people. My entree choice was short ribs risotto. It came lukewarm, soupy and just a few shreds of meat. Not nearly worthy of the approximately $28 price. My chopped salad first course was good. Service was attentive. This is not a destination restaurant, but adequate for travelers staying at the hotel.

Food was delicious, correctly cooked, served at the proper temperature by an attentive, timely waitress. I liked the look of the restaurant and the variety on the menu. My wife and I back for more. PS. very reasonably priced.

column1: District Roof Top Bar and Grille
column13: We had a wonderful evening. I would highly recommend giving it a try. We will be back.

Was not really that impressed with the wood fire pizza - crust was kind of soggy. Had out of town visitors and was disappointed at the quality of food. I don't think we will return. Spent $86 for 4 people - food should have been better!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Greensboro
column13: My business partner and I dined at Fleming's on a weeknight, and there were several parties of rather loud business diners. But we were seated in an elevated corner booth, which helped diminish the noise. We were very solicitously served by our waiter, who was almost over-zealous. The beef -- lite filet served with house potoato and rib eye --was fabulously tender, cooked to perfection and served HOT!! Fleming salad with citrus dressing was good but not great; first course scallops delicoius. Side dish of creamed corn was served family style. Instead of lava cake or crme br_le, we had walnut caramel chocolate (turtle) pie in chocolate crust -- heavenly! Only off note was organic pinot noir - labeled good value on menu, too thin.

column4: 301 F Pisgah Church Rd Greensboro, NC  27455
column13: We had a wonderful "girls' night out" on Monday evening. The food was delicious and the atmosphere very pleasant.
Nice ambience in a town with not a lot of choices for lunch with a friend in a semi-quiet atmosphere.

column4: 1108 N. Main St High Point, NC  27262
column13: We went for our anniversary and informed them of the occasion when we made the reservation. However, there was no effort made to make us feel as if we were having a celebratory dinner. Our one request was a more secluded or private table, and we were sat in a loud adea right near the front door. We sat at a non-smoking table but every time the serving staff went out to the outdoor tables, smoke came wafting in and it was actually hazy inside the restaurant. Our food was very good, but the ambiance left little to be desired considering that we were told that Hamptons was a fine dining establishment. Overall, the restaurant was fair. I doubt we'll go back considering the price and that we enjoy other local restaurants much better.
A special place for a special occasion with something for everyone.
Excellent southern dinner with a flare! Everything was perfect!
Very delightful restaurant. Menu, while entrees are not in print, is creative. I would have chosen 3 or 4 items for appetizers or entrees. Definitely will go back again.

This was my 2nd trip to this wonderful restaurant. We had a second excellent experience. The food was very good. My friend said his meat was a bit chewy and the waitress was apologetic for this. We received service like we were old favorites. I love this place and have recommended it to several friends.Lin Watt

Our first time dining at MJ's in a while, but we WILL be back. THe food was excellent, the service was great, and we love the patio out back! This is one of the few patio's in Greensboro that does not feel like it is in the middle of a busy street. When it cools down this fall the patio will be fantastic. This is one of our new top 5 in Greensboro!
Food was excellent-great variety on the menu. Best bread puuding dessert I've ever had. Will definitely return when in town again.

column4: 420 Jonestown Rd Suite U Winston-Salem, NC  27104
column13: New Town Bistro & Bar is a neighborhood gem. They have a quaint courtyard where we have enjoyed many sun filled mornings with a great brunch. The service is super, always personable and cordial. We celebrated our 21 anniversary there and had a very good experience!

column4: 201 N. Elm St, Suite 105 Greensboro, NC  27401
column13: Always good. We both had the special soup of the day for the first course which was potato bisque with pork belly and it was delicious. For entree I had the osso buco over risotto with figs and it was also good, not excellent. My husband had the steak and it was cooked perfectly. Nice Italian wine list as well.
All food was quite good.Enjoyed thoroughly.

column1: The Old Fourth Street Filling Station
column13: Our group had a very nice evening and the food was outstanding. Four of us had the stuffed Mahi with spinach and potatoes and it was wonderful! Was served piping hot, which was very impressive since the restaurant was very busy. Another person had the Chicken entree (can't remember the name) but he loved it too. One of our favorite restaurants!

I made the reservation at Positano because my mother has enjoyed it in the past and my wife and i were taking her to lunch for her 85th birthday. We were met at the door (actually, outside the door!) and shown to our table. The restaurant had flowers and a birthday card awaiting my mom and the owner kept checking to see if everything was ok. My mom had a very nice lunch and our whole experience couldn't have been better. My wife and I have never been to Positano before, but I can see why my mom likes it. It is a delightful neighborhood restaurant, even if it is located in a shopping center.

I have multiple food allergies to gluten and dairy, and the folks at Print Works are so very accommodating. The staff is extremely well trained and they have sometimes helped me understand what I can no longer eat. This is our favorite restaurant in Greensboro and we eat here often.

column4: 800 Green Valley Road, Suite 100 Greensboro, NC  27408
column13: The entire dining experience was amazing! We were well taken care of during our meal and the food was incredible! It's the perfect place for a special occasion!
Our dinner was wonderful. Server was great - good pacing for a couple who was on a "date night" without their baby. Steaks were perfectly cooked and our view was beautiful. Highly recommend!

column1: Saint Jacques @ The Burke Manor Inn
column13: Lovely setting, food and service! Such a hidden gem in the little town of Gibsonville...very worth the drive!
Great place for a nice lunch. Great sandwiches and soups.
Staff was friendly and courteous. Good dining experience. Will go back!
We arrived on the first night of a new menu. The food was outstanding. Unfortunately, the service was exceptionally slow, nearly offsetting the quality of food.

Wasabi fried oysters, seafood sausage, potato leek soup, chicken with collards, potatoes with brie, great wine selection from Klaude and seamless service all around made for another wonderful Undercurrent experience.
Uncomfortably high noise level.
Good food, would recommend but if you have been there once you probably wouldn't be eagerly awaiting a second visit
See letter printed in the Winston Salem Journal many months ago.

column4: 1 Lodge Street Biltmore Estate Asheville, NC  28803
column13: One trip and you are hooked!!! From the homemade bread to the crisp salads, gourmet entrees and magnificent desserts....it is difficult to decide which entree is best....over the week, I had the delicious tender veal, poached salmon, grouper and risotto all accompanied by fall vegetables. A culinary delight!!!! And service to match....a perfect evening meal to accompany a wonderful fall get-away.
Once again, this restaurant did not disappoint. Especailly good wines this visit. The menu change is nice.
Just outstanding. Poultry raised locally. Poulet rouge and game hen are remarkable. Highly recommend in every way.
Nice relaxing restaurant/bar. Food was good and reasonably priced, service was very good. Will certainly go back one of the better places for the price in town.

column1: Blue Ridge Dining Room - Grove Park Inn
column13: The food was delicious and there was plenty of it. The service was great and all thought that our server was "johnnie on the spot". I would recommend the Blue Ridge Dinning Room to all my friends.ART MURRAY
Ambiance great, service great, food avg. for price.

We go to Casa Rustica every year for our anniversary. We love Italian food, and love going to Casa Rustica. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, and the service has always been good. We highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting the Boone, North Carolina, area.

We ended up with a party of 9. Food was good, and our waiter was GREAT!. HOWEVER, one of my friends and I asked if we could have a little more of the sauce that was on our filets and the chef said that he would have to charge us $1 because it was made with red wine!!! Really?! I am paying $29 for my entree and you are going to charge me for a little more sauce?! Probably won't return because of that. Chef needs a little lesson about how to please his customers.

The restaurant is small but there were 4 large parties and it was extremely noisy and only 2 waiters. We were sitted before 2 of the larger parties and order immediately. Our waiter got very busy and seemed overwhelmed. Food took a long time but I had the Hanger steak recommended by the waiter and it was delicious. My husband had the specila.. Mahi and the sauce on the plate was so much it overwhelmed the dish and he was disappointed. Seems like needed more help.
The booth was a bit uncomfortable and the service was a uneven. It would have been more romantic if they had lowered the lighting.

Tried this cozy little neighborhood restaurant due to the reviews on Open Table when we were visiting Asheville. NC. The best meal we had all week and wish we had found it sooner because we would most definitely gone again. Our waiter was wonderful and the food amazing.
Always fantastic food and warm, friendly service. Fine dining with a family feel. Crippens is a "must" when you visit Blowing Rock.

This was our 2nd time at C 24 and not our last. We had a reservation which was a good thing, it was a Saturday night and they were busy. All 3 of us found multiple items on the menu that we were drawn to. Our server was kind,knowledgeable but did not offer to help translate the menu. The food arrived at a nice pace and we never felt rushed, service did not hover but was always close by. Our salads and soup were fresh and evoked very positive reactions. 2 of us shared an entree and our server offered to split the dish on two plates which was appreciated. Again our entrees were very good, all plates went back to the kitchen empty. Dessert was delicious. Overall it was a very good experience, one that we were still commenting on the next day.

WAS PLEASANTLY SURPRISED WITH TAPAS SELECTIONS. ARRIVED EARLY (BEFORE RES.), SAT AT THE BAR AND WATCHED FOOD PREPARATION WHICH WAS A LOT OF FUN. AFTER SEEING CERTAIN ONES PLATED UP WE CHANGED OUR MINDS FOR PREVIOUSLY SELECTED ITEMS FROM MENU ON LINE. OUR SERVICE WAS VERY GOOD, WAITER REALLY HELPED WITH WINE SELECTION AND OUR DINING EXPERIENCE WAS VERY GOOD......WE'RE PICKY PEOPLE TO PLEASE. ENJOYED THE AMBIANCE AND ENERGY IN THE RESTAURANT AS WELL !!! WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK.

Food was good but not outstanding. Both my husband and I were a little disappointed. Something was missing but we couldn't quite put our finger on what. I rated the ambiance only good because we were far, far away from the buffet and had to wind around many tables and chairs to get to it. Also, we were placed next to a wall of windows where it was really chilly. I had to leave my jacket on the entire time.

column4: Lodge Street Biltmore Estate Asheville, NC  28803
column13: This was a special treat, we had a great time, impeccable service and the food was memorable.

This place is great for groups. Food is typically American and there is lots to choose from off the menu. We've been several times and our meals have always been good. They cater for children which is a plus and also give crayons and a sheet to color on.
The Gamkeeper was very nice. Great ambiance and the food was excellent. Would def. recommend to anybody in the area for dinner.

We had a large group and they did a great job of accommodating us. The food was really good and there was a wide range of options without being overwhelming. It was a nice quaint place that is easy to walk to from the Grove Park Inn. Definitely worth going to and avoiding the drive to downtown.
18% gratuity was added to our check in a very nonconspicous way. The waiter should have reminded us that it was added.

Our favorite restaurant in Banner Elk to dine. The food choices and quality are excellent and the service is consistently outstanding. We had 7:30 reservations on a very busy Friday nite and were seated immediately upon arriving. Excellent wine choices and very knowledgable staff to help you select the perfect wine.

Great romantic dinner location. We were able to sit at a window table that overlooked Main Street. Extensive wine list and many wines by the glass made for an interesting evening. Ordered the salmon, duck breast, and the scallop appetizer. Service was excellent as was the entrees.
Excellent food! Great service, may return before leaving town. Chef came out to check on table, very personable. Will definitely dine here again when visiting Asheville!

Lovely spot in Waynesville for dinner. This was our second visit and we will return. Service is attentive but not intrusive. Food is well prepared and well presented. While their wine list is limited their corkage fee allows those that have a favorite bottle to enjoy it at their table.

column1: Olive or Twist Restaurant and Bar
column13: The band was fun and energetic! There was ballroom dancing happening.
Lovely setting on the water and a very interesting menu with great daily specials. Bar is warm and cozy and the wine list is very nice. If you're in the area you should definitely try it.

I am an out of towner foodie. Found Pomodoro's last visit and will not fail to return anytime in Asheville.Really outstanding Greek and Italian dishes. Hearty servings.Met the owner this time.Traveling w Italian friend. Her quote "best pizza I've ever had".
Consistently one of the best in Asheville.

column1: Red Stag Grill-Grand Bohemian Hotel Asheville
column13: went there 11/3/2012 for my 5 yr anniversary. the food was amazing, my wife had the tasting menu, i had never tried duck, but it was great! I had the steak with mac n cheese, best i ever had! Thank you for your service!

Rezaz is one of my favorite restaurants in Asheville. It is consistently wonderful and so when I have folks visiting I always come to Rezaz. We had friends down from Boston and they were so pleased. I can tell you that everyone cleaned the plates...thoroughly!

My husband, mother and I had dinner at Roux one evening. The wait person was very courteous and professional, and the food was quite good. This is one of the better restaurants located in Biltmore Park. We definitely will visit Roux again.

column1: Rowland's Restaurant at Westglow Resort and Spa
column13: incredibly romantic and scenic view
A very lovely and delicious dining experience!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Harrah's Cherokee Casino & Hotel
column13: Our waiter and his assistant were great!!! Food was absolutely fabulous!!!!!! The only thing we did not enjoy was that the restaurant did not adhere to their dress code. Many of the customers were in blue jeans or jogging pants along with flip flops and tennis shoes.

column4: 86 Lily Pad Lane Flat Rock, NC  28731-8576
column13: We enjoyed a lovely Brunch with you. I was very happy to see that you were kid-friendly. We have a 7 year old and she thought the whole exprience was fantastic! Our food was just wonderful and the staff well we could not have ask for any better. Thank you

Thoroughly enjoyed our first visit here. Food was beautiful fresh and unique. Atmosphere was wonderful and inviting. Have already recommended to others and will definitely return. Be sure to make reservation because it is impossible to get in without one in the tourist season!

column4: 125 S Lexington Ave Suite 103 Asheville, NC  28801
column13: I am a chef at a B&B and a group of guests went to Storm and raved about it. After reading the menu I knew I had to check it out because I am a definite foodie. A best friend of mine and I went on a date and it was wonderful! My husband and I will definitely come to celebrate occasions or even a romantic date. I will be back!!! Btw check out their cocktails...yum!
The food is excellent. It is a little pricey however. Great reception staff.

Hawaiian sunfish entree which our server recommended was excellent, as was the baby suckling pig entree. Only slight disappointment were the raw beets in the appetizer which lacked the flavor which cooked beets would have had. Muscadine mousse for dessert was wonderful. All in all, an outstanding meal.
This place in gorgeous and the atmosphere is awesome. Next time I will make a reservation in the main dining room but we got seated in a side room right beside the fireplace and it was awesome!!!
We were greeted warmly by host but after that, our server essentially ignored us .We had to ask to have a drink order taken after a long wait then had to ask for the wine list. The food was average.

Was a great evening. Annalise was very knowledgable about the wine and made a great recommendation. Crab cakes and pecan crusted shrimp were great , the salmon and the sausage plate were also enjoyed. Someone in our party loved the chocolate mousse.

Zambra exceeded my expectations. Everything we tried was interesting, with some creative taste combinations. Prices were reasonable, and servings were surprisingly large for a tapas restaurant. The atmosphere hasn't changed since we were there -- still dark and cave-like but not uninviting. Zambra isn't quite up to C_rate in terms of atmosphere or food, in my opinion, but it's a reasonable alternative when C_rate is fully booked, as it often is. I made reservations through Open Table but, on the negative side, there are zero Open Table points for eating here

column4: 502 West Main St. Banner Elk, NC  28604
column13: We have been here before but this time they were out of a lot of the items.

column4: 22 N Lumina Ave Wrightsville Beach, NC  28480
column13: Went here the weekend of November 3, off season I guess, because the food was off compared to the favorable remarks we saw on the site. The bacon wrapped scallops and bread basket breads were excellent. Wish we had stopped there. Taste is so subjective. The bronzed catfish was good, but the shrimp and grits with a bbq sauce swirl and the peanut butter pie did not 'wow' us. The wait staff were very nice and knowledgeable.
Loved the wine list, the specials (salmon rillettes & osso buco) and the bolagnese!

We were greeted with great enthusiasm at this quaint, back street, eclectic restaurant. A friendly server offered a menu of tapas, small plates, and large plares. Wonderful opportunity for sharing. The martini menu was creative and top shelf. We will return.

column1: Aqua Restaurant and Spa - Duck, NC
column13: Wonderful location overlooking the sound and food is delicious!
Fried green tomatoes appetizer just ordinary but rest of dinner was superb.

column4: 205 S. Topsail Dr. Surf City, NC  28445
column13: Very nice overall experience. Delicious and thoughtful. We will go back often.

column4: 1240 Duck Road / PO Box 8399 Duck, NC  27949
column13: Love Blue Point! Its one of our favorite restaurants in the Outer Banks!
Great food. Loved the mussels! We will certainly be back again and again.

This was our second time at Catch and both meals have been awesome. If you haven't been here - you are in for a treat. The biggest problem I have is deciding what to order since everything is so good! Great sauces, presentation, fresh ingredients. I had the crab cakes this time and they were outrageous. Definitely the best I have ever had - which is saying a lot since I grew up in New England. We definitely will go back soon.

We are local customers and dine out at least a couple times a week. This wasn't our first visit to Chef's but will most likely be our last. My wife and I both ordered the filet special with crab and it was terrible. The beef was tough, tasteless and chewy. I cannot believe it was even filet, the worst cut of beef I have ever been served. I asked the waitress to take the half I left and ask the chef to try to cut it. To my amazement the management/kitchen did nothing to even acknowledge the poor quality, they just kept serving the "special". The waitress did offer to take it back and bring something else but by that point I was ready to leave. Unbelievable! On the other hand the apps and sides and were quite good and the wine was excellent.
Wine list was over priced, but other than that it was a very good experience.

column4: 4650 C Arendell Street Morehead City, NC  28557
column13: This place is great from the moment you walk in the door! Smiling hostess, Maggie the super waitress, mojitos to die for, over the top tapas, leave room for desert. We didn't know you could eat like this in Morehead City.

Right from the start our dining experience began wonderfully. Even though we are returning customers, i was impressed even more this time. Our service was wonnderful. it is the little things that sometimes matter the most. our server told us the specials as he was handing us the menus so we could consider that option early. i don't like when they tell you specials when they come to take the order, no time to wiegh options....again little thing. The food as always was wonderful top notch taste and presentation. i tried their seasonal apple cheesecake for desert and wow, what a great choice. While the Hilltop is not cheap, here you get what you pay for.

column1: THE KITCHEN - FARM RAISED FIRE ROASTED FARE
column4: 1225 A Military Cutoff Road Wilmington, NC  28405
column13: Good food selection well served,adequate number of wines to choose from,most by the glass, great beer selection (was a sports bar in prior life). Good service. Good value.
While it was an OK restaurant, we probably would not go back. It was way too expensive for what we got. Just expected better considering how highly rated it was

column1: The Mash House Restaurant and Brewery
column13: Our reservation was set for 6:15 p.m. JUST as soon as we arrived; which was right at 6:15 p.m. we were IMMEDIATELY given a table. NO sitting around and waiting for ANY length of time.

column4: 505 Atlantic Beach Causeway Atlantic Beach, NC  28572
column13: My wife and I were somewhat disappointed with our dining experience. We went to this location due to reading pamphlets and fliers around Atlantic Beach. It seemed like a perfect romantic on the water dining experience. We were indeed sat outside directly beside a party of six with two of the loudest and unruly children you could imagine. We were asked to be sat somewhere quiet so we too could watch the sunset. After we had just about finished our meal with no peace and quiet at all, the loud party left and two minutes later an even louder bunch was put right beside us. The food was ok but over-priced for what we got.

column1: Ocean Blvd Bistro and Martini Bar
column4: 4700 N Virginia Dare Trail Kitty Hawk, NC  27949
column13: Ocean Boulevard is a great place for local seafood (mussel app is divine), super rack of lamb, and very good wine list. Creative menu choices make this a FUN neighborhood food destination for us!

column4: 1125 Military Cutoff Road Suite K Wilmington, NC  28405
column13: Jazz music in an Italian restaurant feels very strange
The dinner menu is constantly changing, so it's always great to see what new items Chef Fong comes up with. The best place in New Bern for fine dinning.
The food and service were both excellent.

Had the crab dip for appetizer. Was so good, you could just eat it with a spoon. Entree was the sirloin with shrimp. The meat was cooked perfectly and wonderfully seasoned. The shrimp was grilled and had great flavor. Topped the meal off with chocolate bomb cake and coffe. Absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Great Food and great service. Definitely recommend going here. Loved the sushi and the volcano shrimp (very spicy though). Everything from the sushi, our service, even the water in chilled jars was amazing.
Fun atmosphere, but very loud. Food was good and we will be back.
This is really a wine bar, not a restaurant. The tables and seating make for very uncomfortable arrangements. The menu is extremely limited. However, the food is very good.

Great appetizers but the Turkey meal option was so bad I ate a couple of bites and that was it! Turkey was so dry and tough I couldn't chew it. Small dollop of gravy and the sides were equally awful. I won't go back.

column4: 1515 N. Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Great place for cocktails and appetizers. Excellent location for outdoor seating.
This is a quiet little restaurant. I have been there twice lately and both times the service was attentive and the food was excellent - a cut above the normal Vietnamese restaurant fare.

column4: 231 South Ellsworth Ave. San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: We ate here for Thanksgiving dinner and were sorely disappointed. we had an Opentable reservation but still waited more than 30 minutes to be seated. When we were finally seated, we continued to wait -- for water, a member of the wait staff, any sign of attention.We finally ordered from a four course special menu. When our soup arrived, it was lukewarm. We sent it back, and when it returned, it was exactly the same tepid temperature. When we told the waiter, he shrugged. Our entrees were terrible: one slice of turkey with candied gravy and dried stuffing; salmon that was advertised as fresh and wild, but tasted several days old. the wines by the glass were outrageously -- unjustifiably -- expensive.

I had my 50th birthday dinner here and was very happy. we were given a beautiful private room but as the walls were part glass we could still see the rest of the restuarant. The table was large which left plenty of room - no feeling cramped - nice! The service was great and all questions ( even the stupid ones ) were answered with grace. Love this restaurant:)

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The food was good, but very noisy and it is more of a sportsbar then restaurant. Suited for lunch or a very casual dinner on town. Very generous servings.

column4: 601 Van Ness Avenue Suite F San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: We went to this restaurant on Thanksgiving day. We were grateful that they opened on Thanksgiving and offered both Japanese food and turkey meal. However, the Japanese menu was limited and did not have the Japanese dish that we wanted. All the dishes were overpriced especially the turkey meal ($32 for 2 small slices of turkey, 1 bowl of fried rice, mashed potato, stuffing). We also ordered udon, grilled salmon, and a sushi roll. The sushi was fresh. The salmon was on the dry side. The udon broth was very salty.

When we first walked in we thought it was a restaurant within the hotel with its own 4 walls but found it was literally tables set up inside the lobby. Food presentation stylishly done. The burgers and brussel sprout chips were fulfilling and portion size was generous. Go, if you dont mind watching people rolling luggage in and out of the lobby, from a distance. Validated parking was a plus although you have to wait at the front desk to get it.

column4: 4290 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: food was terrible. the bacon crumbled to pieces with the touch of the tongs it was so overcooked. servers were nice though, which made up for the eggs swimming in broth. for the prices versus quality, the breakfst should at least be complimentary.
Absolutely delicious. Great room too.

5A5 Steak Lounge is truly a great place to eat. From the moment we walked in we were greeted by friendly staff even though we showed up almost 20 minutes early. The restaurant was relatively empty when we got there which was nice and also there was a pianist playing. The waitress working was absolutely hands down the best service me and my girlfriend have ever had. Prior to ordering they brought out the different cuts of wagyu beef so we could see for ourselves what this amazing meat looked like. For a starter we got the lopster tempura which we both agreed was hands down best lobster we have ever had. My girlfriend ordered the filet mignon and i got the slow roasted prime rip, both were out of this world.

column4: 71 N. San Pedro Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: We had a very good meal before a concert and the service was friendly even though the waiter was very busy. There wasn't an empty table in the place. You definitely need reservations on a night when the H P Pavillion is busy. Close enough to walk to the show and there is parking across the street. (Much easier than dealing with the crowds at the pavillion)

column4: Hilton San Francisco 750 Kearny Street San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: Thanksgiving lunch was great here. The turkey was super moist and tasty with a nice spread of stuffing, gravy, mashed potatoes, green beans, yams, cranberry sauce, etc. I didn't expect that the dessert would be so delicious. Its a good idea to get there when they open as they close at 2pm and would need at least 2 hours to enjoy the lunch buffet.

I took my mother and aunt here for a Birthday lunch celebration and had the most wonderful experience. Every item we ordered was outstanding. Our waitress was accomodating, knowledgable and friendly. They even sent complimentary desserts with a candle to the birthday girls (which really made their day special). Truly a stellar restaurant in every way. Can't wait to go back.

The whole experience didn't add up. Maybe aspects of it were a fluke but we would be hard pressed to try again. Food was fine-- pretty good in fact. Hard to park. Not their fault but something to consider in the Marina. There are too many tables in the restaurant so you better hope the people next to you are having a good conversation. The service was terrible. Before our waiter forgot to put our entree order in and make us wait far too long to get them the service was harried, waiters not really focused on service (bread with our pureed beans please....) but then he could hardly bring himself to say he was sorry when he forgot our food. Or check in on us. So embarrassed he made a mistake that all civility went out the window? Not cool.
The beer selection is fantastic, but the food is expensive and mediocre.

We had a great time. I was nicely surprised to see live music performed, a good selections of oldies which made the ambiance very romantic. The food was delicious and we would definitely return with friends.
everything was perfect. the food, ambience and service...very excited to visit again soon!
the restaurant may only have one entree per day, but it allows for perfection and our skirt steak and the baby lettuce salad, 5year cheese and fromage dessert certainly was just that!

I've been going to Fiesta del Mar literally since the day their original Shoreline location opened 20 years ago. I have always appreciated it as a great family place, and go there every chance I get. When I heard that the owners would be opening a bit higher-end place in downtown Mtn View, I was thrilled-- they are great restaurateurs, and Castro Street is still a few first-cabin restaurants away from being a really great spot. Our first trip to Agave last night was a real treat, and I'm looking forward to many, many more dinners there.

column1: Agriculture Bar & Kitchen at Dawn Ranch Lodge
column13: Enjoyed wooded location, lovely ambience and delicious dinners - service was quite slow, though servers were apologetic, gracious and professional. In the past, we have had unfortunate experiences in Guerneville restaurants. Agriculture Bar & Kitchen changed our perspective -- a very nice surprise.
Best Sushi in SF... I love this place. Amakase is the only way to go and it is a MUST.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Service was slow and indifferent. There was a large table of 12, but that's not an excuse. The food was fine, nothing special. This is the second time we have been there. The first time service was even worse. Sorry, tried to give it another chance, but it failed to shine.

I was looking for a restaurant that was something authentic to Spanish food (tacos are no Spanish , tapas are). This restaurant is as authentic as they get. Wonderful service, good menu full of delicious tapas items (and not an endless list of same stuff). Ambiance was great, you feel relaxed and not rushed at all. They have enough items to satisfy a vegetarians hunger also.
The most amazing and over-the-top dinner I have ever had! Alexander's brings a special meal to a whole new level. Fun items of recommendation- truffle mac&cheese and truffle French fries.

Absolutely amazing service and food. This was my first time trying Wagyu and I was more than impressed. Everything we ate (hamachi shots, edamame, steak, baked potato, green beans, and Tropic Thunder for dessert) was outstanding. I've been to "really nice" restaurants in DC, Dubai, and Philadelphia and this tucked away steakhouse rivaled them all. We went for our first anniversary dinner and I'm happy to say that it was the perfect, memorable dinner for such an occasion.

The people at Alfred's provide a great experience and service. Just enough interruptions to keep the beverages and food flowing and not be a pest. Love it there. Will definitely return, and definitely recommend it!

Nice place, but the food and service is not worth the prices. It's a typical touristy restaurant. Had a much better experience at Rocco's the following night, excellent food, fair prices, our bill was half of what we spent at Alioto's and we left happy :)

Food was very good and the service was terrific. Perhaps a bit pricey since portions seemed small. We ordered crab cakes for an appetizer and two very tasty ones arrived, but they were small - perhaps 1-1/2" across and 3/4" thick ($15). I ordered the 1/2 chicken and it was only somewhat larger than 1/2 cornish hen. My wife had the seafood on pasta and it too was a smaller portion. The prices were full size. My major complaint was the noise level. It is VERY noisy and with being seated across from each other at a fairly wide table, it made conversation difficult. There was a large party nearby that was very boisterous and that didn't help. So...in sum, very good food in small portions priced a bit high and very noisy.

Main dish, duck two ways, was over cooked and the portion of duck was small. Otherwise, the food was good. The interior of the restaurant is very interesting. The very high ceilings are not conducive to quiet dining. It is pricey for Indian food.

Wow, delicious. We ate the vegetarian and gluten free options and they were fantastic. The cocktails use Ayurvedic herbs and concepts which were both interesting and tasty. If you're looking for Indian food in a chic setting, or just yummy food to entice your five senses, this spot is a must try. I'm new to this city and hence very interested in continuing to try new places, but I'll make a point to return here myself.

column4: 25 Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Thanksgiving buffet will never be the same!!! Loved it

column4: 2290 El Camino Real Suite 9 Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: I have eaten at Amber before, and the food is always good. We ordered the set meals - the Amber and Vegetarian Dinners. The waiter or waiters seemed to have forgotten what was included in the meal as we had to remind them about the tea and they forgot dessert completely. After we left, I had to think about whether they might have forgotten something else as well.
This is an excellent dinning place. You get value for you pay.

Very unusual spot! Reminds me of a diner--reimagined into something fun and cool. Food was great, cupcakes amazing. They have cupcake flights paired with wine/beer tastings--something we will come back for.

This was our 3rd Thanksgiving at Americano and it was fabulous. It's become my tradition-away-from-home. Everything about it was wonderful--from the minute we checked in they handed us a glass of bubbly all the way to the end where they wrapped up our Thanksgiving meal leftovers...with extra mashed potatoes...hello Heaven!!

I've written before and will do so again to say this is our favorite neighborhood place to eat. The food is so good, every time we go. The staff is wonderful, it is like visiting good friends. we've eaten here at least 30 times, likely much more..but who counts?Dino the owner has created this little gem, we love introducing it to friends. Thanks again!

Our second visit to Anchor & Hope. The food was very good but portions were very small considering the price, 2 scallops & 2 shrimp for 30 dollars seems a bit much. Our table was very dark and almost impossible to read menu. Staff and service were wonderful. But unlikely that I would suggest to go here again.
Tasty tapas in the Mission. Chefs tasting menu is a great way to try what the restaurant has to offer -plenty of food and goes well with the wine pairing.

Albeit a busy evening, we had to plead with the waitress for our drinks and even something simple as bread on the table. Once the food finally arrived, we were shocked at the portions for the prices. A cup of risotto for 18 dollars!? We laughed, and the waitress was embarrassed and brought a second serving without charge. And it tasted completely different than the first serving! The pork was overcooked, and tasteless, nothing like the menu description. I brought friends there because in the past it was nice, but it seems to have lost its appeal, and i paid a lot of money for small portions of tasteless food. Maybe they had a bad night? I can concede that if the food wasn't so off. New chef, lower prices, then I will return.

Angele is always a wonderful experience. They shift their menu with the seasons and this month produced a wonderful soup made from a root vegetable with a dribble of truffle oil. The bread and butter is always a favorite and one can make a meal of that and the french onion soup when it is on the menu. The chicken is now pan crusted with mash potatoes but I prefer their original version. Burgers and fries are a favorite and so generous that they could be shares with a salad ( there a re severalhealthy choices) and that would be sufficient. If you have room at the end of the meal, the selections for those who do not watch the blood sugar levels are numerous and tasty. In doors or out Angele is a winner.
The musical performances are definitely a plus.
I love this neighborhood restaurant. Crowded & Lively.
I have never have had a bad meal there. Love their Spinach and arugula salad, incredible mix of tastes.!
In no way can you ever go wrong with Another Monkey Thai!!!
Our server,Anna, was "spot on".....informative,friendly and attentive! Food was very good, as usual, and we enjoyed our evening. We'll be back!

We enjoyed the Thanksgiving Prefix meal prepared by the restaurant. It is a very popular offering in the area so it's important to book a reservation in advance. There were two choices one with traditional Thanksgiving fare and one seafood option. We all chose the traditional meal and was very impressed with the quality and quantity of food. The meal was as delicious as what I might expect from a homecooked Thanksgiving meal and the quantity didn't disppoint either.

column4: 100 W San Carlos St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Food was excellent! Cant wait to try the whole chicken fried in duck fat! Carved tableside.

Arka has one waitress that she is very good and caring.However, the rest of the crews doesn't do much.If our waitress is unavailable the other seems to be lost.Food is alright, it is hit and miss. Some entries are very good and the rest you can leave without it.

This was my fifth dining experience at Artisan Bistro. The food is every bit as good as a 5 star SF restaurant with the convenience of home. Our waiter, Joe, was fabulous. He recommended a wine that was everything he said it was. He was attentive without being overbearing. It was the perfect evening to celebrate a special birthday with friends.

column4: 2700 W El Camino Real Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: the Indian-inspired food was excellent, and our friendly server made good recommendations about quantities, not trying to over-sell, as well as good cominations of entrees with each other. there was a wide mix of young/old/families and it was excellent value for the money. a place to return to !

My wife and I had dinner at Arya for the first time after receivng a favorable review from a neighbor, unfortunately, it will be our ONLY time visitng this restuarant. We were immediately served and seated as there were many open tables. Several various size parties were throughout the establishment, and the waiter came within a good time, introduced himself, and asked for our initial drink order. Our initial impression was good at this time. The menu was overall non-selective in Italian and Mediterranean cuisine that seemed pricey. Out waiter seemed anexious, was non-helpful, and needs to learn when to interupt or come back later. My wife didn't like her dinner, mine wasn't bad. We didn't order dessert and the waiter made us feel rushed.

Went here for a birthday celebration. Excellent food. Service was good. While our waiter was very accommodating - he had NO personality. I was really surprised about that. This was in complete contrast to the hostess who was very bubbly and friendly.

This is perhaps the best Indian food we have had in San Francisco. For my taste a bit spicier would be preferred, but it was certainly spicy. The eggplant was the best, although the lamb sauce was just wonderful.

If you're looking to "experience San Francisco", this is the place. The food is amazing and the show is funny, exhilarating, original, and full of sass. This was my first time here and I had a crazy amount of fun. They also have a nice bar and dance floor in the basement. So after pigging out, you can go burn a few calories on the dance floor. Just don't bring your uptight conservative friends here. Highly recommend getting reservations well in advance.

I've been there many times and the food has always hit the spot. The only downside to this trip was the service. I had guests from out of town visiting and specifically had this place in mind. There was a HUGE birthday group...it was probably between 20-30 people. I imagine that reservations would be needed for a group that size.

Everyone in our party of 4 enjoyed their dinner. Two of us had the onion soup and loved it. My entree was the pork tenderloin and although it was a bit too dry for my taste the dinner on the whole was very tasty. The sweet potatoes were excellent. My husband had the skirt steak and enjoyed it so much nothing remained on his plate. I would reccommend this restaurant. Our friends said they would come back too.
Incredible blend of creativity and excellent food! Challenges and stimulates all your senses to maximize eating experience like no other!

column4: 234 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: We love The Attic and go there whenever the occasion calls for a great local restaurant! Fab for small groups who want to share dishes. Highly recommend!

column1: Aurea - The Stanford Court, a Renaissance Hotel
column13: I ate at Aurea while on a business trip and was eating alone. The waiter and maitre d' were very welcoming and pleasant, which is not always the case when a middle-aged woman is dining alone. The food was very good, and the wine list was relatively small but had some interesting selections- not just the usual popular chardonnays. A very nice experience, and I would go there again.
lovely ambiance, people friendly and staff attentive. Portions generous, entree's fit for sharing!
We enjoyed the food, wine and the waiter was very accommodating with selections of wine. We would definitely recommend this place and go again.

Excellent without pretense. Congratulations and thank you for your excellent excellent excellent (180 characters left) excellent restaurant. Beautiful presentation-perfect portions-the best servers. Left larger tip than you may have expected and you credited it back to me. I.O.U. !!!
The food wasn't as good as I expected judging from the average review. The seafood tapas were good, but the rice small plate dish was not fantastic. I was hoping to be amazed.

I been eating Thai for many year. Baan is one of the bottom on my list. I ordered one soup and four entrees with all medium spicy. Only the soup taste little spicy and all other entrees was very salty and sweet. I ask the waiter about the medium spicy which we ordered. All he said was " well that's how it is".
kids korner? worst idea everwon't be back...only came back to take my gf there for some decent bbqcity doesn't do bbq right, but it's ok, i might place take out here

column4: Doubletree Sonoma 1 Doubletree Drive Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Maybe an upscale version of Applebees? Service certainly needs more training and improvement. quick lunch..ok... but do you want to pay the price for the quality of food? Food was "good", but overpriced for what we got. Will I go back? nope.

The pastas are great! Everything was well prepared and served with one exception. One of my dinning partners ordered the liver dish which was overcooked and not the best quality meat. The restaurant redeemed itself by quickly replacing it with another entre which my friend enjoyed. An excellent Noe Valley neighborhood spot.

GREAT food and service! Was there 1 time prior when first opened and place felt a little cramped though food was good. Much nicer inside with large room. Tables well spaced and families with children did not disturb us. Bar in dining room was not terribly noisy though full. Food was excellent! Water with fruit a nice touch. Had 2 3-course deluxe dinners and we chose calamari, crab cake, lobster ravioli with shrimp and ribeye. All were excellent. Steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Lobster ravioli was in a tomato-bisque type sauce that did not overpower the pasta. Tiramisu was creme brulee-ishly delish. I like it when the manager is involved in the room and asks "how is everything?" WILL RETURN.
Great restaurant. Have dined here many times. They seat you ontime. Fantastic menu, well prepared food, extensive wine list (reasonably priced), friendly staff. What more could you ask for?
We will be back! Had a nice afternoon starting with brunch with pals, then walked down the street to Sundance Cinema for "Lincoln". Plenty to talk about. We will do this again, and maybe for dinner.
We went there for a special occasion and couldn't have been more pleased with the foor and the service. It has a very Paris Bistro feel that reminded us of time spent in France.
Excellent food -- presented well.

Celebrated husbands birthday: it's always great Italian food here. Salads are interesting, large, always changing. The special "Lasagna Florentine" is the best vegetarian lasagna ever! Had a great dinner here - you can't go wrong! The manager and wait staff are a delight.
Just lovely! Exquisite cocktails and great food. The ambience is endearing and cozy, while classy and modern.
Overpriced, boring, bland food!

When I got there I was seated right away, even without the rest of the party having been there, they served me cucumber water, and asked if i'd like to order a drink, I did. The waiters were really nice, the food is amazing (but that says nothing since I love raw fish), absolutely awesome beer menu, overall great place. Definitely recommend it!!
Great place-can't wait to visit again.
Kind of a Chevy's type place. No remarkable food. But for Margarita and sports bar type atmosphere, its ok.

column4: 3900 D Bel Aire Plaza Napa, CA  94558
column13: Good as always, but their pricing has increased. Just a little too much for glorified BBQ food. Their seafood selections might be even better than their BBQ.

If you like hippie waitresses that haven't washed their hands in what looks like days, incorrectly taking your order only to eventually bring you mediocre food (at best) in a noisy live-music bar setting, you've found your place. Good beer selection but doesn't make up for the rest of the experience. Wouldn't return or recommend.

What a beautiful restaurant! Went here for a romantic dinner for 2 and was blown away by the gorgeous and delicious food, but especially the warm and attentive service. They made our night really special and I would definitely come back here. The interior is contemporary without being fussy as well and I can definitely understand why this is such an amazing special occasions site. PS If the lobster risotto is on the menu - GET IT.

Had a great time here. Who knew there was great food like this in Pacifica? We were here with grandma and the kids and everybody found something they liked. For grownups the wine list and cocktail menu are awesome.
This place is a gem in every way.Every food item is delicious, starting from the perfectly cooked white rice !The service is courteous and friendly.Very clean. The kitchen staff accommodating.
There was louder music than I'd prefer, but the people were lovely and the food was fine. I'll go back when I've a brunch date.

This is a great Thai place with most staples and a number of creative dishes. We had the Sakhoo Saimu and Larb Gai for appetizers. The Sakhoo Saimu is a fun dish comprising a sweet, chewy dumpling of tapioca-encased pork. The Larb Gai is a lettuce wrap with a tangy filling of shredded chicken, chili and mint. These appetizers highlighted the meal. For the main courses, we had the Drunken Beef and Kana Mu Grob. The Drunken Beef was good, but ordinary. The Kana Mu Grob, which we had with pork belly, seemed better in theory. The pork belly was not crispy and the broccoli included mostly stems, giving the dish an unfortunate leftover quality. Service was friendly and attentive. We will no doubt return to sample the menu further.

I have eaten brunch twice recently and enjoyed both times. Food and service were excellent. Restaurant can be noisy if very busy. I have eaten lunch on many occasions. Nice to eat outside during the summer months. Candee
The food and service were fantastic. Parking was an issue.

All the food had great flavor. Would like to see some of the tapas more authentic to Spain as this restaurant can pull it off with its kitchen staff. We were a party of two and felt like family! The chupitos off the chart good!
terrific food quality--was surprised it was so great. and we have fussy eaters.
Great staff, very friendly and eager to please!!!Yummy food!

column1: Bay View Restaurant - Inn at the Tides
column4: 800 Coast Highway One Bodega Bay, CA  94923
column13: Very repectful of local Nor Cal ingredients and traditional Italian recepies. Understated and delicious lobster linguine, salmon tartare, seasonal crab & avocado turret and lamb chops.

column4: 223 Twin Dolphin Dr Redwood City, CA  94065
column13: Bay223 was a little tough to find. I did not realize at first that it was in the Sofitel Hotel. The parking garage sign said hotel guests only. I checked with the maitre d and she said it would be fine to park in the garage. The mushroom soup and the Duck were fantastic. Finished it off with a Nutella milkshake. Jason was my server. I think he was new. Seemed a little nervous and not very confident which was okay because he did a good job. I will return when I'm back in the area.
Went with DH for wedding anniversary. He loved his chicken, I liked my short ribs very much. Service was attentive while not hovering. Lots of families with well-behaved children. Very considerate.

Unfortunately not a good experience! Called to say we were running 10 mis. late so we had to wait 20 minutes for our table and it was not what we asked for in our reservation. They said.. Sorry !, this is what we have for you. We stayed because we were hungry and wanted to have our Thanks Giving dinner as a family. The service was courteous, but to slow. When our order finally got served .. they brought one plate of soup for one of us, and 5 minutes the other plate of the same soup .. All they said was .. Sorry ! / We order the traditional turkey and it was ok, but we have had better. Do not want to say anything bad about the restaurant but I do not have anything good to say.. unfortunately; maybe I can say .. Sorry.HC
Good food and great beer. Servers were friendly and courteous, and knowledgeable about the menu and beer. Fun place to go to with friends to eat or just have a drink. Reasonably priced.

We had a great dinner here with a group of 6. The food was really wonderful - house-made charcuterie was excellent (especially the pate de campagne and the duck breast salumi - those were big hits). Shared starters of scallop crudo, marrow, and deviled eggs were also all delicious. Everyone enjoyed their main dishes - the burger was a bit underdone for me, but was probably good for your average person. (I only realized on receiving it that I hadn't been asked how I liked it). But it was very tasty and the fries were really great. Overall, we loved this spot and will definitely be back. Good wine, good waitresses, and overall a great vibe (if a bit loud).
Very romantic and quiet place.Service is bit slow. so don't expect a good service.Food is decent

Met alumni high school friends there for drinks and food the other evening. We sat in a cozy corner, right by one of two fireplaces in the restaurant. We had great food and drinks. We especially LOVED our waitress Monica. She was AMAZING, gracious, fun, accommodating, and very attentive. I suggest when you go to Becs, ask for Monica. Youll be glad you did!

Belden Taverna went out of their way to make me comfortable when I accidentally showed up early for my date.
