Instead of making me feel unwelcome, they put me at a table, brought me a water, and checked on me a couple times over the 30 minutes before my company arrived. Later, when we ordered and ate, I was impressed by the ambiance and by the professionalism of the staff. This is a beautiful little restaurant and they're 100% on top of their service game. I would recommend this spot to anyone who wants to impress a friend, romantic interest, or colleague, without looking heavy-handed.

We have been to the restaurant many times, and the only gripe I have about Bella Saratoga is that even with a reservation (and a request for a nice table because of a birthday), we always end up with a table in a less-desirable area (closest to the bar and in the flow of traffic this time). Every time we ask to be moved, we are told the tables are reserved or promised to someone else. And every time, we eat our meal and finish our wine and/or dessert and the tables we've asked to be moved to remain empty. It has become a joke in our family. I guess you have to be a regular or know the management to get a good table. Food is good, but I think we're done with Bella.
Simple tradition food executed to perfection.
Intimate, personal, responsive, attentive service all about the best eating and dining experience. Food preparation successfully "high" continental. Go, pay and enjoy.
Once again a solid effort on this can't miss restaurant. i would have preferred our favorite server Terri Ann serving and not tending the bar, but you can't have it all. Doug Chase

Love Benihanas. I never have a bad time, bad food, or a bad experience here EVER! Been here for numerous birthdays, graduations, etc. & most recently brought my Grandmother here to celebrate her birthday in America, for the first time! Thanks for providing a WONDERFUl time!

We arrived 15 minutes early, but were not seated until 15 minutes past our reservation time. My reservation had 3 people listed, but when we were seated they gave us 2 seats and squeezed our high chair between 2 chairs, which was very uncomfortable. It was so busy that there was not another table to move to.

column4: 10123 N Wolfe Rd Suite #2074 Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: celebrated my birthday with some friends. Our server and chef are very friendly and catered well to our needs.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Service was great, fun atmosphere, great for a family get together for a special occasion

Benu was everything that my foodie friends said it was and then some. Truly a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience that I will remember fondly...if I ever get the chance to go again, I would JUMP for it!

This was the second time I have eaten there and the first time, it was absolutely perfect.Rachel was our server and she also was so friendly and did not make us feel like we had to hurry to make room for others. It is a gem in Hayward. \

Located in the heart of downtown San Jose Billy Berk's offers a great menu, good quick service and a fun atmoshere. We went before seeing a movie at the big downtown theartre. They fit us in a little before a reservation ad got us feed just in time for the movie.

BIN38 was AMAZING. The food was awesome, the service was awesome, the wine & beer was awesome - IT WAS AWESOME. The menu is diverse enough to be interesting but not in the way that the restaurant came off as trying too hard. It was perfect.
A little disappointed in the service and the level of food quality. For the prices the food was not that good. This was our anniversary dinner and was not very special.
The waiter suggested the beef bourguignon and it was fabulous. We tried the french onion soup and the pork rillettes as starters and they were very good too. We will definitely go back.
The food was mediocre and portions ridiculously small.

The place was empty, though it was a rainy Halloween night, but the food was delicious! My dining companion and I split the pear salad, the burger and the fish and chips. The fish and chips were perfectly cooked, nicely seasoned and some of the best I have had in the bay area. Give it a try, it will not disappoint.

Fresh ingredients,dishes prepared with care, varied menu, great wine list - and always leave room for dessert. We've not been there when there is not a line waiting for a table, so we always make sure we make a reservation. Even when all tables were full, we've never felt rushed. Whether it's chicken, fish, pasta or the wonderfully prepared lamb, any choice is sure to be the right one. Let's face it, we all have friends with questionable palates, but here even picky eaters have ample selections from which to choose. We return again and again.

column4: 160 Jefferson St, Upper Level San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: The food is delicious and the service is outstanding despite being a very busy tourist dining spot and attraction. The view of Alcatraz Island and the Bay is absolutely beautiful. I highly recommend making dining reservations - particularly if you go during a holiday time or on a weekend. There can be long lines of people waiting for stand by dining; however - when I made a reservation, the staff seated me and my guests promptly. It can get noisy because of how busy the bistro is with tourists. If you're looking for a more quiet and mellow time, best time to visit is during the off-season and on a weekday or evening when people are not on vacation. Dinner time can be romantic because of the ambiance of the restaurant and the wharf.
What more can I say about this restaurant than the absolute best...went there for a birthday and had a wonderful meal from the beef cheeks to the escargot....to just everything...
Outstanding food and service. Ambiance is romantic and a little lively at the same time to create a very comfortable and entertaining experience. Great choice for any occassion.

Having been to Bistro Ginolina many times we looked forward to our last visit.I hope it was just a bad night but the food and service were just horrible.My piccata was soggy and bland and my husbands fish was dry.With all the wonderful Italian restaurants in the county we will not be back any time soon.This all makes me sad as we have liked this restaurant for so long and have, in the past, recommended it to friends.
I dream about the tomato soup in puff pastry!!!

A lovely place with delicious food. I got the lamb dish which was beautifully presented in a squash. The hot olives and salad were delicious, as was the bread. We were disappointed that there was no baklava after reading about how delicious it was. The service would have been very good, except for a bit too vigorous in wanting to clear the table. But the service was friendly and it was a very nice place.
Went for a late dinner on a Saturday evening. The French owner was very welcoming and will make you feel like you were in a French bistro. So was the food. Highly recommend.

column4: 641 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: loved everything , we felt we we were back in paris .

Wow. Wel ove finding great food wine in Marin and Vis a Vis is one of those places. Excellent everything. The owners really care about the whole dining experience. Everything was delicious. We will be back. Thanks

column4: 1011 Blossom Hill Rd. San Jose, CA  95123
column13: everything was so perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It was the perfect half-way point to meet up with our kids for Thanksgiving. The food was very tasty and they did not try to rush us out the door even though it was a holiday. We will be back.

We went on Thanksgiving eve. (5:00 pm) The hostess was very busy. She had help, checking in the guests, they were very polite and greeted us with smiles. There was a 20 min. wait,so we walk over to the bar and had a very good drink, and before we finished, we were called to our table. The manager came over and had our drinks delivered to the table and our waiter was there to greet us. Everything seem to run so smooth even though they were very busy, we felt special. We ordered a thanksgiving dinner including pumpkin pie. (which was served by the manager) It was delicious and we had so much we took leftovers for the next day. Yes, I certainly would recommend Black Angus can you image dinning there when they were not so busy! GREAT . . .

column4: 3195 N. Main Street Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: Tough meat. 1970's retro appetizers somewhat inedible.
I have always enjoyed the service and food at Black Angus.Have not been disappointed once.

column4: 740 E. El Camino Real Sunnyvale, CA  94087
column13: Great place to celebrate thanksgiving dinner without doing any cooking or cleaning.
Staff at restaurant was very friendly. Good service and good food. Drinks were average, took a strawberry daiquiri back, otherwise an overall good experience.

Went expecting a nice night out. Received home made potato chips which were yummy. It took a while to get served. My girlfriend ordered a salad that on the menu said "Mixed Greens" When the salad came out it was iceberg lettuce. We let the waitress know and she came back mentioning that it was iceberg and romaine and was mixed greens. The Meat on the salad was extremely tough. I ordered a hamburger and took one bite and noticed that the toppings I ordered extra had not come on my burger. The burger was good but was missing what I ordered. So I waited for my missing topping and by that time my burger was cold. We mentioned our experience to the one of 3 waiters/waitresses that helped us and finally got a refund.

Blackwood is still new and getting some bugs worked out. If they get it all worked out, it can become a highly recommend place in the Marina. Make sure you know what they mean by 'low', 'moderate' and 'high' spicey in food requests since they tend to put a bit of 'heat' into the dishes compared to others.

column1: Blowfish Sushi to Die For - SF
column13: The moment we entered the restaurant we were greeted immediately. We were ten minutes early for our 7pm reservation on Saturday,11/24. When 7 pm approached we were seated promptly. My wife & I ordered the popcorn prawns as our app. It was good, but I was hoping for some crunchy texture. I ordered the King Raffi, which is a sushi w/ spicy tuna,salmon, and panko sprinkled on top to add a crunchy texture. My wife ordered the crunchy CA. roll which was good, but I preferred my order. However, the service was a bit slow especially waiting for our check to arrive. Our waitress was friendly but being a Saturday night I can understand. If you're looking for a good place for sushi with an upbeat atmosphere then I highly recommend Blowfish Sushi.

column1: Blowfish Sushi to Die For, San Jose
column13: very disappointed, the food is not EVEN CLOSED to quality as SF

column4: 747 Market St, 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: This restaurant was a huge disappointment. From the description on Open Table, it sounded like heaven. When we arrived, we found you had to order at a counter and they brought you the food. Although a brunch was advertised, there wasn't any. I took a client there for lunch and was embarassed
Excellent food and service. Blue Agave is one of my favorites.

This has become my go-to restaurant for bringing out of town friends. The food is always great. I like the interesting wine list. While the food is always great, our service this time was not great. It took forever for her to take our order, and since the wait station was right next to our table, i found it irritating that she seemed to be avoiding us. She was not very helpful with picking out a wine either, as there were many wines that were unfamiliar to our group, and a little info would have been welcome. Great front desk people.
Service was excellent and the food consistently good. I brought a friend who had never been to Bluefin and she enjoyed the food and ambiance.

column4: ONE Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: This is our new favorite place. We were more than pleasantly surprised to find out that their butcher is in-house. I highly recommend the Chef's special meat tray and cheese tray. By far the best pairings I have seen in awhile! We will be going back many times.

I just loved the vibe of this steakhouse, very old school with an eclectic twist. Not trying to be hip or trendy, this place focusses on amazing service and amazing food. My father is in a wheelchair, when we arrived the staff had been made aware and had a perfect table set aside for us. I had forgotten what wonderful service looked like, after all-too-often encounters with smug waitstaff. Very refreshing. Will be back!

column1: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
column13: Great restaurant! Fantastic food and service. We will certainly be back.

We did not get our main course for over 45 minutes. Neither the busboy, the server nor the manager came to advise us that there had been a "mix up in the tickets". No apologies from anybody. No making amends until we asked. And we were still charged 18% gratuity because we had a party of 6. The server Alicia was definitely below par.

column1: Boca Pizzeria, Village Mall at Corte Madera
column13: Food and wine very good. Music too loud for a non-fast food restaurant.

This was our first time in Jack London Square and at this restaurant. We enjoyed a lovely Sunday brunch. Menu was pretty simple, but there was something for everyone and the food was very well prepared. You could tell that they used high quality ingredients and took care to make even simple items a little special. Delicious baked goods (best scone I've ever had), excellent coffee and very attentive, friendly service. Highly recommend Bocanova!

Traveling...looked for a good italian restaurant. Great find. Surprisingly empty. Glad I had my reservation . Service was great but not sure if that is because no one was there. Was able to watch the World Series game 1 in San Francisco.

Good and (Really) bad. I walked in with a reservation. A red-haired gentleman came forward and stared at me blankly and then directed me to take menus from a basket. He then said I had to go up to the bar to order. When I did, the "waitress/cashier" looked at me like I was stupid. She said "we don't serve that." When I raised the menu and showed her the item I wanted, she said "that is the wrong menu." I told her that I got it from the basket up front (like I was told), and she just gave me a different menu. I was stunned...not so much as an apology. I asked a waiter if there was a children's menu. The response? No, because we're remodeling soon. Huh? What? The food was pretty decent though.

My 3rd visit and I returned for the wonderful food, creative menu and excellent service. This was my first weekend visit and while I normally enjoy live music their choice of a combo that includes a brass instrument was a bad choice for such a small space. TOO LOUD. They should stick to just strings. While I highly recommend Bon Vivant on all other points, I would not recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet dinner on a weekend night.

column1: The Boon Fly Cafe - The Carneros Inn
column13: Great service, terific breakfast and lunch choices, great sausages, lovely local hot spot!!!
We booked at the last minute wanting a quick meal quite close to where we were staying. Service is obliging but a little slow. Our prawns were lovely but the lamb casserole was bland.

I easily got a reservation for 9 on a Saturday night earlier on in the week. This was a huge plus! Drinks were pretty good but I would have liked it if they had more wine options. They only had 1 red and 1 white!? Apps were yummy and we all enjoyed the lamb and chicken skewers. The seasonal vegetable was butternut squash, which unfortunately was very undercooked and unedible. Other then that we enjoyed everything!

Getting a reservation for 4 on a Friday night at the last minute was unexpected. The reviews on Yelp were promising and the experience met our expectations. The food was good, the service was friendly and the price reasonable. I don't know why it was only about half full on a Friday night, but it worked for our needs.
Bouche was wonderful! Great food, ambiance, and service. Highly recommended.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Good choice when you are attending an event,symphony,ballet,opera, etc in the neighborhood. Tasty Gumbo and other, like, choices. Casual atmosphere, prompt service.
Same as my previous review. The best place to host a casual or business lunch in the Milpitas San Jose area.
The green onion pancakes with peanut sauce are the best!
Best Chinese food in USA. The General's chicken is outstanding.
a nice quiet place for lunch for business or pleasure.

column4: 1050 Contra Costa Blvd Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: This was my first visit and if you could put 10 stars I would have given that. Our wait person was absolutely wonderful. The pianist was fabulous. Will be going aging to try the brunch. And the food and prices were great.

column4: 55 Tamal Vista Blvd Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: The short ribs ate the best meal I have eaten at a restaurant in Marin!
Nice for sporting events. Nice large TV screens for viewing.
elegant and wonderful restaurant, exceptionally warm and friendly service, terrific Thanksgiving meal.

This restaurant served very good food, but the tables are very close together and the noise level is very high. There was a large party in the restaurant and getting service was difficult at first. However, when we asked to be moved outside to escape the noise, the staff was exceptionally accommodating and the service was fabulous. We had a wonderful experience in the end. Even with the noise level, I would go to this restaurant again but not if I'm planning an intimate conversation.

We went for the Sunday brunch buffet and liked it a lot. The setting is very nice, with garden out back. The food was great - there was a seafood station with fresh BC oysters, housemade smoked salmon, huge shrimp and clams. Plenty of hot food such as bacon and eggs (and eggs benny w oxtail that was amazing), quiche, etc... and housemade breads and charcuterie and decent desserts. Was it worth $38.50 a person? That depends how much you value buffets and how much you eat - but we really enjoyed it and would go back. As a plus, we had our toddler with us and it was a perfect setting for him - he stayed occupied, he ate (free) and had a lot of attention from staff. Also, the staff was terrific, they really make you feel welcome.
Great place and awesome food. I loved it and can't wait to go back

The night we were there they had a live singer (maybe they have that every night). He was a good singer but perhaps more appropriate for a venue where one would go to hear music. We had gone to this restaurant to have a quiet conversation and instead were subjected to a singer walking around with a microphone with the volume turned up high. It was not very conducive to conversation. Fortunately he took breaks from time to time but then they piped in loud music.I would not return. The food was only fair.
Great place to get together with friends for food and drinks!

Bucca di Beppo is a famly tradition for our family; we celebrate all of our birthdays and special occasions there. The food is delicious and we always have a great time there. As soon as the waitstaff comes to the table, they ask if we are celebrating a special occasion and ensure that the party has a really nice time.I asked on Open Table for a quiet table as we wanted to talk and we were seated in a very quiet section. Our server, Eric, was great.

We went for Thanksgiving and were seated at a table for 2 when we had 3 people so we were uncomfortable and they wouldn't move us even though there were open tables. The turkey dinner was not very good at all...stick to what you do best, Italian food!!

column1: Buca di Beppo - San Jose - Oakridge
column4: 925 Blossom Hill Road Oakridge Mall Suite 1529 San Jose, CA  95123
column13: Wonderful Staff,Good food always love seeing all the "family" photos.
Always a great meal, wonderful service, and warm, inviting atmosphere. A great spot for holiday dining.

column4: 44 E Blithedale Avenue Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: We had early reservations for Bungalow44 and thought the restaurant itself was nice enough. I was a little disappointed in the cocktail, which seemed to be weak and watery filled with too much ice. The oysters were nice enough but pretty small. The mac n cheese was okay but not worth ten bucks. The rib eye was perfectly cooked but the cut of meat was a bit lacking. The burger and huge side of fries was very good as were the fish tacos that were the evenings special. Our server was fine but there was nothing of note to really make this an "experience" or drive me to return, but if I do I may go for the pizza.

column1: Buri Tara Thai Cuisine - Redwood City
column13: Some dishes good others average. Duck rolls appetizers tasted mushy ...obviously previously frozen and not completely fried through ....basically not edible.

I set up a dinner for a group of our friends to celebrate "Friendsgiving" over the holiday break. I wanted to pick somewhere where we would all be able to enjoy ourselves, have some great drinks and equally great food.

Service was laughable, but good enough for a quick lunch. The food was good, not outstanding, I'd go back. If you are looking for a knowledgeable staff who can deliver a superior experience you won't find that. If you are looking for decent food, reasonable price and rather quick then this is the place for you.

column4: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay Street San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Martini was great!!! View is nice, service was excellent and the food was wonderful. I would definitely return.

Third time there but the first two were events so we did not get the full menu. This last visit was nice I had the lamb shank which was a generous portion. My wife had the ravioli. Service was very attentive. We'll go back again. I would like to see a more expansive menu.

column4: 610 First Street Oxbow Public Market Napa, CA  94559
column13: Delicious roast vegetables, tasty pizzas and kind service
Cafe Bastille is one of our favorites. And, since we came for lunch - apparently early - at 11a, there was NO ONE else not only at the restaurant, but in the entire alley! We had a great time.

This place has changed hands several times over the years, so we decided to give this latest incarnation a try. We were not disappointed. The dishes were tasty. There was a good variety of selections in every category including many vegetarian options. The portions were generous without being obscenely huge. The wait staff was attentive. And they had a big case with a wide variety of gelato flavors to choose from for dessert. The dining room is small, but on a Tuesday night reservations were not necessary. I wouldn't bet on that being the case on the weekends though.
Food was great. Enjoyed our meal with a nice jazz quartet accompanyment. Would definately go again.

was looking forward to having escargot and caviar but both are no longer available due to lack of sales. ordered the roasted chicken which consisted of a breast and leg but didn't want the breast and asked if i could have a thigh. waitress came back and said the chef would give two legs. it was very good. also ordered the whipped potatoes and french fries. when the runner delivered them, he didn't say one word. so everyone at the table didn't know what the creamy dish was (turned out to be the whipped potatoes). later the ketchup and mayo came and the runner didn't say a single word. one would think the latter would go together with the fries. we also ordered the duck which was excellent. definitely would go back.
I have to say the service was great and the food was perfect.

Went for 1st time for wifes birthday. Wife had dumpling stuffed with seafood and I hadthe stuffed crepes both outstanding!! Started with salad that was large and ae to split.Will definitely go again and would recommend to anybody who lives close. Everything thatyou might have read or heard about this establishment!
Food and service are both exceptional. Top value for cost.
Renzo is a true culinary experience if you want fresh pasta cooked to perfection. Best prociuto in the peninsula.

This is the first time I have written a negative review. Three of us went for lunch and we were all disappointed. The two who had cheeseburgers and fries were unhappy with the dryness of the $15 item (even though they were order medium-rare); even the fries lacked punch and seemed dried out as well. The risotto for the third person was not very flavorful. In all, we decided that we would not be going back anytime soon as the food has gone downhill since our last visit.

Our group of five arrived early for our 7:30 reservation and were seated immediately by the manager. However, we sat at the table for at least 5 minutes without menus and anyone else approaching us. We finally asked for our menus and received them. There were several large tables being served in the inside dining room and the one next to us, about 10 people including three children were there before us and placed their orders before we were seated. Our table was served first and were about an hour into our meal before that table was served. My food was very good, but the overall service was slow and forgetful. We had to remind them and had to ask for water at least twice as the restaurant was very warm at times.
Have wanted to try Cafe Torre for quite a while. I wonder why I waited so long.

that was our second time,again the food&service was outstanding.very good wine listwith reasonable prices. now they are open on sundays and they have a 3 course prix fixe menu for $25 amazing.we love this place, very classy for san-mateo without paying big bucks.we will go back again very soon.
Food was amazing! Lots of options to choose from.
Had the pasta with scallops and prawns...awesome. Ate outside on their patio. Very good.
Stacey is hands-down the heart and soul of the restaurant. She made us feel at home and directed us on how and what to order.

Reservation ready at time it was made, all food correctly described and prepared. Sunday brunch on a holiday weekend can be a risk, but chef had all staff motivated and executing precisely on the line. Front of house active and attentive to customer needs. Online reservation requests with regard to seating type and location obviously read and listened to. Great location, food, service.

Five women went for a birthday brunch. We felt like royalty with warm muffins and scones at the table, bottomless mimosas in with lavender, rosemary or raspberry-orange flavors, and a full and delightful menu. Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious. There was also a bottomless bloody mary choice with an open bar to prepare your favorite selection. The restaurant is wide open and unpretentious, with an expansive outdoors patio ringed with lavender. The chef is experimenting with new menu items--this morning there was a crepe with duck eggs and butternut squash that was a huge hit with our group. All in all a wonderful experience.

My husband and I had the steak as well as the PAELLA' .This was a great choice as they did a great job on both of them. The Paella' is only a summer dish and so one would want to go soon.We did share both and would of even been great to just share the Paella'. We had a light breakfast and no lunch that day so this hit the spot perfect.Our waiter was awesome
Great food that arrived fast accompanied with supper service. Could not ashfor more!
We loved our meal; service was friendly and efficient. Can't wait to go back.

Japanese version of Korean BBQ, affordable, more variety, fun and tasty. Warm and helpful staff, nice selection of beers on tap and sakes to imbibe. Ambiance has potential if they'd just dim the lighting.
Casual, fun, very young crowd. Good food..gnudi, rabbit sausage pappadele. Good wine selection and attendance and fun service.

Friends have raved about lunch at Campton Place, so we decided to try it for lunch. Very nice ambiance, solicitous though somewhat leisurely service, rather limited menu, pricey, lovely presentation of the food, and (the decider) MINISCULE PORTIONS. In my opinion, very poor value. I would not return.

We stumbled upon this tapas restaurant while in the area, and how lucky we feel for having done so! Both the food and service were terrific. What a nice surprise. As an added bonus, we even managed to get out the door for under $100 - with wine. The chef/owner came out to chat with us before it was too busy. Very nice guy and I hope he does well - he deserves it for the food alone.
Some of the best food in San Francisco.

column4: 651 E Blithedale Ave Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: They were able to take our party of 9 and give us a private room. The noise was higher than usual due to the World Series but we were able to still hold a conversation due to the private room. We have been coming here for a couple of decades, minus the few years it was "Maria, Maria". Bringing back the old neighborhood favorite has proven to be successful. We LOVE the Cantina!
The food is delicious! Great, fresh pasta! I believe they were a little short staffed when I went, but pasta like this is hard to find!
Love sitting upstairs with view of restaurant. Great atmosphere.

everything was a positive, except for the first time we sat near the door and were cold all night. We were sitting by the bar and the noise level was not good. We will request a seat in the back next time. Our server Kim went beyond the call of duty.

For a couple of wandering visitors on Thanksgiving Day this place was an Oasis. They offered the traditional thanksgiving day meal but we chose to sample their seafood offerings. Oysters on the half shell and jumbo shrimp cocktail to start, followed by a roasted sea bass with saut spinach and mashed potatoes were a treat. The wine service was great.
Not your usual hotel dining. A creative menu with fine flavors. Consistently good food and service.
First time to Napa. My wife and I enjoyed dinner at Carpe Diem. She had the filet and I had the Ostrich burger. Both were very good. Truffle fries were amazing.

I love the food here, and the fact that everything is organic, ethically, responsibly and locally sourced, and prepared with care. The dishes are creative and delightful. The margaritas are sublime. The chips are fresh-made on site, and the dipping sauces are so interesting. I highly recommend this place. I will never get tired of it. Oh, and they are dog-friendly for patio dining!

Small but authentic French bistro, excellent food and value. Can be a bit noisy inside but if you can snare an outside table (which we did) it is plenty warm under the heat lamp and cozy. We had a lovely evening.

Never had a bad experience at Catch. I've been going to Catch for years and I think the food has actually improved this past year. I've ordered the Halibut several times and this last time was super delicious. Everyone else in our party had a fantastic food experience too.

column4: 3740 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: GREAT for big groups! They knew how to handle a big group, and on a short notice. They had more than one person helping us. We had an awesome time.

Loved it! We were unable to book a reservation at Flour+Water and were suggested to try Central Kitchen...equally delicious; different cuisine. Everything was beautifully presented and scrumptious. We felt welcome the moment we stepped in, answered all our menu questions, never rushed. Definitely returning!

Not as good as before. Heavy handed salad dressing with little flavor, heavy sauce on scallops, no more vegetarian options (mixed veggie plate is uninspired). Like the chef who comes around and the feel of this place but the food's not for me. Cleaner food with bigger flavor is preferred.
Sat beside a couple who were having a very intense conversation, which ruined the mood a bit. The food was great though and the ambiance as well.

column4: 1332 Park St on Redwood Square Alameda, CA  94501
column13: Wonderful find for Thanksgiving dinner in Alameda without having to partake in the traditional dinner faire. The prix fixe dinner (3 course) was a great value. Italian wine list is extensive. I will go back to see how it evolves during a summer eve, and brunch when the weather allows for outdoor seating.

Tucked into a small corner location, Caesario's makes the most of a small space. Great food, attractive decor, friendly staff. We eat a meal there each trip to SF. Many were eating the special Thanksgiving dinner (generous portions) which looked like a plate you would prepare at home--and most "ate the whole thing." I had a large salad with fresh garlic grilled shrimp: cold crisp greens, warm shrimp and a Louie dressing, a perfect end to the day!

column4: 845 Main Street Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Every time we visit, we are treated like cherished friends;even when the restaurant is bustling. The starters are always fresh and with a touch of imagination, so there is always something new to excite the taste buds. The smoked lamb shank falls off the bone and the pork chop also tender and juicy. Desserts such as the rich chocolate bar and panacotta are the perfect ending to the evening. Staff is friendly,professional which makes the evening very special. Wines are reasonably priced and a true gem is the Liquid Sky Cab.

column4: 405 N San Pedro Rd San Rafael, CA  94903
column13: Came here for Thanksgiving dinner with my husband and his parents who are in assisted living nearby. We were lucky to get a reservation, since many restaurants were completely booked. They only offered a limited menu because of the holiday, but the choices were excellent - lamb, salmon and beef, each with watercress soup and salad. All were delicious. The ambience was casual european and made very french by the boisterous group 2 tables down sipping wine and speaking in french. Things quieted down when they left. My only comment is that the room is small and requires walking up 2 steps to get to. A bit of a challenge for my father-in-law with a cane, but he managed. I highly recommend this place and would love to return.

I loved the decor and vibe of Chambers. Really has that retro 70s vibe with the records and motel-chic hotel to the side. It was really cute and loved being in the there. Our server was awesome. Very attentive and helpful with the menu. She was amazing.
We had an amazing dinner! Food and service on point.

I understand that the chef is French and that his significant other is waiting tables, but restaurants that charge as much as Chevalier does need to provide good service. The one-and-only waitress went out of her way to avoid looking at me, and acted put out when I stopped her one time during the meal with an "excuse me". Not really acceptable service when we were paying $150 for two people. Otherwise, the food was unique and enjoyable.

Delicious transport back to France. Cassoulet always good. Bone marrow savory and delicious. Lamb confit special was sublime -- best dish we've had all year. Perfectly cooked, sweet and savory, different textures, all artfully presented.

column1: Chez Papa Resto at Mint Plaza
column13: All the food was superb, the service friendly, and the ambiance pleasant.

My boyfriend and I came here for his birthday on a Friday night. We arrived at 8 pm with no waiting and dinner lasted two hours. The service was spectacular; an entourage of wait staff will serve you and make sure that your water is amply filled and your needs are met. One even reminded me of an English butler - love it! The ambiance was okay, but it did have a cozy feel as the place was a house turned restaurant. We're seated quickly next to a wall of mirrors, but you can request seating next to a window. We ordered the Gastronomique option without the wine pairing. That was my bf's bad idea as I prefer wine to go with all my food and maybe then I would't think that the food here was just okay...not memorable.

Absolutely fantastic all around! Will be going back for dad's birthday. Highly recommend this wonderful Italian restaurant. Food is AMAZING and the ambiance is wonderful. Only downfall is that there is no full bar but plenty of wine and two beers to choose from.
the cuisine was interesting , modern and traditional. loved the spare but warm room and the service was attentive and educated.loved it -will return.
Excellent cuisine....creatively prepared. excellent service.

Food was fine. I still haven't found the perfect French restaurant yet, but this one is pretty good. It's good sign when the staff speaks French too. If you're in a hurry, let the staff know; otherwise, your meal will be about 1.5 hours long for three courses.
We had a pleasant evening, although they need to soften the lighting and the food was bland.

i have heard so much about cin cin i was expecting to be blown away and i just was not.the good:we had a few nibbles and they had good flavor.the mint chip gelato was the best i have ever hadthe cons:i met a few friends and it was so loud in the restaurant we were screaming at each other just to be heard. between the obscure music collection that night and all the other people it was a little too much.at least twice the waiter had to come back and tell someone at my table cin-cin was out of whatever beverage had been ordered.the service was ok. our waiter seemed a little put out that we mostly ordered beverages.because i stopped in mostly for drinks with friends i will go back and test the full menu to be fair.

column1: Cindy Pawlcyn's Wood Grill & Wine Bar
column13: Never Disappointed with any of Cindy's restaurants. This was our first time dining at the new one. Everything was superb. The calamari was the best all of us had ever had. Great flavors with every dish that we sampled.

We visited last Sunday...we were the first to arrive; greeted warmly and seated within minutes. The restored hotel is delightfully decorated; light and airy. My husband asked for a type of wine they did not have...the maitre d' recommended a very nice, inexpensive wine from Portugal which we all loved. We tried the sauteed brussel spouts as an appetizer and they were outstanding! We even dipped the artisan wheat bread in the remaining sauce. My husband's oso bucco was very tender; the duck burger delicious, and the incredible tamale was very, very good with a much different presentation .. it was easy to eat because you did not have to undo the wrapper but rather the filling was placed on top of a crisp corn husk with the sauce on the side.
The restaurant had listed only 6:30 or 8:30 possible reservations and it was very empty the whole time we were there. Food is overrated.
Food was great, the setting was perfect, our waiter was very knowledgeable.

column4: 55 Cyril Magnin Street San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: They lost our Opentable reservation for Thanksgiving. After a wait, they found us a small table in the corner, then served us a $75 buffet dinner.

Appetizers just soso..."little gems' salad underwhelming...would not repeat it. Service totally right. That made up for the food.We liked the small intimate setting..quite enough for conversion. Price point was good for such a nice place.

column1: Clay Oven Cuisine of India - San Mateo
column13: On Friday night, the restaurant was very relaxing place to dine for a family with a small child. The food was delicious and we were very satisfied.
I read horrible reviews for this restaurant. We had great service and the food was delicious. Glad I don't always go by the reviews.

column1: Clay Oven Indian Restaurant - West Portal
column4: 385 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: My husband and I have enjoyed having lunch at this restaurant many times. White tablecloths, quiet, clean and can talk without a lot of loud background noise.

column4: 18070 San Ramon Valley Blvd San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: My breakfast at Clementine's was good, hot, fast, and plentiful. i had the Down South Denver Omeletter (andouille sausage, peppers, onions, and jack cheese) with home fries and toast. It was all tasty and the server was very friendly and attentive. I'll definitely try it again.

column4: 350 Smith Ranch Rd San Rafael, CA  94903
column13: Great place for lunch, especially on a nice day. Great selection of salads and the specials are almost always very good.

This was my third visit to Co Nam - two dinners and one lunch. We sat at the bar the first time and met the bartender/owner who was very helpful and enthusiastic about his food, making recommendations, etc. The food is excellent and there are always specials in addition to the menu. I had one lunch and another dinner at the table. These were all excellent - food, service, ambience and drinks! I will definitely go back as we live in the neighborhood. This part of Polk Street desperately needed something of this caliber with a hip and friendly vibd. I hope it is here to stay. It is friendly, well thought-out, inventive and extremely delicious.
This was our first time dining here and it was AMAZING! The food and ambience were superb. I would definitely dine here again!

The service to begin was very un-rushed. Shakir took time to make sure the rye we wanted in our our cocktail was acceptable by offering a taste first, which did change our mind. The food was fresh, hot and creative. I would definitely go back and send friends!

We've been going to Hyde Street Bistro for over 10 years now. We were surprised that it changed to a rotisserie menu, because we loved the French menu that was in place before. If you're a vegetarian, this is not really the best place to go. There were only two items on the menu for vegetarians: butter lettuce salad and butternut squash soup. Overall, our meal was good, but we're not sure we'll go back as our celebratory place to go to, as we've done for the past 10 years. Also, a new change for us was Philippe, the sincere and friendly maitre d'. He's no longer there and this was very sad for us. He was always a prominent reason for our visit. He treated us with such care and sincerity.

Very understated but well decorated restaurant to make us feel like being invited to someone's home for dinner. Most dishes were beautiful to look at and tasty to pellets but a few misses such as oyster dish is too strong to taste bud. Great dining experience overall.
The food is good but nothing special. It is quality food and prepared well but fairly standard fare.

column1: Colombini Italian Cafe & Bistro - Nob Hill Hotel
column4: 835 Hyde Street Suite B San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: I recommend this restaurant with hesitation only because the service was poor. It is a cute little place and the food was very good. We had the spaghetti alla carbonara and pasta putanesca, which were both tasty and had perfectly sized portions. There was one server for the entire room, and we waited almost 15 minutes to ask for our check. We felt like she was ignoring us, and then when I got up to find her, she was texting on her phone behind the counter. If you have time to wait and are looking for good food, I would give it a try, but if you will be easily annoyed, then go somewhere else.
Absolutely one of the best restaurants we've ever been to. Great food, exceptional service.

Attended for elderly birthday. Requested beforehand but restaurant forgot to provide special birthday dessert treatment that they had agreed to. It was too awkward once at the restaurant to remind them. No scenic view offered; ambiance not greatly appealing for such an expensive restaurant. Meal is set with several small offerings all of which were generally good but not very filling.

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in sf! As a professional chef that works in the" biz" I am always impressed! It blows away all of the other big name restaurants away, definetly has a wow factor to it and is an adventure with texture and flavor! I highly recommend any gourmet foodie to get the tasting menu!
Don't let the modest appearance throw you off....the food is thoughtfully prepared with wonderful ingredients and the service was very friendly, attentive and seamless.
Had a great time. Food and service were exceptional. Thanks
Food is always fresh and tasty!
Right on the strand, this is a wonderful place to eat, with plenty of vegetarian options to boot. Cheers Ms. Weir, well done!

While not very creative, the food was good and nicely prepared. The "solarium" dining room lacks in personnality and could use a coat of paint. The heating system was not working on the night we visited the restaurant. When I reserved, I mentioned about celebrating a birthday, but non one cared to do anything about it.

It was my first time ever having Thanksgiving in a restaurant. I was hesitate to order the turkey, but then my son and I decided to give it a try. We were more than pleased with our dishes. The turkey was very moist and flavorful and so was andouille sausage stuffing. The warm ginger cake was wonderful. As always, the service staff was efficient, attentive and friendly.
Great food, ambiance, vibe, location, and service. Five stars for each category.
We have our annual tradition of Crab fest and shopping! Great spot for memories.

column4: 260 Capistrano Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Was surprised that a 20% tip was tacked onto the bill since no mention was made either by the server or in writing.

From the bread to the wine to the entree, Credo gave us everything we wanted and needed. After a long, rather stressful week, we were looking for a place where we could relax and just enjoy each other and some delicious food. The decor made us smile and kept us engaged - in particular we loved the quote from Stephen Colbert. The fresh baked bread was out of this world and we ordered the most comforting of comfort foods from the menu and they were perfect. Our server took great care of us and everyone was just wonderful. It was exactly what we needed and we left with huge smiles.

column4: 544 West Alma Ave. San Jose, CA  95425
column13: We went to Creekside on Thanksgiving, mainly because they were one of the few restaurants still showing open reservations (first clue). The menu looked great and everything sounded fantastic, although the prices were a bit high, if the food was good then it would be worth it. I ordered the house Prime Rib special. The salad came swimming in dressing with deep fried croutons, my prime rib had rainbow hues, the veggies tasted like they had been frozen and the "garlickey" mashed potatoes were flavored with garlic powder, it was so horrendous. I cut off a ton of fat, and spit out several large chunks and the manager still only discounted it 50%, saying I "ate" half of it, really bad customer service.

column4: 344 El Camino Real San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: Really like this place. A bar would be awesome but I know it's a small place. I still recommend.

The only thing keeping me from checking "very good" for the overall experience was the fact that we had gnats circling our food the entire meal. When I mentioned this annoyance to our server, she just responded "I know".
Food was good and service was friendly, but not sure I would go out of my way to go back unless I was in the area with no other options. Decor was very nice.
We enjoy the wonderful hot bread that greets us. The food is always delicious and the wait staff is warm and friendly.

column4: 845 Market Street, Suite 400, Westfield San Francisco Centre San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: What a find! The mozzarella and brussel sprouts was devine. It was warm, lemony and served with toasted bread. I have to say that the pizza was better than the ones I had in Napels this year. I can't wait to go back.
This intimate, charming restaurant with wonderfully-prepared food is a joy. The menu isn't daring but everything is perfectly done. The wines are reasonably priced. A great experience overall.

Daffodil might have been great in its day, but that day is long gone. The interior is stuffy and outdated, which might contribute to the empty dining rooms. The menu offers fine selections, but the entrees are over- or under-seasoned and less than delicious. Nice affordable house wines.
Our waiter,David, was exceptional, friendly and we felt like locals who would dine there just to say hello friend.

column4: 6025 W. Las Positas Blvd Pleasanton, CA  94588
column13: The place was happening with locals on Saturday night. Small place with warm atmosphere. Great food and service.

Had five of us, with an anniversary to celebrate. They brought a 3-candelabra to the table with a single, complimentary dessert. Food was really good, and service was really efficient, but not overly friendly. Will go again.

The menu is set up in the classic Italian order of Anti-pasti, Pasta, Main, and dessert. However the portions are so large that you are stuffed after just two. Recommend limiting how many courses you choose.
Amazing food, really friendly staff. Can get really noisy, though. Due to a large, very loud group, we asked to be moved to a table in the bar area and they were very accommodating.

column4: 202 Grand Avenue South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: service was poor to say the least, there was no interest by the waiter in pleasing us
Food was very good and so was the service. Very warm atmosphere. Attentive servers.

column4: 210 E. Main Street Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: The coffee continues to be weak. We were disappointed since we had mentioned this in a review in January. Otherwise the appetizers and entrees are exceptional. The service is exceptional. Desserts we did not like as much as in January. Changes have been made and not for the best. Go back to your earlier dessert menu/preparation please!
Excellent authentic Italian food. Owner cooks himself. Good pastries, too!

column4: One Letterman Drive, Bldg D, Suite 150 San Francisco, CA  94129
column13: Ate here the night after Thanksgiving and the place was very, very quiet. It is enormous, so it was a little disconcerting. Specialty cocktails ($12)were quite good - derby cooler and the old-fashioned. The menu read a bit fussy, especially desserts. Started with deviled eggs w/fried chicken liver - egg was ice cold and filling very bland, luckily the chicken liver was divine. Sunchoke soup interesting but tepid & not worth $13. Tossed salad w/Tasso ham quite good. Entrees ($24): halibut excellent but my grilled rabbit with bacon had little flavor and arrived cold - had to flag waiter & send back for reheating, so spouse had almost finished halibut by the time it came back. Desserts had too much going on so we skipped. Service just adequate

Good German fare with a hint of Czech. Very good service. The beer was very good. We enjoyed a nice rich dark. Dishes were tasty and mostly traditional. DJ's is a smaller establishment but comfortable. Would recommend a trip to DJ's. Oh by the way, plentiful of convenient parking.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: My friend and I have been to several brunches before the opera at this restaurant. We like the relaxed feeling and somewhat unusual dishes . Last week we had a breakfast pizza, which comes with two sunnyside up eggs on top. We enjoyed it and it was easilyenough for two. It's definitely not a restaurant with an attitude, thankfully, but more like a sort of hang out with friendlystaff. Also, one of the best bloody Marys in town.
Had my best lunch ever. The food was outstanding and the service was great
It pains me to give this negative review, because this used to be my all-time favorite restaurant. The food was really bland and mediocre and thoroughly disappointing. Not planning on coming back.
Dosa was yum. You would never have anything but a great meal here.

On the day before Thanksgiving, I was promised they would have a special vegetarian main course on the menu for Thanksgiving dinner but when I arrived they did not have it. It was too late to go elsewhere and if it hadn't been Thanksgiving, I would have gone elsewhere. I made do with sides.
Excellent food and service. No complaints.
good place for business lunch..food is ok not spectacular.

column1: Duck Club at Lafayette Park Hotel
column13: All the dishes we were served were outstanding, the service prompt and attentive without annoying interruptions such as "how are you enjoying your meal" (I was until you asked!) But for our purposes (I have a hearing loss as so many septuagenarians do) I loved the ability to actually hear what my tablemates were saying.

When you walk into Effie's, it looks like an all-you-can-eat diner, along with a slight funky smell. Dated interior with red vinyl booth seating, old carpet and faux-mirrored ceiling. There was a small outdoor seating area off the parking lot that might have been better. Since there were very few other diners (Saturday night at 7 p.m.), it was very quiet so conversation was easy. The food and service were fine but even so we will not be returning.
Always perfect ! Try the Sanchez although its called something else now but most servers know what it is from when it was at the outlet mall.

Friday night reservation @ 18:30 for two. Very busy when we arrived with several people waiting for tables. Slow service, waiter kept saying he was sorry there was a big party in the restaurant but in reality he had too many tables to take care of. Took 50 min. to get our food. Prices were low but food was just OK. I had the prawn tacos, shrimp instead of prawns, taste was OK but hardly any shrimp in the meal. Wife had chicken mole, she is a mexican food fan, she wasn't impressed. Beer was $4.50 for a ice cold 16 oz. Dos Equis which was great. Place was crowded with seemingly happy customers so they are doing something right, but we'll continue trying different places and won't be returning.

I'm a huge fan of Moroccan food, so I'm a tad biased, but this place was quite good. Great decor, friendly and attentive staff, excellent food. And of course the whole experience was made especially notable by the belly dancer who performed. She was quite talented, and did an excellent job of engaging the customers; thereby creating a group experience unusual in a restaurant.
El Paseo is so charming and has a really beautiful ambience. The food and service are also outstanding. Great place for a romantic date night!

column4: 2049 Fillmore St @ California San Francisco, CA  94115
column13: Good food. Fun ambiance. Staff, not very friendly.
we love this new Rockridge restaurant!
The only problem was we were seated in a table that the direct sun was in my eyes. They should invest in some shades for when the sun is hitting certain areas of the restaurant.

In general we had a very nice time at this restaurant. The food waas great and the service good. We were disturbed, however, by our neighboring diner who talked on his cell phone in Chinese for 15 minutes while waiting for his food to be served. We thought we were daved when the food came, but he started eating while he was talking! Soon, that proved fruitless and he gave up the conversation (whew!. We had a few laughs with the waiter about it, but I would have preferred if the resaurant had a policy of not using the cell phone (for phone calls) at the table.
Dining was very relaxed and comfortable. The service was very attentive, but not so much you felt bothered. The food was unique, the flavor combinations amazing. I would definitely go back again.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This restaurant is very over-priced for the quality of food. Even with a $25 off coupon and bringing our own wine, the bill was still over $150 for 2 people. It's obvious that they're trying to cater to a sophisticated clientele, but the service is attempting to be overly formal, but it comes across as unfriendly and insincere. I would be okay paying $150 if the food were better, but the majority of the meats are lacking the proper seasoning and some were downright dry/mealy. I've been to other Brazilian Rodizio restaurants and this is by far the least satisfying. Spend your money instead at a nice steakhouse or sushi restaurant.

column4: 710 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Enjoyed this venue better than the SF venue

column4: 99 East San Fernando Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Enjoyed the experience since the food was good, but portions were small. I order the Shrimp Scampi and only received 4 shrimp. I really enjoyed it, but was still hungry. Steaks were small also. They were out of a lot of items on the menu such as the hen, which my husband wanted to order and the gnocchi. A little odd for a Saturday night. Nice experience but they need to either increase their portions or cut their prices!
In a City known for great Chinese food, Fang is another solid contender.
Excellent, thoughtful and well designed food. The service was excellent although a little on the pretentious side for San Francisco, they could drop it down a notch.

Based on the reputation of Farina and an appreciation for Ligurian food, I was somewhat satisfied with my experience dining here. Pasta dishes are good (particularly the mandilli pasta with genovese pesto) but primi piatti starting at $24? Foccacia de recco--also quite good but for $18?. On a critical note, all dishes were heavily salted and the prices are quite high. As someone wrote in a revievw I read: "good food at absolutely unreasonable prices." Service was attentive but a bit rough around the edges. Would probably not return except to try the pizza and wine at the bar.

Four of us dined at Farm. We all ordered the evening's tasting menu ($95 w/o wine). The evening's theme was pumpkin, admittedly a tough road for the chef. Overall the food was barely successful. The dishes could best be described as "clunky"....well cooked, well presented, but with only the exception of the pumpkin soup...in the end....more "interesting" than "tasty". The soup was good. The only really poor dish was the (second) dessert...an odd concoction of pumpkin, cranberry sorbet and dried brussel sprout leaves. I never leave a dessert on the plate, but I did that night. It is a pretty restaurant with good and well trained staff. It was very empty...but it was the Sunday after Tgiving. Honestly, I would not go out of my way.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Truly enjoyed the experience with my 12 yr old daughter. Although the area didn't seem safe at first we felt comfortable once we were there. Definitely will visit again. The food was amazing!!!

The menu highlights include items that are too infrequently served at most restaurants, such as venison loin and rabbit. Sauces and seasonings are subtle but delicious. Portions are fairly small and not overly rich, which makes it possible to enjoy four courses.I would fault the menu for neglecting vegetables, which are served in very small quantities and play only a supporting role to the protein items. Considering the restaurant's country setting and the fact it has its own vegetable garden, I found this neglect surprising. It would be great to see some vegetarian and vegan items on the menu and more plentiful servings of vegetables with the meats.Still, I would return for the ambiance and the deliciousness of what is offered.
The menu is varied and satisfied a diverse group. Everyone enjoyed the food and the ambiance. Our waiter was efficient but not very personable.
Did not have my reservation time correct. Somehow pushed it back but made it work anyhow.

I have always loved Faz, Danville, ever since I first dined there about 15 years ago. The food was always good, and the service was exceptional. But this last dining experience was disappointing. The ambiance and service were still exceptional, but the food was really below my expectations. I had the sea bass special, and the fish was overcooked. My brother had the parpadelle, which was a tad too al dente. My niece had the lamb shank, and it did not have much flavor. I really hope that this was an off night, or has the chef been replaced? I'm willing to give it another chance, but if I am disappointed again, I will not be returning.

Did not realize this was in a hotel when we made the reservation. Nevertheless, the food was good and we enjoyed happy hour at the bar, with good and plentiful hors d'oeuvres. We wanted a place with a nice bar to meet someone, and this place fit the bill. We would come here again when in the area.
food good but pricey - think it's because they're on passport card... just my thought

They have heat lamps, but they need to actually use them. We attempted to sit outside, but it was too cold at our table while a bunch of heat lamps remained unused, on a Friday night no less. Outside sitting is always better, but when it's unpleasant, a consensus builds with the group to "just move inside." This is an automatic negative for the group and not a very economic use of resources for the restaurant. Perhaps have the meriachi band take up the task as they move table to table? It would make sense, we enjoyed their music and gave them a tip...

My wife and I enjoyed our Saturday night dinner at Fifth Floor very much. But we had difficulty with the menu. I think they're trying so hard to offer creative and innovative preparation that they lose touch with the basic dining experience. I got the sense that their focused on the foodies who order the tasting menu. Our food was very tasty, but sometimes it was difficult to know precisely what we were eating. I would recommend Fifth Floor for someone who wants an unusual dining experience.

column4: 5100 Clayton Rd Suite A14 Concord, CA  94521
column13: Excellent food, service and ambiance. Everything on the menu is great!

Very good for vegetarians as there were several entrees and salads. The food was very fresh and well seasoned without a lot of salt. I had not been there for a number of years, but will put it on my list of regular " go to" when dining out in the city.
Small relaxed dining room with fantsatic local food and wine. We had the southern fried chicken and the ribeye special - both were fantastic.
Our server provided us with excellent service. She made our experience memorable and delightful. The food was prepared perfectly. We will be back.

Typical Fisherman's Wharf dining spot. Can seat hundreds but only a dozen or so were there on a cool November evening. Abalone was good considering how hard it is to find these days, but the crabcake was quite subpar.
Better for lunch. Dinner menu was limited and fussy. They would not make an adjustment to to chef's concept of the dish

column4: 10151 N. Cabrillo Highway El Granada, CA  94018
column13: Flavor is a great dinig place. We have gone there several times now and we have yet to have a bad or so so experience. The food ranges from good to exceptional especially their specials. The atmosphere is relaxed and the servers are good and very personable though the service can be a bit slow at times. But that is a minor complaint. It would.not stop me from going there again. They also have a wonderful back room which is great for a bigger group. We had a gathering of friends and family in that area and it was so conducive to a great evening. Everyone commented how good their meals were even though many of us had different dishes.

column4: 3607 Alameda de las Pulgas Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: The diversity of the seasonal menu, the quality of ingredients, the presentation of the meal and the excellent service provided by the staff have always made for a rewarding anddelightful dining experience at the Flea Street Cafe. I frequently recommend it to friends and to those who are searching for something special and unique in the world of fine cuisine.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Palo Alto
column4: 180 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: iF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR MEAT EXPERIENCES THIS IS A PLACE.WE TOOK FRIENDS FOR DINNER AND EVERYONE WAS VERY IMPRESSED.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Walnut Creek
column4: 1685 Mt. Diablo Boulevard Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: slow service, nothing special from waiter. For the caliber of this restaurant not up to par.Have been there two other times, good service and food. May not return.
We went to Flora for Sunday brunch. The service was a bit slow and the guy at the table next to us was watching a video on his cell phon

I enjoyed eating here, and the food was good. I did order my hamburger medium-rare, which means slightly pink on inside, but it arrived well-done, not pink at all. So if you want it slightly pink, ask the waiter how it should be ordered (also, it was an open-face sandwich style, which is not the best way to serve a hamburger.) Aioli for french fries could have been kickier. There were four dessert choices, but as a dessert person I think five would be better. The orange pot de creme was very good, but portion could have been a little larger. Attractive setting and friendly, efficient service.
This was located in the touristy area of Pier 39, but it was better than expectedIt is a bit pricey but the food and service was good enough to warrant it
Excellent. only downsdie was waiting 30 minutes for table beyind reservation time--stay however made up fro it by constant check in and reassurement
Calamari was cold. Crabcake sandwich was like cheese-toast with very strong cheese.

Had a wonderful time celabrating our 22nd anniversary.Everything was perfect!From the clam chowder, the warm sof bread, the rib-eye steak and balckened salmon (which wasn't on the menu, but our waiter Brian asked the chef if he could prepare it for me since I was craving it). The deserts, creme brule' and a chocolate cake were divine. Brian helped us pick out a wine which was great as well. Thank you Forbes Mills for always being reliable.

column4: 206 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: An anniversary dinner at Forbes Mill is a special occasion. From the ambience to the wine list and excellently prepared food, Forbes Mill is such a treat. I'm already looking forward to my next meal there.

A great restaurant to take visitors to and to enjoy when you are in the mood to head to Fishermen's Wharf. The food is very good and the service and view is outstanding. Yes, it is in a tourist area but sometimes it is just fun to play a tourist in your own city.

Food could be even better. Interior space is outstanding. Now take the food and service to the same level, with the thought that was put into the ambience and you will have a wait list that gets the food critics attention!

This place needs to mature - the service is inconsistent, and the table choices vary a lot. If you happen to be seated near the front door, you will be subjected to frequent blasts of cold air like we were.
Everything was tasty, veggies especially nice for the holiday. Turkey and Prime Rib was yummy! Chai Tini to start made it a very festive day.
Dinner at Fresca was very good. Delicious food.I went wiht my friends to taste Peruvian food, so they enjoyed ceviche, anticuchos and others.

column4: 24 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: This is one of my neighborhood gems! I always enjoy my experience here. It is a small restaurant which can get very loud with chatter ... so it may not be the place for a quiet meal but the food is definitely delicious and never disappoints.

column4: 5755 Mountain Hawk Way Santa Rosa, CA  95409
column13: I can not say more than I wanted to order another plate of the same thing. It was heaven. I had the hanger steak and it was cooked perfectly. It came with swisschard which I don't like and the waitress offered me some awesome roasted vegetables that if I had my choice I would swim in a vat of them they were sweet and cooked perfect and the mash potatoes were creamy and tasty. I know Lisa from having a restaurant where I used to work for the owner of Montgomery Village and she has another gem here. I will not only go again and again but I will go for take out as well. I urge you to run to Fresh it is amazing and they have lots of goodies in the take out kitchens as well. Great great place!Mary Ann Sawyer

Fringale is one of our neighborhood favorites. This time the meal was especially fine. Wonderful Endive/Watercress salad. My duck and my wife's sea bass were both cooked to perfection. Nice to see that they have kept up the quality after all of these years.
Fun place! Interesting menu and everything is so tasty! If you like fried greens (and other fried goodies!) then this is the place! Service superb and ambience enjoyable!
As an employee of the Hilton (right around the corner) I love how the staff treats me and my guests! WONDERFUL restaurant and very attentive staff!
The staff went out of their way to accommodate us for our special occasion.

column4: 2 New Montgomery St. San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: You can't find better then that ! It's so great !
Excellent experience this visit, very pleased, especially after my last visit three weeks ago where service was not particularly friendly or attentive.
Great location across the street from Berkeley Rep - convenient but nothing to write home about!

The food was awesome. Every item we ordered was perfect. Beet/avocado/grapefruit salad A plus. Trout, crabcakes, calamari, and the evenong's special pizza were equally outstanding. I would go back anytime. This is a gem.
Overall good food and nice place.

column4: 398 W. El Camino Real, #114 Sunnyvale, CA  94087
column13: food is great. Service is not that good. Food is served without plates. Had to ask for plates. Waited for 5-10 min to receive the plates.

We'd never noticed this place before, even having been to many other restaurants on this street. Found it on OT when looking for Japanese in Marin.Sushi and sashimi were good to excellent. Shime saba was flavorful and plentiful, but the uni was scarce and not as cold as we like. Toro and smoked sake were very good. Starters (miso, wakame and gyoza) were fine.Service was fast and gracious -- we were in and out in under an hour. Easy parking in the paid lot across the street.

The real deal neighborhood Italian restaurant. We were visiting from Southern California for an Oakland Raiders game and found this gem on Open Table. If you are local you already know how great this authentic Italian restaurant is. For us, this was a real find. I am from NYC and the antipasto, great salads, and mouth watering carbonara made our day.

Made a reservation for a family reunion of 14 and asked for the banquet room. Reservation was confirmed but was NOT told we couldn't have separate room (in use by another group). We were seated in the main dining room which made us feel out of place (probably not comfortable for regular dining guests).The service was a little slow and some got their food a bit after main group. It seemed they may have been short on chefs. BUT the server (Christine) was very attentive and did a good job keeping us happy despite delays and OUR changing a couple of orders.The food was very tasty, attractively presented and portions were generous(even had some left to take home). Combination of flavors/seasonings was excellent and food high quality.

the girl & the fig is a definite must visit. The waitstaff is attentive and knowledgeable of the menu and make good recommendations. The chef's take on a simple grilled cheese provides a comfort food in a restaurant experience. The range of choices is so varied that it may take a while to decide on what you want to select, but once you make up your mind, you can't go wrong. The chestnut soup, the brussel sprouts, the cheese/charcuterie plate, the wine/drink selections, the desserts - well, now I have to stop writing and go back because just thinking of it has made me hungry! If you're in the area to do some wine tasting, just remember that it's better to visit the vineyard tasting rooms on a full stomach.

Eh. The food was ok, nothing spectacular. Cocktails very very tiny for the money. The outside patio was pleasant on a warm fall night. However, the tables against the wall are on a serious incline, but could be easily rectified with shims so that tables don't slant downward. Why don't restaurants do this? Because they don't think from the customer's point of view.

column1: Glen Ellen Inn Oyster Grill & Martini Bar
column13: As always, the food is wonderful and the service was over the top!!

We chose the Gold Coast Grill for their Thanksgiving fixed price menu ($23)and based on the reviews I found on Open Table. The food was delicious. We enjoyed the entire experience and fully expect to go back again to order from their regular menu.
First time to new restaurant. Food was very good and service was attentive and informative.

An OK spot but there are much better choices currently in downdown Petaluma, as well as arriving in downtown Petaluma, every day. Would probably only go here as a last resort or if my guests weren't foodies.
Good food and service, at reasonable prices, though the menu could be a bit more extensive. I would recommend this restaurant to others.
Overall good experience but nothing special
Thank You, Thank You, Thank You. See you next year for our pre Holiday dinner.

We had a lovely brunch here for our 15th anniversary weekend, though we stayed in Yountville. It was worth the drive up to St. Helena. Though it was a cool fall day, the view overlooking the golf course was splendid with lovely landscaping and fall colors. The service was attentive (almost too much) and we were treated to an anniversary glass of champagne! May have been because they weren't busy that day; we ate a very late breakfast. Corned beef hash was unusual and the best I have ever had, anywhere. Eggs Benedict was perfect. Would definitely go back.

We are members and go since it's close to home. The food and menu was better before the newest owners took over. It's getting better but would like to see a bigger menu with some variance between lunch and dinner.

column1: The Grill on the Alley - San Jose
column4: 172 South Market St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: As usual, he food and service were terrific. We eat here annually with out of town relatives on the Saturday after Thanksgiving. This time we were seated in the semi-private dining area which turned out to be private as the other table set for 6 never was filled.

We ordered the sampler side platter and fried chicken with waffles. We got Mac and cheese, potato salad , corn and collard greens. The chicken had good seasoning but it was a bit dry. We also has grits which were supposed to have cheese. They were good but I didn't taste cheese. The Mac and cheese was good. The collards were bitter but ok. The potato salad was good but it tasted like store bought and the corn was canned corn with bell peppers. It was an ok meal but I don't think I'd come back.

column4: 19620 Stevens Creek Blvd, Suite 150 Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: The reservation in advance through Opentable was not useful actually, since we had to wait in line when we got there on time. They did not reserve the table for us. The food is a little salty.

column1: Hachi Japanese Fusion Sushi and Tapas (Sake Lounge)
column4: 1711 W. El Camino Real #B Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: This was our first visit to Hachi. The location is odd, right on busy El Camino Real and there is very little parking available in the lot shared with Domino's Pizza. The food was unusual as well as delicious. We had the opportunity to sample a number of tapas as well as a sake cocktail.

column4: 390 Capistrano Rd. Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: We have been visiting Half Moon Bay for a number of years now, and the Half Moon Bay Brewing Company is always one of our choices for dinner. We have never been disappointed .... either in service or food. We would recommend this to any of our friends.

The food was only OK. Great Happy Hour prices. Ambiance was mediocre (certain areas feel too out in the open and you can stare right into the kitchen where they have supplies piled up). At one point an employee came in and let her son run, loudly, around the entire restaurant. As a paying customer, I just wanted to enjoy my meal and undwind from the week. I'd probably stop by in the future and just sit at the bar with small snacks but it won't be my go to restaurant. The servers here are incredible and very on top of it.

column4: 101 Golf Course Drive Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Not necessarily a wine list but an amazing Sake list. The food and sushi is some of the best I've had in my life. Try Ken's Roll.

column4: Pier 39, Suite M.209 (Beach & Embarcadero) San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: Fantastic views of the bay, Alcatraz and the passing ferry boats. Food is decent, but a tad expensive. The sushi, yakitori, and dinner menus are pricier than better Japanese restaurants elsewhere. The best deal are the bento boxes and lunch specials for around $15 (available until 4:30pm). No complaints, since most restaurants in this area have similar high prices, considering it's a tourist spot. The salmon teriyaki was fresh and moist. Some of the rice on the California roll didn't hold together, probably made by a novice. Apparently the place doesn't get many customers, so it takes a while before a waiter shows up. Service was friendly.

We enjoyed Hana Zen. It's in a good location, and large windows look over the street from the 2nd floor. We were seated immediately on a Saturday evening. We ordered a variety of dishes, and the food was great. It's a nice, yet casual spot with fantastic sushi. Try it!

We went for Thanksgiving dinner, to give the cook a break. Thanksgiving was a prix fixe menu. Flavors were good, portions were good sized. The food wasn't as warm as it should be, probably because of the amount of meals being served The prime rib wasn't worth the $10 up charge, it was under seasoned. We've eaten there before, ordering from the menu, and that would be the best choice..
We were here for Thanksgiving dinner. It was a very nice experience. Food, ambience, and service were exceptional. Highly recommended.
The food was very good and the service couldn't have been better. A tad pricey, however so plan ahead.

column4: 2100 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: Harris' is a tradition. It's a nice break from the "dress down" feeling of other establishments. Thanksgiving at a restaurant? If it's Harris', you bet! Whether you're a traditionalist who wants that turkey and stuffing, or in search of one of the best steaks and lobster in the City, this is the place. Save room for dessert, and make sure you take time with the wine list - there are some interesting domestic options. The staff is always friendly but not overpoweringly so. The ambiance and decor may seem it's from times gone by, but why let them go by? Stay the course Harris'. We need you around for a long time.
Best restaurant in Sonoma!A true "Wine Country" gem.

If the restaurant is busy service can sometimes be lacking and the orders might be backed up. We came when they were entertaining a large group so they explained to us that the kitchen was tied up, and service was fairly slow as well.

The service was so bad here I actually hesitate to call it service at all. After two hours we had only gotten our appetizers. When we asked about the rest of our meal, the waiter at first tried to say we hadn't ordered anything else, then said "Oh yeah yeah, it's coming."
