There was ONE chef/sushi maker, and he was moving SO slowly. He also clearly had not even started our main courses yet- AND THERE WERE ONLY 2 OTHER TABLES OF CUSTOMERS! We finally just asked for the check so we could go somewhere else and the waiter just said "OK"- he didn't even try to make it right! Then he STILL wouldn't bring us the check! After 30 minutes we just put some money down and walked out. My aunt was visiting- so embarrassed I brought her to this place.
Came here with a party of 9. Food was great, service impecable. One of our favorites!!!

column4: 2424 Van Ness St San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: The food has been consistently good for many, many years. Friendly staff and a quiet ambiance. You can actually have a conversation with your dining companions without shouting. What a relief!!! Much more enjoyable than going to State Bird Provisions with people shrieking.

Food is consistently delicious with a varied menu selection. Good waiters ready to attend all dining needs. This is one of our top three places to dine in Marin. The noise level is sometimes high which is expected near bar lounge area, but I am one who likes quiet dining.
Excellent food.Lots of vegetarian and vegan options.

column4: 1015 Alameda De Las Pulgas Belmont, CA  94002
column13: Had a delightful dining experience with grandson Daniel. Always a pleasure to dine at Hola's.

I have two kids under four and get out rarely. A group of friends and I decided to meet at Hopmonk to see the Steve Pile Band. We made reservations for dinner and the food was amazing. The diverse beer selection kept us interested, but the food was ready so quickly we had time to talk and laugh for an hour before the show. The music was fantastic and the bar by the stage was awesome. They had tarped the outside area and the decor was very festive and warm. We all had an amazing time. Thanks for making it count!

Hopmonk is our family's favorite gathering spot, accommodating myself in a disabled condition along with my electric chair. The food is always good, the ambiance is hip. And the staff are very friendly.
Awesome food. Delicious Southern style.

column4: 60 San Leandro Marina San Leandro, CA  94577
column13: Horatio's is our go-to family celebration Spotlight. Food quallity was far below our expectations this visit!

column4: Hornblower Landing at Pier 3 San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Finding the dock and figuring out what to do prior to boarding was a bit challenging. There's no official check-in area off the boat as you make your way through Pier 4. But once we were on, it was a delight! The service was prompt and courteous, the 4-course meal was thoughtful and prepared with care, and the live band performing didn't miss a beat. If you're looking for a cost efficient dinner adventure though, this is not for you. With tickets, meal upgrades and a few drinks with 20% tip, we were at $400! Hindsight, I would have optioned for another venue at half the cost, but if you do decide to cruise - make sure that's your final answer, because there's NO refunds.
Outstanding appetizers, salads, & entrees. Limited wine list. Small, bland dining room.

column4: 3055 Olin Avenue Suite 1005 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: The food and drinks were good but not so far beyond a much cheaper Aquis visit to warrant the sparseness of the presentation. No cheese or guac for fajitas w/o extra cost or substitutions allowed. No chips/salsa w/o extra cost. Waiter never refilled our water glasses and didn't have much description for his view on the menu (maybe someone new?). Band was good and other staff we talked to were nice. There weren't really any takes on specialty Mexican food that would warrant a specific return to this location.

column1: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
column13: I was looking for a restaurant with a good selection of fish entrees - this one has them all!!

The food at I squared is excellent: everything from the apps to the main course was tasty and fun. The stuffed cabbage was outstanding and their signature salad was great, as was the hummus and baba ganoush. The homemade ice cream and dessert was fantastic, too. The prices are reasonable and the quality and flavors are outstanding. The service was professional and charming. A full bar and a good wine list make this restaurant just about perfect! Enjoy!
Fantastic original Italian food. A true Italian dining experience.

Excellent service and very helpful wait staff. Food was of exceptional quality and prepared to each individuals specific tastes. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys a variety of food prepared with the best locally grown produce
More like an upscale chain than a dining experience which commands such high prices. Prices are similar tomthosebof delfina, zuni, etc!
We appreciated the special birthday presentation by the manager. Everyone enjoyed their food. Valet parking was excellent. We shall go again.

column4: 302 South Market St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Considering it was Thanksgiving, very impressed by the turkey dinner and had excellent service. Seated right on time. Our server was exceptional!

column4: 1430 Mt. Diablo Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: We had been to the restaurant several times for lunch and dinner. The food and service were good and consistent. The price was right. A really pleasant place to go to with a group or just the two of you. We will definitely go back.
Lovely place with lots of personality. Owner was very attentive to detail and friendly without being overly so.

column1: India Clay Oven Restaurant and Bar - Richmond District
column13: One of the few restaurants in SF open for Thanksgiving. The restaurant was only one quarter filled at 7 pm. The food was good and plentiful and the wait staff was excellent. Table linens were impeccable and the overall ambiance was very good. It was worth driving out to the Sunset to enjoy a good meal at a fair price.

They were very busy and I waited for the nan bread while my food was getting cold it came half way through the meal. There were some spicy dishes and the wait for water was even longer we had six people at the table but the food was stellar. Would I go back yes but not on such a busy day.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This turned out to be a terrific spot for a pre-opera (or symphony or ballet) meal. The food was delicious, and the wine list was quite nice and reasonably priced. The portions aren't large, so plan for appetizers, and some of those (soup in basically a teacup, small salad) weren't substantial either, although tasty. We all especially loved the sea bass over pearl couscous and salmon with French lentils.
While at the beginning the service was great it faded during our stay.It is a bar and great fun.

column4: 120 Sir Francis Drake Blvd San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: We went on Sunday to celebrate our anniversary. The food is good. But there is something off about the restaurant in general. It lacks a spark. Maybe it's the old fashioned sound system playing a random variety of music just audible - like it can't decide who it is. Maybe it's the lighting - a little too bright. Perhaps, it just caters correctly to its older clientele. In summary, our food and server were good but we probably will not go back.
Atmosphere was fabulous, service excellent and accommodating, Turkey luncheon was fantastic and sufficient to feed 2 people.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Great food, the prices can't be beat. We arrived for an early dinner and there was no one there, by the time we left the place was almost full. The food was great, my curry was excellent with lots of spice and heat. Loved the decor, a nice hip place to eat.

column4: 401 Main Street Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Aside from being seated next to the musical entertainment (guitar), whichmade it somewhat difficult to converse, ours was a very enjoyable meal.

column1: Jack and Tony's Restaurant and Whiskey Bar
column13: Good food and service, but the noise level is extremely high. Have a listen before you sit down, if it is busy or a large group is present.
Awesome service. Great food on first visit. 3 of 4 dishes ordered on second visit were poor. Insanely loud.

Frequently when I would take the #5 Fulton to USF, I would see this restaurant and think, some day, I must eat there. When I was looking for a place to dine with a long time friend, the description fit my requirements, so I made a reservation. Was I ever delighted. The house wine was delightful, as was the plate with pita and tabouli with babaganoush, hummus, and a carrot dip that was fabulous. The entree, eggplant stuffed with lamb, was also a healthy serving, which I enjoyed again for lunch the next day at home. Plenty of good food, conducive to conversation, and friendly service.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Outstanding. Our only quibble with the service was the fact that our cocktail order arrived at precisely the same time as the first course. This may be a small point, but in a great restaurant like this, and at this price point ($200 for two of us), it's not too much to ask to have a few minutes with the cocktails before the food starts arriving. That said, everything else was flawless. Service was prompt, efficient, and overall very professional (even the check came promptly!). All courses of the meal were delightfully inventive and delicious. Always a pleasure!

The restaurant was only half full when we arrived for our 7 PM reservation. We opted to have a drink in the bar and visit with our friends. We took our table around 7:45. By 9 PM, all other guests had left and the staff was repeatedly fussing with our table, in a poorly disguised attempt to usher us out the door so they could go home. Food was unremarkable. My pasta was desperately under seasoned and under sauced. My husband's scallops were over cooked and the sauce on his pasta had a gritty quality. Food was served very quickly and the waiter seemed bored and disinterested, totally lacking in warmth or any desire to answer questions. His skills would be better suited to a fast food counter.

We dined at John Ash for Thanksgiving and it absolutely lived up to it's exceptional reputation. Due to traffic two of our party where late and even though we had 1:30 reservations the hostess offered to allow us to sit at our table or wait in the bar. We chose to have drinks in the bar. The ambiance of the bar and restaurant is lovely. When set at our table, we were seated in an out of the way spot for the five of us allowing us to visit without distraction. The food was truly gourmet from the lobster bisque through to the pumpkin creme brule. The wine list is varied and the wine was excellent. The after dinner coffee was perfect. All in all a perfect meal. Just be prepared for the price tag. 5 People for lunch, $560.

column4: 2915 El Camino Real Redwood City, CA  94061
column13: veery good food, excellent service & attention to detail
John's Grill is a classic. The food is good and the staff delivers. The price is reasonable. We go every year during the holidays.

WOW, now I see why people in Calistoga rave about this place. Try the tasting menu. 4, 5 or 6 courses, your choice of anything on the menu. The octopus was flavorful and tender. Duck, rabbit and sweetbreads equally great. Next time I'm trying the lamb neck.
Good service, good food, good times. The decor could use some fixin' but definitely a great restaurant and will be back. Great value for the quality!
The restaurant could not find my reservation in their system

Right on Sebastopol's Main Street (easy parking a block away) this narrow high ceiled place has a lot to offer. A wide ranging menu, each item we chose was prepared and presented with care. We enjoyed a charcuterie platter and a Brussels sprouts slaw, both ample and satisfying. The two main courses, a chicken piccata and the halibut, had plenty of tasty vegetables along side. We shared a creme brulee, ever so creamy with that signature crispy sugar atop (it was a little too browned for me).

column4: 201 South B. St. San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Everything was delicious and the service was excellent. I would definitely go back to Kingfish.

Krua Thai provided a pleasant blend of good service and excellent food. The pad thai was deliciously sweet and savory. The Krua Thai sampler platter was a perfect starter at an amazing value. If you find yourself with a Thai craving in the Mission, Krua Thai will certainly provide the cure.

We went here on Nov 24 and had the best dinner ever! I had both specials of the night, the risotto cakes with mushrooms and salmon with braised cantinelli beans! My husband had the veal scalopini. It was a little on the salty side, by he loves capers! It's worth asking for if its not on the menu specials. I loved all the dishes sooooo much.
Love this place, this was my 4th visit. Pasta's are fantastic.

First time visit for me, but not for the other guests. Very quaint atmosphere; would be wonderful for romantic date. Overall, the salads and the pastas were all very good. The pasta with the spicy arrabiata sauce was a bit too spicy for me, but still delicious. Service was very attentive throughout the evening. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and she thought they might just bring a scoop of ice cream with a candle on it. We were all very surprised when they brought out a beautiful tiramisu dessert with 3 forks!! Will definitely come back here.
Domniguero chicken was some of the best prepared chicken I've ever had a restaurant and guacamole sampler was excellent! Good service too, would definitely recommend and return.

Food was excellent. We had the seafood paella and the lobster paella, along with the beef empanada and the lobster bisque soap. The biggest down side is the portion. It's small for what they charge. If you have a hearty appetite, plan on ordering two large plates and some extras.

column4: Hilton Santa Clara 4949 Great America Parkway Santa Clara, CA  95054
column13: This is a nice place to have a quiet dinner. It is a hotel restaurant. It is big and it was perfect considering it was around 10 and wanted somewhere quite.
We had a very pleasant Saturday luncheon here.
A quaint French-inspired cafe. The food was okay. The service was good as was the ambience.

column4: 233 West Santa Clara St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Enjoyed our dinner! Food was great. We started with the Artisian Cheese plate. I had the fettuccine smoked chicken, My wife had the swordfish. It was wonderful.
great when you want a quiet, elegant restaurant near ACT.
as always, the food and service was great!
a very good experience closed to the freeway, very good service, we said we was in a hurry have had quick service. raviolis to be recommended. we will be back

This was my 3rd visit. This time we brought our kids (12 & 15). They enjoyed it as well. The service was excellent. They have large back room that is very nicely decorated and looks to be a great place for large parties.

column1: The Lake Chalet Seafood Bar & Grill
column13: Lake Chalet is a great place for adults to take their parents for dinner who are visiting from out of town for special occasions. We went for the Dungeness crab on the menu. It was cooked perfectly. I would have enjoyed slightly more refined condiments than cocktail sauce and horseradish sauce with the crab. I recommend that crab be served with a house-made mayonnaise and/or aioli.The bread (epee) was wonderful. Perfect compliment with the crab.
Everything went well, except some piece of wire was found in our lobster meal.We got "soory" and no charge for this dish.I was expected to have this dish replaced as well...

Really excellent meal--I was surprised at just how good it was. Very generous portions, too. Service was very prompt and attentive without being intrusive. Great atmosphere. Nice neighborhood spot. I'll definitely be back!

Lark Creek Blue was our choice for Thanksgiving Dinner and we were not disappointed. The menu was a pre-fix one but WOW is all I can say. We ate inside rather than outside, and the atmosphere was festive and energetic for sure. The restaurant is small and the tables are a little close together but it didn't stop us from having a great time. I would not recommend this for younger children, especially in the evening. The food was great, between the five of us we had everything on the menu including the lobster dinner, the thanksgiving dinner and the prime cut. Even though there was no chocolate on the menu for dessert (my sister is a chocoholic as well as myself) they came up with a fantastic dessert for us from the back.

column4: 845 Market Street - 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Business meeting. Very happy with restaurant choice. We will return.
Great way to spend a Thanksgiving!

column4: 452 First Street East, Suite H Sonoma, CA  95476
column13: We focused on the starters as they were the most interesting to us. We started with the beet salad which was perfectly balanced with a fresh fried cheese ball. The mussels were excellent and we did not want to give up the sauce. We just kept soaking it up with the bread. I enjoyed the sardines but my friend was a bit confused on how to deal with a large whole sardine. By the time the scallops arrived I was already full but they were too yummy to pass up. We also shared both the red and white Portugese wine sampler. I did not love every wine but it was fun and educational. The service was just right. Attentive but not suffocating. I look forward to my next visit.

column1: Laurel Court Restaurant & Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
column13: Lovely for tea with relatives and friends-a real treat!
Nice restaurant, very knowledgeable waitstaff

column4: 898 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Probably not fair to rate a restaurant on Thanksgiving day...prime rib was lukewarm and salty. The sodes looked as though theyd had a long day sitting around. Staff was very nice ....but our waiter had very bad breath...which makes it difficult to enjoy your meal...as he leans over u pouring water. I might try a steak at the bar next !!!
Service was slow (even for a French restaurant) and none of the dishes were stand outs. There are better french restaurants in SF in the same price range -- Garcon, Chez Papa/Chez Mama to name a few.

This Asian-French fusion restaurant is among those in San Francisco you want to return to often. The food is innovative and excellently prepared, and the service is especially intelligent and welcoming. The menu is truly thoughtful and adventurous with prices moderate.

The restaurant is located on the third floor open to the mezzanine. The ambience would of been better if they would dim the lighting a bit, it was a little too bright. We went for Thanksgiving dinner. The butternut squash bisque was excellent, turkey was good, vegtables were under cooked and bland. Overall it was an OK experience.
Little Star has been a fantastic find, especially the cornmeal crust for their pizzas! We drive a long way just to go there. Thanks!

I go here for the quality of the fish -- delicious, fresh, succulent. I usually order from the daily special board, but if I take my kids they'll get whatever sushi roll and agadashi tofu and are happy. Last time I happened to try the grilled calamari, dusted with chili--the sweetness of the calamari lingered long into the night. Yum.
I had a group of 9 that Local Kitchen was able to seat in a private dinning room for my birthday. I couldn't have been happier with the whole night.
Really wonderful, thoughtful, fresh ,beautifully presented comfort food without any pretense.The chefs are putting their hearts into their work.

Incredible! Among the best and most unusual meals I've ever had. Each dish had some sort of surprise, but nothing gimmicky: just truly original and inspired combinations of flavor and texture. I strongly dislike cauliflower, but their salad of it was a true hit for me. Just... wow. Pricey but worth it.

Unfortunately not a good overall experience. Our dining experience began with a waiter that seemed to care less whether or not we were there, he kept looking everywhere else but at our table. Out of the three meals ordered, the rib eye was the best, tasty and well presented. Don't order the lasagna, it was presented as a big blob on a plate with no other greens etc...

Excellent food and service for my 3rd experience. Waiter is extremely friendly and well educated on their wines and food. He gave fantastic suggestions. Request back area seating, cute and the front of the restaurant can be a little misleading. They also serve late night tapas until 11ish. Just what Pleasanton needs.

We had to wait despite our reservation for 20min after reservation time, which is a little bit annoying, since I even had to commit by giving my credit card information. But then we got a cute corner table and we were very happy with the Thanksgiving dinner and the service.

column4: 2825 Sand Hill Road Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: We had a wonderful post-Thanksgiving meal at Madera. The dining room is beautiful. The service people are knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. We immediately felt at home and had no doubt we would be well cared for. Roast squid with olives, tiny potatoes and arugula puree was one of the best such appetizers I have ever eaten. My wife and friend both had sturgeon and thought it was perfectly prepared. The beignets for dessert were light and addictive, better than those in New Orleans. We had Peleirin Pinot Noir by the glass, hard to find such a good wine 'by the glass'. All in all, a very satisifying evening.

We've been to Madrona Manor before for Thanksgiving and have always enjoyed not only the food but the ambiance. The service is excellent and the chef always creates a special wine pairing to go with the course so that is a real treat.

column4: 555 Golden Gate Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: We arrived early for our 6 pm reservation, hoping to enjoy the bar scene. Instead we were immediately seated at our table and pressured into ordering quickly. It soon became apparent why: at 6 pm the whole area filled up and the one waiter could hardly keep up although he tried. Food was good but not great; prices were fair for what we got: lots of food.

column4: 3055 Olin Avenue, Suite 1000 Suite 1000 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: The food was great and abundant as always. The service was a little quick. I don't like getting my entre when I am still enjoying my appetizer. i love the free pasta to go. It makes the experience last and I don't have to cook for two nights. Great deal with Mario's plan for two.
This is a wonderful little restaurant and I always love visiting it.
They did not even have my reservation

We always enjoy our Mamacita meals and it's a great place to take out-of-town guests. We had a 7 year old, 5 year old and 2 year old with us and the waitress was very mindful of their limited attention span and brought the food out promptly and provided sources of entertainment throughout the meal. Great experience all around.

The food is wonderful. Sadly the ambiance is poor - we were in the back room and very cramped. The noise factor was bad - had to strain to listen and almost shout to be heard by people at the same table. The owners and waitress are very friendly and welcoming. A great place if you go early before it fills up. Again, the food is excellent. I would recommend with certain reservations, i.e. noise, cramped space, lack of ambiance.

We've been to Mandaloun several times and never had a bad meal. I had the Lamb Shank and my wife had the short ribs. The Polenta in Bolognaise small plate is one of our favorites. I don't put salt on anything, so I am more sensitive than most, I would recommend they back off a little and let diners add salt to their taste.
Excellent service and delicious food - can't go wrong with that combo!
We had a lovely meal, went early so the restaurant was quiet, and particularly liked the pasta with the caramelized onions and chicken. Tasted homemade!

column4: Pier 39, Fisherman"s Wharf San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: Went to Pier 39 to get seafood. Only place I could get a table was Mango's. They ran out of the marlin. Service was very slow and noisy. Not the best mexican food, but not terrible either.

The service was excellent and the food was great (we had the tasting menu with wine pairing). But the cost was too high. Last year we had dinner at Michael Mina in San Francisco and had the tasting menu with wine pairing. The food was a bit better at Michael Mina and the cost was about 2/3 that of Manresa. So we can't recommend Manresa at their current prices. Great food and service, but not worth the price in our opinion.

Liked the comfortable dining room,but when we arrived at 5.30pm there was an old smell about the place this turned us of ,after the place started to fill and the food was coming out the smell did seem to dissapear.Service was friendly and our waiter was well informed about the wines and the food was excellent. We both felt a little rushed through out the whole meal we like to take our time and relax but as soon as we finished our meal the dessert menu was immediately placed in front of us .But again the food and wine was excellent,probably would not go back.

column4: 218 Sir Francis Drake Boulevard San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: Always a treasure - we have never had a negative experience here.

Even though I had reservations, our party of four had to wait about 20 minutes at least to be seated. It was difficult to wait because there was hardly any place to stand and there were other people waiting too. When we were seated they forgot to give us all a menu and we had to get up and get our own. The service was a bit sporadic at first but eventually smoothed out and we had a nice lunch. It was, however, quite loud. It should also be noted that it was the day after Thanksgiving and there were many tourists out and it was busy in town just in general.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The only negative is that my capuccino was brought to the table luke warm. The food was fabulous and the service was excellent. A really perfect place to go after a show (or before) at the Orpheum. Too bad it is located on the sketch part of Market Street. I hope some day a developer will revitalize that part of SF.

This is my fourth (and final trip) to this restaurant. The food here has gone from mediocre to bad (portion size and taste) and the service is reliably surly and slow. This latest trip we had a clueless waiter who made us wait at least 10 minutes for anything we needed, including the bill. No bread ever arrived. The salad was so drowning in dressing that you could not taste the vegetables. And the entree was the saltiest fish I have ever tasted served over sloppy, soggy, salty chard. The portion size was so small that I ended up fixing my guests a peanut butter sandwich when we returned from the restaurant.
As always their soup is great. Pumpkin soup that was just so comforting.
Great pizzas and decent menu items otherwise.

Had a little bit of a rough start with a rude hostess, but it was all fixed in the end. I think she was just overwhelmed with the huge crowd of people that were there. She seemed to feel really bad about the way she acted.

The meal and service were OK. Nothing special. Two days later I can't even remember what we ordered. Selected as it was convenient to the theater. No complaints, but there are many other Walnut Creek offerings I would prefer.

column4: 5200 Mowry Avenue Suite M Fremont, CA  94538
column13: Thanksgiving dinner was fabulous! The turkey was excellent and the accompaniments were just as good. My son had prime rib and raved about it. The service was outstanding as well.
This resturant caters to tourist and not locals. Nobody would visit it for a second time. Our waiter mike was extremely rude. My folks live in Healdsburg and will never go back to this place

column4: 2323 Van Ness Ave. San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: We do not live in San Francisco, but when we are in town we make it a point to have dinner at the Matterhorn. The food is always delicious and the service is attentive. The fondue is reminiscent of our times spent in Switzerland. Bridget the owner has always been on hand to welcome us and is truly interested in making our visit enjoyable. We highly recommend the apple strudel for dessert.
Amazing brunch. Lobster bread pudding benedict and banana pancakes were unlike anything I'd ever had before. Delicious.

column4: 2015 Crow Canyon Pl. San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: Good diner eats with everything you would expect--hash, meatloaf, breakfast served all day, and a great rueben sandwich. Easy, comfortable place, and handled a crowd of 12 without issue.

column4: 601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Max's Opera Cafe is 3 blocks from the San Francisco War Memorial Opera House, by the Civic Center. It was a very good place to go for dinner before the opera. The prices were very reasonable. The food was delicious and they had a nice selection to choose from the menu. Service was excellent. It was a little noisy but expected due to a full house on a Saturday night. I recommend getting a reservation. With a reservation we were seated promptly. Food was served quickly, was very hot, large portions & delicious. This isn't a white table linen place but it was very clean & the staff was very attentive. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
I have been to many Persian restaurants, and this one is in the top two.

column1: Mayo Reserve Room - Mayo Family Winery
column13: Fabulous experience. This was our second time to come to this wonderful food and wine paring and we loved it again.

column4: 900 North Point Street at Ghirardelli Square San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: I have been to this restaurant multiple times. This visit was just ok at best. Our table was in the back room which was like Being in Siberia. I had the scallop special which had some lime oil thing around the circumference of the plate. It was way too much oil for the dish. Scallops were cooked nicely and tasted good but the overall dish was just ok.

column4: 170 South Market Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation. I mentioned to the hostess that I had made a reservation through OpenTable but she missed that. It was a busy night and service was slow. We asked for bread long after we had received our salads. When asked if the restaurant provided bread, server said only when asked for. That seemed chintzy to me. Took a long time, over one hour, for the main course. Worried about being late for a concert, I finally got up and found our server and expressed my angst. She then brought out the food which was hot and tasty. But she was preoccupied on other customers. I would go back but not on such a busy night. My wife and I both had seafood dishes which were good.

This was our second visit. Both were very enjoyable. Excellent service and very good food in a fairly elegant setting. We enjoyed being pampered a bit. This was a birthday dinner, and the waitress took note of that. Nice.

This was our second time in two year, decided to give it another try and maybe it improved. It did not. We will not be back. For being a steak house the meat my husband got was super fatty and chewy. My filet was overdone and the salmon portion was very tiny. The best part was the veggie pizza and baked potato. The restaurant had 4 tables with customers, at 700pm and the lighting was so bright it was like being under a spotlight. They also reuse the condiment tray for the baked potatoe so it makes the rounds from table to table picking up everones germs and sits on the counter not refrigerated with sour cream in it. The expensive cocktails have very little alcohol in them. Do not waste your money or time.

Very tasty and flavorful menu. We ordered three different dishes and each was exceptionally good. Good levels of spice, not made bland for a typical American palate. Reasonably priced. Would definitely go here again.

column4: 536 Golden Gate Ave San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Some of the best indian food in the city!

column4: 2 N B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Go if you want fondue or dinner to last over 3 hours. Very dark, slow service, average food.

column4: 125 E. Sir Francis Drake Blvd Larkspur, CA  94939
column13: Everything was very well done. I would say that the four course meal is a great way to experience the Melting Pot for the first time but it is a lot of food. The next time we will probably do two courses instead of stuffing ourselves. The Larkspur location is special due to the beutiful historic brick kiln that it is in.

The father and daughter team bend over backwards to make one's dining experience a good one. All the food is prepared in house. The service is impeccable and they are both very gracious and accommodating. Good food, good Margaritas, and good service. And . . . reasonably priced. You can't go wrong!!

column4: 41 East Gish Rd. San Jose, CA  95112
column13: Service was great! Food was great! Overall a GREAT experience for a team dinner. One ding - the restaurant had a musty smell. Still I would go back again! Overall this was a great place.The belly dancer was great as well. She was classy and it made for a fun evening.

column4: 1029 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Good food good serviceGreat music

A wonderful buffet brunch in a grand historic hotel overlooking San Franciso and both bridges. Mounds of crab claws and shrimp and the prime rib was excellent. The service was attendant and delightful. What a find! We'll be back .

I was very dissapointed with the food and would not go back. The lobster bisque was barely warm, the salad was so cold it must have just come out of the fridge and the eggplant terrine did not taste fresh.
Fantastic food and service, perfect way to spend Thanksgiving Day.

column4: 459 Prospect Way Half Moon Bay, CA  94038
column13: The seafood dishes were incredibly fresh and good. Will definitely go back again.

Burger was ordered medium, it came out well done on a grocery store style bun. Service was off all night. The server checked in on the food after my burger was gone. Ordering hot coffee after dinner took three tries to get it right. The second attempt came with bright red lipstick on the cup. I rarely go to a full service restaurant anymore. This experience was a disappointment.
As always, the service was great as well as the food!
We went to there Thanksgiving dinner. It was a bit overpriced, but the food and service was very good. Would like to come back to try there regular menu.

column4: 131 Mirada Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Wonderful food, view and service. The crab salad was fabulous.

I went with a group for a birthday dinner. We had a good time and the food was pretty good. However, when we asked for the leftovers to be boxed, the manager - not out waitress - took our plates and our food was dumped. They offered a free drink for the inconvenience, but when I complained that over half of my $25 jambalaya was dumped, he comped the meal.

Excellent food and service far exceeding our expectations for a small neighborhood restaurant.Ashley provided us with the best service of any of the great restaurants we ate at during our 4 days in SF.The best food!

column1: Mission Grille - Marriott Downtown San Francisco
column13: I have to say that this was a Thanksgiving dinner and I understand it was a super busy day. The crew at the entrance of the restaurant were very kind and I appreciate the effort on that due to the many people that were waiting to get it. We pay at front bcs it was a buffet menu. My only complain is that the waitress who supposedly was in charge of our table, which name is Brenda, only served us once. We had to ask four times to a different waiters to refill our coffees. That was the only thing that make our dinner unpleasant .

column4: 817 Terry Francois Blvd. San Francisco, CA  94158
column13: Delicious food. We had seafood and burgers and both were excellent. Wonderful oysters. Anthony at the oyster bar is great. The bay a pearly blue with pelicans flying by. Server was helpful and timely. And we didn't have to shout to hear each other. Relaxing. Then we'd hear the bar go nuts when a touchdown was made. Nice that they have different spaces for a choice of dining experiences. We'll be back.

column4: 325 Sharon Park Drive, Suite A2 Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Great food, very attentive staff, quick and efficient service.
good food at a very reasonable price

column4: 1035 S. Winchester Blvd San Jose, CA  95128
column13: The food here is just excellent, probably the best Japanese in West San Jose. The unagi sashimi and all the rolls are great, although the rolls with a fried component are too heavy for my taste.
The owner knew it was our first time at his restaurant and he made us feel very welcomed. Lovely seasoned dishes and the best pomogranite margaritas ever!

Think 4+ rating (We've eaten at some of the best, so we don't give 5's lightly). We will eat here more, and the pricing was ok for the food level & location. Savory dishes/appetizers were excellent to superb (also the good,casual service/atmosphere). This was a last minute choice, so we had modest expectations (especially when you go to a TV chef's place), but we were impressed. My only critique would be the enticing desserts didn't quite deliver (execution was just ok with some good points). If you love the old dubbed/subtitled Iron Chef, you will love Morimoto's playfulness & style, but the flavor does deliver, BIG. Morimoto is definitely legit, so don't hesitate to try for a drink/nosh or a full meal. Seafood/Sushi/Pork Belly A+.

We've been coming here for years and Morton's consistently delivers the best steaks in the city. It is "Old San Francisco," provided you are seated downstairs where it is much quieter, clubby, and comfortable. The wait staff is friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Try to save room (doggie bag) for one of the terrific deserts. Just bring your deed. This is deffinitely a special occassion establishment.

We were there on a Saturday night when Tom Jackman was playing guitar. He was wonderful. We really enjoyed listening to him. Unfortunately, the food was not quite as good as the entertainment. The braised ribs were a little fatty indicating they hadn't been cooked long enough. The lobster special was interesting... The lobster was perfectly cooked, but layering it with pear and wrapping it in puff pastry doesn't make it "stuffed." The sauce with the lobster made the puff pastry soggy. The whole thing didn't work well together. (Only 2 stars for dinner.)We have also had Sunday brunch at Morty's and every item was delicious. I highly recommend Sunday brunch. (4 stars for brunch.)
Great weekend brunch. Always nice to set out on the patio for the view before eating. And the service is always top notch. Even dog friendly.

column4: 55 Music Concourse Drive San Francisco, CA  94118
column13: Across from the DeYoung, located in the Academy of Science, this is a great room loaded with ambiance.

The atmosphere is really fun and funky and the cocktails were amazing. The menu is extensive and I wanted everything - the Mussels were fabulous, calamari, brussel sprouts, all the desserts. The wait staff was great and the food comes out fast. The only issue was our mains came out before we finished our apps. Will definitely go back again and again.

Food was great -starters of oysters,mussles and burrata were excellent, but we had to ask for enough extra plates to share. Entrees all perfectly prepared - quail my fav but trout, duck, bavette all great and bouillabaisse more ordinary but good -had to ask for the spoon/cktl fork and bowl for shells. Service was excrutiatingly slow/forgetful and pooly paced with lots of miscommunication, for example, I brought a really nice bottle of champagne - handed it to the hostess on arrival being very specific that it was a surprise to be opened asap after we were seated to celebrate an engagement - server instead waited 10 min then brought empty champagne glasses over asking each person if they were having champagne - totally ruined the surprise

Ian was an excellent waiter and was very helpful with wine suggestions. He was willing to accommodate you with your request and was very friendly and nice. Jordan greeting us was also excellent as our first experience. The portions were ample and liked that you got your meat/fish with a side order included. It turly is a family style restaurant.
Overall good. Thumbs up on the seafood tostada. Smiling service.
The Mynt is my favorite Indian restaurant. The main dishes are excellent. Deserts are so-so.

Outdoor dining ambience w folding tables and airplanes roaring by we're badly romantic. Inside ambience with running water n soft lighting more so. Food very good tasty and well prepared. Service very attentive.

column4: 1201 San Carlos Avenue San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: enjoyed our first time, food was wonderful
It was so dark we couldn't read the menu!
The staff was so so nice and engaging. We decided to sit at the bar and were treated to many tastings and amazing apps. This may be my new favorite place!

We are from San Francisco and had an evening to spend around Hayward after dropping of our kids at a show. We decided to have a nice dinner and chose this place. Very intimate quiet setting although the service was slow. To be fair there was exactly one person hosting, waiting tables, bussing on a Friday night!The food was surprisingly good. We did have fairly simple fair like clams, ribeye on scalloped potatoes, whole snapper but the portions were generous (compared with the city) and flavors delicious. We skipped dessert so cannot comment. The wine list is reasonably priced and the pinot noir we had by the glass very drinkable.

Food choices were excellent and tasted very fresh (especially the naan breads!) Tandoori and curries dishes were flavorful and properly portioned. Meat was tender and plentiful. We had a good food experience but the service was a bit slow and somewhat disorganized.
Great place to get away to. A bit of a drive, but you can stay in one of the cottages for a romantic night away.
we love this place...a "neighborhood gem" worth leaving your neighborhood for...
We were very impressed with the food and great service we received, great gumbo and BBQ shrimp and grits, very delicious! Everybody was very friendly and helpful!

We had the first seating at 6pm. The alcove in the front of the second room fit the seven of us perfectly with street views and away from traffic. We all had the seven-course kaiseki meal with the nuances of flavors including the amuse bouche of yuzu foam with marigold petal, uni custard, the sashimi, grilled beef tongue and fried pig's ear, the beet and watermelon radish salad, the oxtail donburi with poached egg and ending with a plum ice cream with crispy, salty rice puffs. The portions are very small, so we added the seafood and pork belly ramens and the tan tan mian. The broths of both ramen dishes were very salty and disappointing. Do not go if you have a big appetite or starved, you will still be hungry. Lots of sake choices.

First time to Nonni's Bistro. It was a wonderful experience. Greeted by Chef Magnusson and seated at a very nice table. Service was equally as good. We ordered the flatbread with smoked salmon and it was delicious. Also tried the Beef Stroganoff. Wonderful flavors and also very delicious. We will be back not only for the flatbread and the Beef Stroganoff but also to try more on their menu.
Had a very nice dinner and will be back. Very accommodating to our special requests, which was great.

Food was good , but the servers were outstanding. It is refreshing to see young hard working people who enjoy what they do. The late night hours encourages people to enjoy the City. The neighborhood has been improved by this business.

column4: 550 Stanford Shopping Center Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: They appeared to be attempting to set a record for how many mistakes they could make on a single salad. It was supposed to be the grilled chicken caesar salad, lightly dressed, with no parmesan cheese and no cheese crisps, lightly dressed. It arrived soggy with dressing, with no chicken, but WITH parmesan cheese and cheese crisps. They did correct the order, mostly, and they took the salad off the bill. The other entree was done correctly the first time.

The people at North Beach were fantastic for my family party on Friday night. We received a wonderful variety of great Italian dishes and everyone loved it. We had theatre reservations and they were great at getting everything out to us in a timely manner so we could casually enjoy all this amazing food and still make it to the Orpheum in plenty of time. Thank you very much

column4: 475 E. Strawberry Drive Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: My first time there. I was very pleased with the whole experience !

Nova is just around the corner from our apartment, so we drop in frequently because they have good comfort food basics, the booths are comfortable, it is usually fairly quiet and the service people are friendly. They have good marguerites and cosmos (for my wife) and they are one of the few bars that stocks Talisker single malt Scotch. An excellent combination of features. We made a reservation with out of town guests because everywhere was jammed (game 4 of the World Series and just two blocks from AT&T Park). We got there at 7 pm (7th inning?) and the placed was jammed to the gunnels. Still, the waitress acknowledged our reservation and had a table almost ready. We got drinks and food despite the incredible mob.

column4: 524 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Although the food was good, and the service fine, the restaurant was very noisy with the big screen TV's and a game going in the the bar. the decor is kind of stark and cold.

column1: The Oak Room - The Westin St. Francis
column13: Awesome experience. Waiter was exceptional and read my mind! Food was outstanding. Entire staff friendly. Recommend the Oak Room for any special occasion!

This was our second visit. We brought another couple with us that had heard of it from others. Each entree was great and cooked as requested. We shared the warm toffee nut cake that was recommended and it was fantastic, we fought over the last bite.

column4: 17500 Depot Street, Suite 180 Morgan Hill, CA  95037
column13: We had dinner here the nite before and came back for lunch the next day. We had 7 in our party and ordered pizzas to share. We had appetizers and soup of the day. Everything was divine. We will be back again soon with friends. Great find in our own city that was recommended by a friend in SF. Excellent fresh wood fire pizza! Definitely a foodie place! Delight your taste buds and have the octopus. ;)
Our server was very friendly and attentive
Food used to be excellent but has really dlipped.Used to be our go to place as setting ambience locationAre perfect.
Hip spot with great food. Love the big booths for brunch.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This was a fun experience and the staff made sure that we knew what to expect.

column4: 2855 Stevens Creek Blvd Westfield Shopping Mall San Jose, CA  95128
column13: We love eating here! Service is great, though it can get quite busy. LOVE the food! I can't say enough about Oryza! I've gone with the kids and on date night this visit. Seating can be a bit crowded and squished, and I didn't like being sat in the middle of bar traffic and dining room traffic. Pleasant and helpful servers and staff make you forget you're at the mall.

column4: 139 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Excellent food and good wine list. Great for a Birthday celebration.

Excellent food. Server got our order wrong and we waited far too long for wine glasses to drink a wine that was opened and waiting!! To house's credit the mistakes were recognized and we received complimentary desserts.
We hadn't been here in awhile. They serve very good Mexican Food. Huge portions, but we would have preferred a smaller plate. Loved their Margarita's! We will be back.

column4: 1606 North Main St. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Food was excellent. Service was a bit sketchy. Maybe it was to crowded for the wait staff. We felt overlooked and were never asked if we wanted wine with our dinner.
When there isn't an event at AT&T, this is a nice quiet neighborhood eatery. Lately my favorite dish has been the Southern Style Pad Ped.
Great food, everyone is real friendly. Will go back for sure..
I was in SF for a bridge tournament. A local highly recommended Ozumo so I decided to check it out. He was right.

column4: 1875 S. Bascom Ave #550 Campbell Campbell, CA  95008
column13: Whenever we're looking for something better than the usual stand-bys we're always reminded of our local seafood gem of a restaurant. We love the selection, organic food, and the fact that they seem to reserve the area in the back for kiddies which makes it comfortable for our family. The specials are elegant, the regular menu is consistently good, and the kiddie meal options are the best we've ever seen. And the seafood and produce are fresh, fresh, fresh!

column4: 133 Corte Madera Town Center Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: Getting rather expensive as the food and service decline. A return visit is doubtful.

I'm actually a native here and live in the neighborhood as well. I LOVE this place! I love the food and the prices are so reasonable for seafood. It was one of my closest friends' birthday and I happen to mention it to the waiter (who is awesome) and he brought our dessert with a candle and said it was on the house. That was so nice and was very appreciated! For me, the best way to tell about a restaruants seafood is the freshness, especially the poke or ceviche dishes. OUTSTANDING! The chips were perfect and we talked about coming back very soon--and my tacos were the best. Being a local and native, there are tons of taco places but I must say their seafood and the steak tacos were probably my most favorite. I have a will stay a regular!

column4: 115 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: While the bar scene is vibrant, it is much too noisy for the diners who must shout to be heard during dinner. Definitely need a partition to separate bar from dining.We would only return if the weather was such that we could eat outside.
My only complaint would have to be the noise level. About half way through our meal a live jazz band began playing extremely loud music and made our previously enjoyable meal a very unpleasant one.
I would recommend this restaurant to all my friends. And I can't wait to go back.

We have loved this restaurant for lunch, but this was our first time for brunch. Wow! The crab cake eggs Benedict and the colcannon were both outstanding. The service is attentive but not intruding. we stayed a long time and enjoyed it all. try the make your own mimosas!

There was barely anyone at Panta Rei when we arrived, but that spoke nothing of the great food it has to offer. Went for a business lunch on a beautiful day - the outdoor seating is simple, but offers some great people watching in North Beach.

column4: 333 West San Carlos Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: great food, ambiance, fine service, top notch
Fantastic vegetarian/vegan option; delicious!
I always enjoy dining at Paradisio!

Altering their menu decreased the selection and quality of choices. Had to wait for billing process to be completed yet the restaurant was less than half filled. Has taken on the aura of a restaurant in decline, losing badly to its more popular neighbor.

Parcel 104 offered a prix-fixe set menu and price for Thanksgiving @ $50 per person. The sweet pumpkin soup was fabulous. The turkey dinner with tractional sides was fair, but not exceptional. Dessert, a single pie serving, while tasty, was a tiny portion. However, my request to have small tastes of all three pie choices was honored graciously. Service was attentive, friendly and on point. The ambiance is upscale, but a bit stodgy. Not a very lively scene, and the room was more than two thirds empty. I don't think I would spring for $50 per person again for this type of menu. It did not highlight the chef's talents with local produce and innovative recipes.

I understand that the selling point of the $27.50 brunch buffect is bottomless champagne. However, I do hope the restaurant can offer alternative drink choices in lieu of the champagne. Charging customers $8 for a cup of coffee is outrageous.
Copious servings of OK food at a relatively decent price.

column4: 1991 W El Camino Real Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: My wife and I had dinner at Passage to India for the first time. We were immediately seated, and a waiter came within a minute and took our initial drink order. My wife and I both ordered the buffuet, which was good (not excellent) with the exception of the goat which was outstanding! We both enjoyed the food choices and flavors - we really enjoyed the Garlic Naan. Definitely a place we'll come back to.

column4: 315 Main St. Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Fabulous as always! LOVE the lasagna! Great for lunch or dinner. Wonderful staff who is pleasant to everyone. Pasta Moon will continue to be on the top of our list.

column4: 3124 Crow Canyon Place San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: Have been going here for over twenty years and never ever disappointed. It is our special occassions restaurant and for those nights we need a quiet get away where we can talk, eat wonderful food, drink great wine, have attentive service with little special surprizes.

It was nice that the Owner/Manager walks around the restaurant and makes sure that the guests are happy. Food was excellent, all our our meat selections were cooked to perfection. Our waiter wasn't quite as friendly as we would like and she was unable/willing to assist on menu recommendations. A nice touch was the 20% off our next visit that was presented upon our exit.

I took my brother for his 1st stripclub expirience, he fell inlove. Food was great service was nice but not familiar w menu. I was told they lost power and most of there food was spoiled including all the Kobe which I was looking forwards too.
Good food and good service, very friendly people.

The salumi misti was out of this world . . . the small plate perfect for two people to share and savor. Every bite was delicious, from beginning to end. On a Friday night the place was packed like sardines, so do make a reservation. The butternut squash raviora was heavenly. The herb-crusted beef short ribs wereso tender and melt-in-your-mouth divine! This is not your ordinary Italian restaurant . . . it harkens back to real Italy.

Wonderful. So glad they were open Thanksgiving. And the staff seemed to enjoy being there and that made the experience more enjoyable. Food was as delicious as usual.So Thankful For Perry's on holidays!

I have been dining at Perry's since I moved to SF 45 years ago. It's a consistant'stable' place to go. Food remains of high quality; staff are welcoming; service is quick but not pushy; they allow you time to chat & choose your meal.
GREAT FOOD AND GOOD SERVICE, KUDOS TO THE TWO ASIAN WAITERS THAT SERVICED US.
Loved it, needed vegan options and there were plenty as well as amazing pizza and meat options...

The fried calamari was perfect---tender, crispy, with a light, almost tempura-like coating. I asked for a side of cole slaw, which was not listed on the menu (but they did have cole slaw listed with other dishes) and it too was delicious. Just thinking about it today makes me want to go back and order the same thing again !
Wonderful wait staff; giving privacy with service at the same time. Lovely ambiance.
1. When I called for reservations I was told that dinner would be 25 or 26 $. It was 30. Food was almost cold. Over priced.Server did a good job.

A wonderful meal..Eclectic....pizza...(perfect crust), shared pasta (bolognese) AND ahi tuna to please any palate....Quiet on the patio away from the noise of the main dining area...service attentive yet subtleA most pleasant evening...thank you

Authentic Italian food and staff and ambiance. Reminded me of being in Italy. Excellent lobster ravioli in tomato cream sauce. Wish they had more wine by the glass selection, but otherwise great experience
Brunch not as good as lunch on my previous visit. Server pleasant but forgot some dishes.

Always mildly amused when I enter the restaurant. It is as if I walk out of an arousing urbanized existence and then seamlessly launched into an adaptation of, "The Stepford Wives". The patrons tend to be plastic and proud and the waitstaff, at times, displays a certain hostility. Presumably, the staff has its fair share of lordliness with which to deal; but for the price to be entertained at Picco, one would think the staff would be better equipped. The food, however, is the most interesting and memorable part of the evening. It is the simplicity of the fresh Kampachi and the variation of the risotto that keeps me coming back. The cocktails once outstanding, but as of late syrupy. Despite it all...did I mention the delicious cuisine?
Secluded location -in an intimate but vibrant atmosphere. Our second visit was as good as our first. We'll be back!

column4: Pier 3, The Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Friendly people and good tasting food.

Had the bean soup, good but very salty, the scallops, way too much spinach and capers, and the panna cotta, where they obtained peaches to grill and strawberries that were "fresh & locally sourced" is a concern because the peaches were hard as rocks and both peaches and strawberries were tasteless.
Celebrated my wifes birthday here staff were fab food spot on a view to remember table near the window with Alcatrz view, top night great staff will deffo go again when in town. Steve from UK
Our family celebrated my daughter's 21st Birthday and we had a memorable experience at the Plaza Bistro! We definetely will go back again! Sincerely, Katerina

I've been a pretty faithful customer of Poesia since it opened several years ago. Unlike many restaurants that don't seem to maintain a good standard of food or a diversity of options, Poesia has consistently maintained high standards of food and a diverse, often changing menu. I have always had great meals at Poesia and I highly recommend this restaurant.
Interesting menu. Fish skin was charred, although it was deboned at the table in a competent manner.. House-made pasta tough. Plleasant setting.
Overall experience was great the hostest was excellent I came out for my birthday and I was not dissaspointed great foid drinks

column1: Porter's Restaurant - Poppy Ridge Golf Course
column13: Loved the quite, peaceful view. Food was excellent but the service was poor. I would wait a while before returning to this lovely spot until the service may get better.
great local place if you are in the redwood city area

We had a wonderful meal; service was impeccable; we were "troublesome" so she earned her money.Making requests for things off the menu and splitting an entree for an appetizer at a table of four. I'llbe surprised if we're let back in...LOL. Fantastic!! Love the restaurant, staff and food.

column4: 1801 E. Cotati Ave Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Foot tasty, ambiance quite nice, service odd. Delivery of wine and food was not well timed. White wine arrived with first course (crab cakes) a few minutes later while still eating the crab cakes, the red wine was delivered ahead of the 2nd course. Within five minutes of that course arriving, while I was still eating and had plenty of food on the plate, I was asked if I was ready for the desert menu. Server was vrery nice and wanted to please but needs more practice with timin.
Amaizing place. exellent service but this time the french toast was dry. but we will be there again for sure.

The chips are fabulous! Very different than your normal tortilla chip. It always seems to be too busy at dinner time though, the servers seem like they are spread too thin and don't have enough people on the floor. The salads are huge and the only reason I go there.
Attentive staff and great atmosphere. Food was delicious and the ingredients were fresh. Great coffee!

This is a great family restaurant. They really know their food and their cerviche dishes are truly wonderful. Somehow I never seem to get beyond the appetizers as I order a bunch to share, to get the variety of flavors on offer.

My partner and I really loved Radish. Delish, fresh, interesting food and GREAT service; Katie, our server/bartender was friendly and in addition to gave us great tips about the city, in addition to sound suggestions on what to order.
Brunch Chef Michael Ocampo created some amazing brunch dishes...I would definitely recommend brunch here. Everything was unique and very tasty! I will be back!
Finally an ethnic restaurant that can make the food really spicy (and still tasty) if you want it that way.

column4: 7335 Bollinger Road Unit C Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: Had not dined at The Red Crane for a few months, and were quite happy to have returned. New dishes had been added to Royce's signature dishes. All show signs of Royce's creativity and light touch. Always enjoy his Wasabi Caesar Salad and Mushroom Pizza. Added Chicken Gyoza, Crab Bites, Hamachi Sashimi and Miso Glazed Chicken to the mix. Quite a variety! Modest, but well constructed wine list, plus a few sakes we're still learning about.

A little gem at the end of Claremont Ave. Easy parking, great menu and perfect recommendations. Our server suggested bringing the dishes in a family style plate which was great for browsingall of the items in an easy, fun format.

You won't go away hungry. The Red Tavern features many regional specialties from Russia, Bulgaria and even some middle eastern dishes. Food is heavy, but tasty. Not everyday for me, but when in the mood for smoked fish, borscht, stroganoff or dumplings. They do great things with potatoes.
Great food and nice server, but the set up is awkward when walking in and the wait was long, even with reservations.
Great tasting food and excellent service. The ribs were unbelievable, both tender and tasty. The chicken enchiladas were also excellent, as well as the churros y chocolate dessert.

Great location - easy to find. Plenty of large screen TVs good for sports fans. First time dining at The Republic - it was a Tuesday night and fairly empty yet the service was quite slow (15-minutes to get a vodka Martini even though there were no customers at the bar and the bar was 10 ft. away from our table). Perhaps there was a private party elsewhere in the building? Generous portions. Turkey burger was served dry and some condiments (an aioli maybe) would have made for a much more flavorful burger. The salmon on the salmon sandwich was quite fishy tasting. The best part of our dining experience? The french fries. Other than that I would not go out of my way to return.

column4: 303 N Santa Cruz Ave Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: The food was very good however, our Server was not.
Very good food and attentive service - enjoyed it very much.
Exemplary service and food - their Lava cake for dessert was delicious. They even surprised us with a "painted" anniversary surprise.
The service was excellent !! Food was wonderful and good value . No complaints

We enjoy our meals and service each time we dine at Ristorante Bella Vita in Los Altos. It is convenient and off the main street so it is always easy to find parking. The decor and ambiance is always a nice feature. The restaurant is comfortable for both couples and groups, as they are able to accommodate with their separate rooms and one day we plan to make us of their beautiful wine room for a special occasion or party. We invited friends to join us and it is was their first time eating here - they too are from Los Altos but had never giving the restaurant a try - they enjoyed it and will be back!

This was the most disappointing of our many visits to Da Mario. Three of our party of 5 thought that the food was only OK. Two of them had mushroom ravioli and the third a chicken parmigiana. The other two of us thought the food we ordered, veal scallapini and the rockfish special, was very good. The service was very good, as usual. The prices at this restaurant are higher than similar restaurants in Saratoga. The food should be outstanding.
Very professional and personal service, the owner takes the time to give his own personal touch to everything. I will highly recommend it to others as well.

Restorante Milano is a great addition to the Russian Hill (just off Hyde Street) restaurants. Menu was focused on Northern Italian (i.e. Milano) food style and delivered. Overall food and service was excellent and price reasonable for selection. I would recommend it highly to all that love the Russian Hill experience. After dinner, walk back up the hill to Hyde and take the cable car home!

This Emeryville gem is kind of hidden off the street, but the food is well worth the search. To be honest, I chose Riva Cucina for the panna cotta, but I'll be returning for the rest of the menu. The service was excellent, and the help with the wine choice was appreciated.
Sea Bass was slightly overcooked, but still edible.
Rivoli is always a great spot for a romantic dinner!
always good food and good service

The host is always gracious and accomodating; and helps servers when needed. We brouht out of town guests and our party of six had a very enjoyable dinner. Service was excellent and the food was outstanding. We were just here two weeks ago and had the same experience.

AMAZING!!!! From the garlicky oil dip to the succlulect prawns (and there were plenty of them), to the wine and the sandwiches, all fantastic!And fair prices to boot! You will be very happy in this cozy little neighborhoood gem.

A fun place for beer and good American food. Nothing fancy, but tasty and plentiful. If you like beer, they always have a good selection of beers made on the premises. I had a delicious turkey meatloaf, and my husband enjoyed his burger.
We had dinner there last weekend. We enjoyed the casual ambiance but the food was not good. There was something wrong with every dish we ordered. Do they not taste the food they serve there?
2nd time we've been here. Excellent food and service. A welcome departure from the traditional experience.
Consistently top notch food and service; non-pretentious
Great food, great service, delightful place!!

column4: 53 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Still one of the best neigborhood Indian restaurants!

column1: The Rotunda at Neiman Marcus - San Francisco
column13: Great place for a girlfriend lunch. Beautiful, with great food and service. Pricey, but hey, everyone needs a little treat once in a while.
Food and portions are decent for the price.
the food and service were excellent.
The lamb skewer and beet salad were fantastic. Excellent service and decor. The entree's were good but not great. I think I will return for a second chance as our experience their was great.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
column4: 1601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Hands down, the best fillet I've ever had and the shrimp was perfect. Celebrating a friend's birthday was our special occasion and the wait staff made it very memorable in discrete sophisticated way.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Walnut Creek
column4: 1553 Olympic Blvd. Bldg. E Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: I did not receive my points for this reservation. Could you please give them to me?

column4: 1143 San Carlos Ave. San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: The food was delicious - I lived in India and this is great Indian food! We had veg and non-veg dishes and they were all amazing. It arrived piping hot to the table and we had very attentive service. My friends had been here several times but this was my first time and I will definitely go back.

column4: 1075 Sutter Street Hotel Carlton San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: A less than stunning room - sets the tone for something straightforward, not fancy. We trusted our server to guide us to choose what was a wow. The flavors were strong - but we felt it was more show and spice - more than that depth of flavor. Great beer choices.

My all time best restaurant experience! The 18 course menu was thoughtfully planned; courses flowed organically into the next and were perfectly proportioned to leave you nourished and sated yet comfortable. Each dish was a work of art: fresh, tasty and visually arresting. Interesting combinations surprised and delighted me such as a dish called "toffee", a mousse made of duck-liver and white chocolate paired with a Bavarian Lager. Seemingly simple dishes such as a bowl of vegetables eaten with your fingers successfully stood next to more complex preparations of pork, ash and who knows what else! Excellent pairings were served throughout introducing me to wines that I would enjoy with or without food.

Even though we had a reservation, we were seated a half hour late because it was Diwali. The hostess was completely frazzled and did not manage the crowd well. The manager was more in control and settled things down quickly. Food was good, both quality and variety.
Always reliable. Delicious, authentic afghan food in generous portions. A good value.

The only restaurant that has worse service than Salt House is R&G Lounge on Kearny. Tables were placed so tightly some of us were sitting with their backs touching the people at the next table. Didn't help that the five of us were given a table for 4. The waiter took away the Shellfish Plateau tray before we could finish all the oysters. We were given the bill - not in a tray or in a folder, just the piece of paper - while we were still having the dessert. The waitress never once came to check if everything was ok.

I have been a loyal fan of Salute E Vita Ristorante for years. After being away, I was eager to have a meal there. I've now been twice, and both times were a big disappointment. The place was over-crowded and the noise was horrific. We had to wait for over an hour from the time we ordered until our meal came. The second time was for Thanksgiving. The wait staff mixed up our orders and served two of us the wrong meal, we had to ask over and over for water, all the white pieces of turkey were dry as a bone and tasteless, though the dark meat was fine, and again it was so incredibly loud we couldn't talk. It was such a disappointment that I doubt I'll go back. The staff are friendly and the ambiance is lovely - but...

A little nerve-wracking to have to fight the large gulls, but well worth the battle. Picturesque, uniquq to the Bay area, the food, setting and service made this a memorable meal to share with family we don't get to see very often. Fun to watch kayakers come up from the dock to share a meal and warm up, too.

I made the reservation but was the last one to arrive. My friends were so impressed that they were greeted like a VIP and seated right away. The food was always a treat. Some of my friends came to Livermore for the first time. They were pleasantly surprised with the lunch experience and the downtown.

column1: Sant at the Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn
column13: This is a very special place. Loved it!

I had my eye on this restaurant for awhile since I love Greek food, but only recently had the occasion to eat there. It was a pleasant meal but not as traditional Greek as I had hoped. The Greek salad had fresh greens but had few tomatoes or olives and just a sprinking of feta. The gyro meat was delicious and the pita bread was light and tasty. The tsadziki sauce was milder than I like. There were two musicians who quietly played songs to accompany the dinner and I enjoyed that added touch. It's a good place to have a pre-theater meal as long as you aren't expecting it to be a traditional Greek restaurant.

column4: 105 Town and Country Drive Danville, CA  94526
column13: All of the lamb dishes are wonderful. Service is very good and you never feel rushed. Indoor and outdoor dining available. Parking is plentiful.

Very good pasta. Good service. A little hectic for a lunch since a San Mateo women's group was seated on the entire ground floor and seemed intent on shouting over each other. Hut it was a nice place for a sit down lunch.

This restaurant, in a strip mall, has no ambiance at all. However, the food is good, fresh, plentiful, made to order, and reasonably priced. The service is friendly and attentive. This is obviously a family owned and run operation. The people are working hard to provide good fresh food to please their patrons and make a success of their restaurant
I have been there twice now and it's my new favorite place. We had a great server on Black Friday, and they played a fun discount game. The food was absolutely fantastic! Can't wait to go back!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Unfortunately, Sauce has a recurring issue that they need to resolve before I'll be back. When arriving with my group of 7, we noticed that the menu stated that "gratuity included on parties of 6 or more." After paying our check, we were at the stoplight at the end of the street when the server ran down to us apologizing that we hadn't left a tip. When I advised that the menu stated it would be included, she said that the menu stated "gratuity MAY be included." After I added the tip to the receipt on the hood of a nearby car, my party recalled that a Sauce server had done this same exact thing when we were here 6 months ago. This was embarrassing for us and the server. Note to Sauce: Either include the tip or remove the notice on the menu

Since it's a newer place, it looks like they are still working out all kinks due to their popularity. For example, a few false starts with our being seated by a hostess. At the table, we got menus and water quickly, but there was a wait for our order to be taken. Folks around us were having a good time, and we chatted with nearby customers. The brisket was good, but very spicy, not noted on the menu. It cleared the sinuses. The waitress said it was dry rub. My jive turkey was tasty, and moist with the BBQ sauces. The fried Oreos were interesting, would have liked a few more. All in all, a fun place that we would go back to and try sitting outside where it was quieter.

We arrived a few minutes late,but our friends arrived on time and were told that there was no reservation for us, so they left. When I arrived I tried to check in with someone, but nobody understood what Open Table is. There was no manager on duty. The food was less than ok, the polenta was not edible, and the service was ok. The only good part was the really good band.
The price of the food is reasonable for the portion size and quality of food. It is a friendly and relaxed environment.
Excellent place. We just google a good restaurant in the area and we were so delighted. What a surprise! Excellent food, the best Peruvian food we have eaten and we have been on Peru.
We took out of town guests to dinner before a ACT play. The waiter was helpful in suggesting itemss on the menu. Pizzas, risotto, soup,salads...everything was fresh and flavorful.

Very good experience at Scoma's on the night after Thanksgiving. Got seated right away, waitress was quick and attentive and answered any questuions we had. Food was quite excellent, which surprised me for a touristy type of place.

column4: 1333 North California Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Love the ambiance and the live piano music is a special treat. Always good food, too.

I love the holiday spirit when we went there on Nov 26 - the restaurant was decorated for the holidays and all the lights and looking out at the water was very festive and made the evening feel special. The food here is always great - I had the herb-crusted ahi with vegetables and we split the crabcake appetizer - both were delicious and the sauce on the ahi was so amazing we were dipping the crabcakes and bread in it! The server and wait staff was very attentive.
Excellent meal and ,for the most part, good service and ambiance.

column1: Scott's Seafood Mountain View (fka The Cantankerous Fish)
column13: This is a fine, medium-price restaurant, with good food. I'm a true foodie, and it wasn't special, but worked for us when we needed to go out to dinner while visiting Mountain View.
A bit pricey for the small portion sizes, although the food was delicious. Very upscale feel.

We dined in the eve and it was so cold had to keep jacket on and then added my scarf. The risotto was good but luke warm and the beet salad, while once delicious now is mediocre. should go back to their recipe of the beet stack. I have eaten here about 25 times and this was the poorest experience
Food and service were great. It was Thanksgiving and we made our reservation for when it opened so I can only judge what occurred early in the day.
Chicken was dry and overcooked unlike last visit where chicken was delicious. Hope this was a one time event.

column1: Seasons at the Four Seasons Hotel
column4: 757 Market St. Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: We dine at the Seasons for breakfast on a regular basis. All agree, it is our favorite meal of the week. Excellent staff and great food.

Dining at Sens is always an absolute delight. It's very spacious and the food isalways delicious. It's a real treat to introduce anyone who's not been here orfor someone who wants to come again. I have never been disappointd with a meal.
Interesting wine list with some small (and virtually unknown) producers definately worth discovering! Good selection of by the glass wines too.

I have been to Serpentine several times. Even though parking situation can be maddening, the food from this restaurant is worth the trip. The pork sandwich is a favorite of mine. The ingredients used at Sepentine appear to be fresh, local when possible. One can find warmth in their soups on a cold, rainy San Francisco day. This place is a solid lunch option for those able to travel to Dog Patch during the work day.

Wonderful experience at seven hills. It was our anniversary and they gave us a table up front. Smaller plates with each one more delicious than the last. Menu items were reasonably prices and so different and yummy. Wine list interesting and reasonable. Terrific service. Small spot and cozy but a night to remember. Highly recommended.
Very small restaurant, great food, slow service but since the place is so small you can stay the whole evening.

column4: 1080 S. De Anza Blvd. San Jose, CA  95129
column13: My husband and I recently discovered Siam. We loved it. Great food and reasonable prices. We will definitely be back - again, and again!

Everything about Siena Bistro was wonderful from the moment we walked through the door and were greeted by name (we were the only table left to be seated) to the fact that they accommodated our rushed schedule with aplomb and graciousness.
